title: Fast and efficient but crowded
review: The sky train is an excellent way to get around Bangkok without the hassle of the traffic It's track is limited although another line is in the pipeline to be opened   If you purchase a rabbit card this serves as a stored value card similar to the Octopus in Hong Kong and the Oyster Card in London Useful for avoiding the queues for tickets   Stations are well signposted in Thai and English and each platform has a vicinity map which is also bilingual   Tickets have a map of the system on the reverse   This is the first time I have taken the train A friends wife said to me once following a knee replacement how unfriendly the system was as it it virtually devoid of escalators and those that do exist only go up and not down Even from street level there are steps to walk before the escalator so it would be true to say stations are not disabled friendly   Trains are crowded at rush hour but that I Guess is typical of any mass transit system Good value and inexpensive

title: Inconvenient white elephant!
review: The Airport Rail Link sounds like a great idea for sidestepping Bangkok's notorious traffic snarls And indeed it is very fast clean and cheap during the actual 2030minute ride  But that's only part of the story  The Air Rail Link terminal doesn't connect directly to other mass transportation  Instead passengers are dumped at a relatively isolated terminal not very close to most people's final destinations  In most cases passengers will then have to find their way down to the taxi stands and contend with often cranky and abusive taxi drivers (seems the ones around the Airport Rail Link terminal are among the worst in Bangkok)  By the time passengers lug their bags around and get a taxi (plus waiting for the train at the airport) and make their way to their final destinations they probably won't really saved much time or money if any  Moreover the terminal is not particularly "people friendly" with few lifts and the neighborhood around the terminal building is a bit dodgy (I would not comfortably hang out there especially in the evenings)  Finally the trains themselves don't have luggage racks so you have to constantly juggle yourself and control of your bags  Unless you're going to a destination quite close to the Airport Rail Link Terminal do yourself a favor and just take a taxi

review: Love the BTS skytrain because it is convenient and takes you around to tourist attractions It gets pack during rush hour and literally the people push themselves in like sardine But it is cool inside so no need to get annoy to get close to one another   Easy to use the vending machine you see the station names next to the vending machine and remember the number Then on the vending machine press the number for that station or the nearest station and pay the amount in coin using 1bath or 5 or 10 Then the train card comes out If you don't coins you can change on the counter The counter exchange opens from 10am until 5pm (if I remember correcly) The vending machine has English language on it so don't worry   Have a nice ride be cool

title: Needs some pride...
review: The Airport Rail Link is a fantastic step forward for Bangkok's public transport system but nobody seems to take pride in its operations  Unlike the BTS and MRT networks the ARL lacks identity and dedication to service  The Makasan station is such a depressing experience that I choose to travel from Asoke to Piyah Thai to catch the City Link or when it is running Express train rather than take the short MRT trip to Makasarn  It doesn't need cheaper fares or cleaner carriages It doesn't need much done with the scheduling It doesn't need better uniforms or better trained staff  It needs a smoother passage from Customs to the station at the airport end and could do with better promotion on aircraft in Immigration and through Customs   It would be best if one prepaid card even if it was an ARL card could get one from one's home station to the airport without having to cue up for a ticket every time   Most important if all it needs a culture change  pride amongst the staff that for many they are Thailand's first ambassadors to tourists and the first to welcome home weary travelers  with a smile  Electronic boards at strategic points at the key connecting stations and at the airport showing the next departure times (in real time) would be helpful to all  I love the service  it could just be so so much better

title: Fastest Way To The Airport During Peak Hour.
review: Apart from the 15 minute intervals between trains this service is a god send especially if you're rushing to get to the airport and the roads in the city are choked with traffic Select from Makkasan or Phaya Thai station within the city limits Makkasan can be accessed via a connecting bridge from Petchaburi MRT and Phaya Thai is accessible from the BTS line towards Mochit At 45 baht per person per trip you stand to save quite a bit on transportation especially if you're travelling alone A normal taxi ride into the city is around 250 baht or more

title: Patience and a map
review: Traffic is SO congested that this system is the only way to travel Have change for the machines know that if you change to another line you will have to exit and pay again to continue your journey The map is useful to check that you are heading in the right direction [there is map of the line you are on at the back of your ticket as well but the writing is tiny] and to thrust at someone at a ticket office if you cannot manage Thai pronunciationI am in my sixties and a solo traveller but have crisscrossed Bangkok with relative ease on this system

title: Interesting to see the unique markets
review: The tour went through 2 unique markets near Bangkok and was a good way for me (a solo traveler) to do a bit of exploring  Bus to get to the first market was about an hour and then on the way back to Bangkok (after the floating market) it was an hour and 45 minutes  So quite a bit of time travelling  But if these markets interest you its a great way to see them

title: Excellent trip
review: Brilliant trip which was very well organised and ran like clockwork Both destinations were excellent and we also saw quite a lot of the countryside

title: Clean, efficient, easy to use  - cheap
review: clean efficient and easy to use  best part is that is is cheap Also links to other train lines that are close to most major hotels that tourists stay in

title: Easy To Navigate
review: Cheap and easy to find your way around good maps provided I enjoyed using this to get about as there were some wonderful views of the city The Skytrain is very high up surprisingly enough They were very high tech there were TV screens for adverts in them barrier systems for tickets Lots of stairs so make sure you find stations with elevators if you have trouble with escalators or stairs

title: Don't try to connect with taxi
review: Mid June I hop down to Bangkok for an overnight trip (one small hand carry) so I tried this service But I made the mistake to try connect by taxi to my hotel When I got off the terminal there's no taxi to be found for 40 minutes I finally went by motorbike Scary Therefore my advice is connect with Skytrain But if you have a lot of luggages it will be a challenge

title: I love it!
review: The best transport to rush from Bangkok's traffic jams clear rapidly cool and cheap

title: By far easiest way to get to central Bangkok
review: Used Airport Rail link for first time to get to BKK Ratchaprarop Station which was only 5 minute walk to hotel Clean and air conditioned this was most reliable way to get into town taking approx 25 minutes avoiding the taxi cost and potential long delays on Bangkok's roads At only 40 Baht each way cheap as chips

title: WOW... Efficient, Fast & much cheaper..
review: Used the Rail Link for AIrport transfers & was amazed to see the cleanliness on the train Its a very efficient medium to reach the city from Airport & offers a great first look of the city from the elevated trackstakes about 50 bahts to reach Makkasan where a normal taxi would take about 300 bahts easily

title: Good way to get to the Airport
review: If you stay near by it‚Äôs good way to get to and from airport You can count how long it will take to get there I like it

title: If you know where your hotel is...
review: this is the way to go For 45 Baht (compared to 350 plus 75 toll for a taxi) you get to the city fast If you have heavy baggage and have to change to another line you should reconsider however  The different lines should have an agreement so only one fare has to be paid The way it is now one has to pay for each segment separately

title: Skytrain - travel without traffic but packed!
review: This is most Most Recommended to go around Bangkok and you are able to miss the long delay due the traffic congestion Well run mass rapid transport and stations are clean and secure Well signed and easy to follow this is so popular to the people and be ready to move quickly to get in and off  be prepared to squeeze in or be squeezed as it is packed The services run through all the most popular places retail and entertainment centres It is air conditioned so all good

title: Very clean and efficient
review: Proper signage and cleanEasy to use and announcements are  made in both Thai and EnglishCards can be bought from the counterCounter staffs could be friendlier though

title: Best way to get around town
review: The sky train is by far the best way to get around town Even for short trips it can be quicker than taking a cab due to the complicated oneway systems in Bangkok and the congestion In hot weather which is prettty much every day the trip is worth it just for the airconditioning alone The ticket machines don‚Äôt take notes and the queue for change can be quite long at peak hour so it‚Äôs a good idea to save up lots of coins and use them to buy your tickets Take the skytrain and change at Phaya Thai for the airport train for the best way to get to Suvarnabhumi

title: Convenient
review: Easy to have a quick ride much better than a taxi avoid all the traffic jam Cheap and quick Good choice of transportation in Bangkok One disadvantage is if you have an elderly one might need to walk up or down staircase not every station has escalator as such Bear this in mind

title: skytrain
review: while in Bangkok enjoy the skytrain you can cover a lot of tourist spots by using skytrain it is cheaper than taxi and much faster buy one day ticket for unlimited use

title: MRT is better than Sky train
review: The MRT network is limited but quality wise skytrain is cramped hot and humid inside In comparison the MRT is very well placed and cool

title: Cheap and fast transport to city
review: This is one way to beat the city traffic jam It is not only convenience it is not expensive and a good transport if you are staying near to a station

title: Fastest way to go around Bangkok its always full especially on rubutsh hours
review: This is the fastest way to go around Bangkok but its always full especially on rush hours  Just try avoiding peak hours because you will feel like a crushed sardine  Watch out for pick pockets

title: Great public transport
review: The MRT and the adjoining Sky train are a great cheap ways to get around the city and both connect to the Airport Sky train linkvery convenient

title: Wonderful A train to te aiirport
review: Cities that often regard themselves as a being a cut above Bangkok (for example Melbourne Australia) quite often have no link to the airport while Bankok has this wionderful train No more traffic  jams and jitters

title: Skytrain
review: Clean convenient  way to get around Bangkok Gets super crowded during peak times Can easily connect to other transport options such as MRT and Chao Phraya Express Boat

title: Great
review: Easy to uselovely cool air con so great to escape city heat buy a day ticket so you can get off and on as many times as you like

title: very good
review: I have travel with this and all has all guides if anything you will not understand the stuff will help you and reasonable cost for traveling

title: Great, clean and fast
review: If you are staying near a Skytrain station use it Keep in mind it is not handicap or traveler friendly if you have a lot of luggage Stairs would be more the norm but escalators and elevators are available at the typical tourist  connecting points Good and inexpensive  way to get to the Main Airport  Rail connection at Phaya Thai  but if you are in and out of Dom Meaung airport of no value Tip booths are for change only and after that you buy a token from the machines and price depends on where you ate going 25 baht and up one wayIf you have a lot of luggage don't even try to go through the turnstyles Look to the right and there is a gate with a security guard to make it easier

title: BE AWARE OF DODGY TAXI DRIVERS
review: Trains where a good option as i got ripped of a few times by taxi drivers tuk tuk to me worked best but it is essential to negotiate and confirm a price

title: So handy
review: Wish we had one in Manchester  UK  We have to pay 4 pounds just to drop off and you get fined if you drop off on the road out side

title: mrt
review: it is a expereicne to travel in mrt in bangkok and very safe and conveinent looking at the traffic on the road and should always use

title: Unbelievable
review: These markets were unbelievable It was true Thai culture with stalls and stalls of food clothes & everything else you could imagine  It was clean and accessible   Was an amazing experience and completely child friendly

title: Very easy way to get around Bangkok
review: very clean & airco in it During rush hour can be very busy Staff is very helpfull and friendly It is also possible so change coins at the counter  Safest and easiest way to travel around Bangkok

title: Very easy to use. Number one mode of transport
review: Very easy to use for a tourist hop off at the river and catch the boat to see a good amount of the town

title: Most reasonable and efficient way!
review: The airport rail link is a gem of Bangkok and fairly easy to navigate For our departure trip we needed to take two Skytrains and transfer to the airport link It was all straightforward and easy to navigate  A taxi to the airport runs around $50 and depending on the time of day you might be hung up in traffic The total for the Skytrain and Airlink was about 85 baht or less than 3 USD Travel time from the Silom district is 45 min to an hour A great deal The link takes you right to the bottom fl

title: Clean , Eficient , Cheap
review: Easy to use  Get a card at the kiosk to miss the lines at the ticket machine  Can be very crowded at morning and evening rush hour  Very well run and safe

title: Quick
review: Fastest way from airport to down town and cheap but it is only operated from Suvahnaphum Airport not from DMK airport

title: Loved the Sky Train
review: As this was our 2nd and much longer trip in 2 Bangkok locations we decided to really get familiar with the Sky Train this time and see if we could get a lot of use out of it  It turned out to be fantastic for us to get around easily and cheaply The rabbit card I had researched online was a real boon and made it all a breeze  our st 10 nights were at The Mayfair Marriott at Lumphini which was between 2 stations and we used them both The next 4 nights were at the Shangri La at the river right by the Saphan Taskin  station and was very convienient  It all worked very well and we got to the MBK Mall easily and the other main ones as well   Loved it all so efficient and clean as well and you never have to wait long for one to turn up

title: Puts US Mass Transit to Shame
review: Navigating the BTS The skytrain is very user friendly  At each station there is a teller or booth attendant and an automated machine  There is a map on the automated machine that has numbers next to the train stations  The number by your destination is the amount of your fare  For instance to get to Chatachuk (the last stop on the light green line) is 42Baht  The automated machines only take coin so the attendant in the booth is solely there for change  She does not actually get you a ticket  The train is very clean and we felt extremely safe  Victory Monument is also on the same light green line as is Siam  You can change to the dark green line at Saim to get to the tourist bus on the Chayo Praya river  Just get off at the last stop on the dark green line

title: Great way around
review: If you can figure out the maps you can get around the city fairly quickly and the skytrain is very clean Can get a little packed around rush hour so give yourself some extra time

title: Quick and Easy if you are connected
review: I had a very good connection to Nana just two changes in trains but easy to manage and convenient in signs and guidance A perfect and cheaper alternative to taxi especially when you go or come into town during rush hours 810 and 1620 Sometimes a bit packed when there is an outage in sequence just happens

title: Convenient way to and fro airport
review: Nice and convenient way to travel to and fro airport The train is quite comfotable and the route covers through major parts of city

title: packed out even at midday
review: Really easy to use the ticket machines as they are in both Thai and English and are just touch screen  Machines take both notes and coins and give change  We had to ask someone which platform to go to as there didn't appear to be any signs  Once on the train there is a map similar to the tube map showing the line you are on but it has a clever lighting system to show where you are on the line red once you have passed the station and green as they approach I thought it was a shame that the windows are marked so that you can't really see out as that would have been great but I guess that is to keep the heat out  Oh and btw there is Aircon too so it doesn't get ridiculously hot like the tube despite the heat of Bangkok

title: Fast, safe, clean efficient.
review: Don't be afraid to try this local commuter service It's slick and safe and way faster than taxis Plus it's air conditioned just avoid rush hour for the usual reasons

title: Nice!
review: It is punctual and safety Names of station are expressed  both visual and voiced Price of tickets are fair

title: See Bangkok the easy way
review: The BTS Skytrain can be a bit crowdedbut an excellent servicealways cleaneasy to understand station announcements Very affordable

title: Best way to travel
review: Fast takes you straight to your international terminal and reasonably priced Plenty of room for luggage and the platforms are well signposted

title: Good Experince
review: Really nice Infrstructure  Also Affordable  Public trasport in thailand may not be swanky  but its upto the mark and very affordable

title: So cool, clean, fast and cheap!
review: It was 80p to go from one side of town to the other and was freezing cold from aircon which I was happy about after sweating all day It was busy but what public transport isn't

title: Nothing special
review: It is cool to have BTS beside Metro but I have expected space shuttle ) and instead a was driving in a slow train between buildings and that's it But okit is not that bad From point A to point B and have good connection with Metro MRT stations

title: Not the greatest
review: I don‚Äôt necessarily think this is something you need to see to learn about the history I didn‚Äôt hate it but I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs a must do when in Thailand The ride on the train was long for what it was and there was nothing interesting to see up until the stop where we got off The train is apparently more comfortable on the weekend but it was very bare bones when we rode it on a Monday If you‚Äôre pressed for time in Bangkok I‚Äôd say skip it but if you‚Äôre bored and looking for something to do it‚Äôs not a terrible way to spend a day Definitely not the most interesting thing I‚Äôve ever seen or toured

title: Easy to navigate and buy tokens
review: Tap 'English' on the screen then touch the station you want to go to put in the bills and coins get a token Touch the token at the turnstile to enter drop it in the slot to exit People making change are nice Connects to the Sky Train and Airport train It gets crowded at rush hour but still useful and faster than taxis

title: Good & clean
review: Great way to beat the traffic jam However I didn‚Äôt like all the windows to be tainted with ads and commuters couldn‚Äôt look outside for sightseeing Some of the stations have no down riding escalators So the BTS is not so pedestrian friendly not elderly nor handicapped friendly Otherwise the experience was great

title: Convenient and not convenient
review: I have tried the BTS from the airport to Thonglor it was convenient and not convenient as well The vending machine does not accept note and only coins even for kids need pay full price For most countries the senior and kids pay half The vending machine has no multitickets function you need to buy ticket one by one If you have more than three people to go you take a taxi will be cheaper It is fast than taxi as no traffic jam Another thing not convenient is the BTS are three stories level above the gound floor we have to walk down and no escalators or lifts for going down I carried very heavy luggage and not convenient at all

title: good but expensive
review: The Airport Link skytrain is by far the cheapest quickest and easiest way to get to the airport  It's quite expensive though so don't use it to get around the city a taxi will be cheaper

title: Not enough time!
review: Both markets are interesting to see The railway market is more local (a lot of seafood and fresh vegetables) and we got some spices there to bring back home The floating market is more touristy It looks pretty cool when you enter it by boat but it's a little anoying when they are stopping although you don't want to buy anything and then the salesmen want to talk you into buying stuff   Bad thing The time We always just had like 1015 minutes of break to walk through the markets on our own Especially when they also want you to get lunch during this time its definitely way to short

title: Very convenient, clean and safe
review: Always reliable no long lines clean and safe I find everyone is polite and willing to move and give space for others

title: difficult to get to.
review: The taxi or BTS to the airport link takes as long as a taxi to the airport from most areas in Bangkok It only connects to one BTS station and you need to buy a seperate ticket

title: Check where you're going, and take the Skytrain to the nearest point, if possible!
review: I found this a cheap and convenient way to get around Bangkok  For a westerner it's easy to follow  I always did a quick Google Maps check found the local station and planned my route around that  The aircon is such a relief during those hot sweaty Bangkok days and nights

title: Great!
review: This is a fantastic service in BKK It is so handy to use and very cost effective It is clean and has fantastic aircon It can be somewhat busy but that is to be expended

title: safe travel by MRT
review: Do not confuse between the MRT and Sky train Both are mass rapid transport but the routes are different Th egirls at the conter are very helpful You can get coins for the ticket machine from them

title: Great Way To Arrive in The City
review: We took the Rail link as it stopped close to our Hotel Its a great service clean & AC'ed As soon as the doors opened & we got out we were hit by the Bangkok heat & the smell of spicy chicken grilling A pretty perfect start to our visit Down some stairs grab some chicken & jump into a TukTuk Great stuff

title: Rabbit makes it easy
review: Definately the best way to avoid the traffic We bought a Rabbit Card on our last trip and were able to just top it up this trip making life so much easier

title: Yes very good
review: Sara is awesome and very funny Loved the tourthe food was also delicious please recommend to more people

title: Great way of transportation in the bussy Bangkok center
review: The skytrain is briliant way of transportation in the bussy center of Bangkok it takes you to the next stations within minutes The only problem is that its limited to the center and specific areas and then you need bustaxi  We choose an hotel connected to the skytrain so it was realy easy for us  learn your location then use the skytrain to skip the heavy traffic

title: Rail Link
review: The fastest and most efficient way to go from and to Suvarnabumi Airport Please notice that this Rail Link does not operate 24 hours If you have a late flight you might not be able to use this cheap service

title: SMOOTH SAILING
review: The fastest means of transportation into the city from the airport or from the city to the airport It connects directly to the airport basement once you alight you are inside the airport already the train moves from Phaya Thai thru Ramkhamhaeng Huamak all the way to Survanabhumi Airport in all the journey takes 40mins or close   Previously the train was for seating only however recent coaches have some compartment for keeping bags a space for disabled{a dedicated elevator too} and more security Unlike the BTS the ARL like MRT has a board showing waitring tine for the train to arrive on the average it take 23m for BTS but much longer for ARL  If you need to get to the airport in the shortest possible time use this service also cost is minimal 45bht will get you to the airport from Phaya Thai

title: Good alternative for the taxi
review: If you don't want to travel by taxi from the airport to the city of Bangkok The ARL is a good alternative Easy affordable and comfortable

title: clean and on time
review: Bangkoks underground system is not very large but the trains run on time everything is well organised air conditioned and clean

title: Great service
review: Great to get around the basic central areas of Bangkok  One day pass is 140 Baht  On and off as much as you like Doesn't cover all of Bangkok and ticket is different to metro   Easy to use Great of you take the transit train from the airport to the center which Is only 45 baht

title: Take a dust mask and water!
review: This is obviously a must do We drove to kanchantaburi and left out car at station but in hindsight next time I have another plan   You buy your ticket at the station 100 baht no resident or child discount You cannot buy a return Doesn't matter how far you go still 100   The train has the windows open and the heat and dust and burning slash clearance particles which all share the carriage with you make it difficult to breathe  especially bad if they just reballast the line  Top tip Bring a mask which you can buy from chemists or a clothextra t shirt to breathe through   Top tip Do not bother washing your hair or blow drying it that day It will be caked in dust by the end   You can buy water and loads of hawker food on the train if needed   There are a number of stops if you go to the end of the line Nam Tok which is where you can get to Hell Fire Pass from If you take an early train you can I presume get on and off going sane direction but I'm not sure  There seemed to be lots of people who get off walk along the wooden bridge but then take photos of the next train passing over and jump on that one next   We got off at Nam Tok and booked a car and driver to take us to hell fire and back to kanchantaburi Good fortuna vehicle with AC for the vehicle was 1500 We had a leisurely meal and then the driver did the driving We just didn't fancy the train and struggling to breathe again It was reasonable price to not have to rush have AC   However next time if we bring guests we will drive to one station maybe Nam Tok drive to hell fire etc and then take much shorter train to the first stop which is where you walk across the wooden bridge The road to Nam Tok was a good easy to drive road in a car or on peds  The headsets are worth waiting for if all out You need ID and 200 deposit They are freedonation  Also I think it' apt to end with the cemetery

title: The best way to get to the city
review: Quick and convenient way to get from the airport to the city Air conditioning in the train works exactly as it should  the temperature is optimal Very reasonable price Buying a token is easy and hassle free

title: The only way to travel in Bkk
review: Fast and easy to get around Perfect transport from airport and to shopping centres Just make sure you book an hotel near a station and your trip to Bkk gets so much easier

title: Easy and efficient transport system
review: We stayed close to the BTS and it quickly became our main mode of transport With minimal fuss you can get to most parts of Bangkok city and also to the river boats for access to other areas The system was clean safe and very efficient Trains run until 12 at night and there was security at each station Possible to purchase a day pass which allows unlimited access for the day for 130 Baht

title: good
review: easy and best way to travel in bangkok good service mvery clean well lighted up announcement is clear and loud and generally on time every 3 mins you have service very organised

title: Don't take Cabs!
review: I read but ignored TripAdvisor on my first Bangkok trip  The traffic is as reported HORRIBLE  You can take the Skytrain virtually anywhere in Bangkok including to and from BKK  It is super convenient safe and cheap (140 Baht for a day pass or about $450 USD)  Pick a hotel close to the line and you will be a happy camper  One cautionary note during rush hour the trains are literally jammed packed so if you are claustrophobic this might be an issue

title: Essential
review: If you are using AirBnB and backpacking this is essential easy to understand maps of destinations and the ticket machines are more logical than the ones in UK

title: Easy
review: Fairly simple and easy to use There are signs in English and maps and apps available The flow of the train was smooth and the air conditioning works well

title: Definitely worth getting a hotel near here!
review: I used the bts Train system a lot on my 5 days in Bangkok So easy to use the ticket machines in English such clean spaces and cold aircon which was a must I would definitely make sure my hotel was in walking distance to this service You can get an all day ticket for 100baht or a single journey costs approximately 45baht  Well used by locals and tourists

title: Good clean fast way to get around the city
review: Tried it today and it was quick clean to use Some of the lines could be packed but no big deal It's better than getting stuck in traffic

title: Great & Easy way to beat the Traffic
review: This is an easy and cool (literally with AC) way to get around the city Quite cheap for a family and very clean A tip is to have some coins as the ticket machines do not take notes You have to queue to get change About 55 baht was the most expensive fare one way Very frequent services was a bonus

title: trip #1  2016
review: This is a good service to the airport from Phayati You can get here by using the BTS trains from various locations around Bangkok Take the regular service as its much cheaper option Fast and clean better than the crazy maniac taxi drivers trying to show off their skills on the expressway

title: easy and cheap
review: Take ten minutes to understand the way BTS is working and you can reach most of central Bangkok in an easy and very quick way andvery cheap On the peak hours there is a lot of people on the BTS but every 2 minutes you can take the next one

title: Excellent Metro System
review: Used this throughout our stay in Bangkok getting a day ticket is the cheapest if your using it a lot but still cheap just for single journeys and it gets you almost everywhere you want to  We used Asok station at Terminal 21 and if you were going into the old town sightseeing we would change at Siam and go to Saphan Tahksin and then get the public river ferry up to Pier #9 for the Grand Place for a couple of Thai Baht each  A very cheap and just as good view of the river front for a fraction of the price  Very busy during peak times but it's a city Metro system so to be expected but in my personal opinion a lot quicker than the taxis or even tuktuk's which get clogged in the city traffic chaos  Highly recommend it's use and it is so simple to use

title: Not too complicated once you figure it out
review: We are cheap travelers No doubt about it If we can save a few bucks on a taxi that covers a beer or a meal or a trinket to take home One problem we encountered in Bangkok is that even if we thought a taxi might be easier many times the taxi driver didn't know how to get to our destination   Get your bearings on a physical map and online before you get on the train because once you're off the train it's easy to get turned around We spent a lot more time walking than we planned just because we'd think we could jump right off the train and be at our destination Think it through and you can really save some money  You may not always get a seat but the train was clean and air conditioned And the maps and announcements are clear You just need to allow plenty of time and get acquainted with the system No food or drink on the train and that makes a difference   If you are in the planning stages of your trip take a look at how you might utilize the train system It's worth the time to research it

title: Fastest way to commute in bangkok
review: I travel every week in and out of bangkok through suvarnabumi airport It is the fastest and cheapest way to commute to and from airport If you are going to sukhumvit You can go phaya thai and take train to Asok I Normally get down in makkasan ( phetchaburi MRT) and take taxi Please remember to check the map as the station name changes depends on underground train or sky train

title: BTS Skytrain!
review: We found it easy to use and get around Bangkok The station are closer to the most big shopping centres and atracctions

title: Great way to travel
review: Fastest service Need to walk a bit to reach shopping malls but I personally felt walking is good for health

title: Fast and easy
review: Just walk down and down  The the rail link at the lowest level  Take the local train  It's near as fast as the express and runs much more often    When you get off be sure your cab is charging you with the meter They all offer fixed prices that are 23 times the metered price  You may have to try several cabs

title: Stay above the chaos
review: The skytrain makes moving along Sukhumvit easy as can be Any other way is awful in comparison The cars are clean and cool though usually full Just squeeze in and you'll get to where you want to go quickly If the line didn't exist and all the people who ride it were added to the mayhem below Sukhumvit would be impassable It's by far the most efficient thing in Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: It is very convenient to take BTS because the traffic is really bad in bangkok But if there have toilet and escalator would be perfect

title: Best way to get around Bangkok

title: Great!
review: Definitely the best and cheapest way to get into town from Suvarnabhumi airport It's clean has AC and is fast and reliable Don't be scared It's really a great option

title: Amazing for budget travellers
review: The airport rail has connectivity from the airport and also the its very reasonable considering the high charges charged by the taxis

title: QUICK AND EFFICIENT

title: Skytrain
review: Cheap fast and cleanEasiest way to get around Bangkok and there's a new link to the airport nowStations clearly marked and maps on every platform Cheap too

title: Rail link
review: Dont bother with taxi's from the airport you will sit in so much traffic just get the train to down town then pick up the Skytrain or MRT l went from the airport to MakkasanYou can pick up the subway from here but be aware the subway gets very busy if you have large bags It cost 30 baht l think which is so cheap

title: Easy ride to the City.

title: Good and cheap.  Better than taxi.

title: Easy!
review: Using the train is a easy way of getting around Bangkok Buy a pass it is easy  refundable good for 5 yrs

title: The divergent train
review: Very comfortable fast and expensive It's a good way to avoid the traffic jam and the pollution of Bangkok

title: Faster to reach everywhere
review: We really enjoyed using the sky train since it was cheap and faster We can also Save money using this instead of Tuk tuk and taxi But the cleanliness has to be better in future I hope so

title: well run service
review: Was last in Bankok over twenty years ago and was very impressed with the changes made over that time  The skytrain is among the most impressive changes  Well run and clean and gets you to many parts of the city quickly and efficiently The staff is very helpful with directions and helps getting you started  Sometimes a little crowded but this is a major city and nothin unexpected

title: Best way to travel
review: Air con and very punctual Serves most of the popular places in the city Only way to travel in Bangkok

title: So easy!
review: I would say it¬¥s the best way to go from Suvarnabhumi to the city It only takes you about 20 minutes to go to Phaya thai station which is located close to the city center of Bangkok From there you can grab a taxi or just change to the BTS (Skytrain) Very easy just buy your ticket in the ticket machine and then jump on the train )

title: Best Transport in Siam (BTS)
review: BTS enable u to enjoy Bkk to its MAX Save hours of commuting time Cheaper than taxi Predictable time management Clean and vibrant trains and stations

title: Best way to get around
review: This is by far the best way to get around the parts of Bangkok it accesses Cheap fast comfortable

title: Going to the city without the traffice!

title: Airport RailLink Bangkok, Thailand

title: Great way to Travle

title: Good way to get around
review: The only issue is it is relatively limited in that there are just two lines that cross in just one place But air conditioned carriages frequent service easy to buy tickets (get coins from the people in the kiosks) All works well Much better than rip off taxis

title: BTS is an easy way to get around BKK
review: BTS is an easy way to get around BKK  The BTS is convenient fast and cheap form of transportation  It is also the best way to get to the weekend market  It will let you off at the entrance of the market

title: Efficient BTS
review: I have experience the BTS from MO CHIT to the nearest BTS (Ratchathewi) of our hotel and for me it was the efficient and fastest way to beat the traffic around BKK If you want to buy ticket you should have coins or if not u can go to the counter to change your paper money to coins Bts machine is a coin operated You can see beside the coin slot if how much will be the amount to be paid per certain station and there will be a simple instruction on how use it Hope this help

title: Great public transport
review: Used this to get too and from the airport Ticket price to the last stop was 45 bhat from there you can get the bts to wherever your hotel is

title: Great Way of Reaching City
review: The Airport Link provides an easy way of reaching Bangkok The entrance is underneath the airport and purchasing tickets is easy   Transferring to Metro and BTS lines is easy as stations on the link provide direct access   Highly recommend using when traveling to Bangkok

title: Transport
review: The BTS skytrain to me was one of the safest & cheapest modes of transport in Bangkok and hey its not easy to get lost because of the maps on the stations and also the announcements and train stations indicated on the tickets so you can know exactly where to get in and out

title: Interesting stop
review: Would suggest this for anyone who needs help in traveling tips Traveling the world is my favorite sport

title: Excellent and cheap - about one pound Sterling
review: Go down to the basement level buy a plastic token 50ThB go to Phaya Thai (end of the line) and youre in central BKK From there you can easily negotiate the BTS or other stations Could not be easier

title: Fast and modern
review: Fast and modern transportation also very cheap The best way to connect the airport to bangkok where you can then take the BTS or a taxi Highly recommended

title: BTS is the best mode of transport but ....
review: No doubt that in the central area of Bangkok is the transport of choice Fast very frequent airconditioned and affordable The lowdowns however include that you will still have to climb the stairs coverage is only along some of the main roads and often the trains are packed  Connection with the Suvarnabhumi airport is excellent If you take the city line you're from the airport in Sukhumvit area within an hour for about 2 usd Tip when you carry a bag and go through the entryexit gates don't hold the bag in front of you when you pass through as the gate will close automatically and hit your thighs

title: Not the cheapest thing

title: Day Trip Bridge over River Kwai
review: From the booking to the drop off everything was spot on  Picked up on time Met by a very cherry and  friendly tour rep ‚ÄúSin‚Äù who explained the day kept us well informed and answered any questions we had  Sin was very knowledgeable courteous and always had a smile  Can‚Äôt forget the driver who took us everywhere who negotiated two lots of rush hour traffic admirably    Highly recommend Sin as your guide and the company for any tours

title: Efficient
review: The auto ticketing machines were easy to use good if you are just using it once or twice a visit otherwise a rechargeable pass is the better option Rarely waited long for a train and they are always clean with good aircon

title: Comfortable but lacks escalators in some stations
review: Pros  1 Good for solo or couple travelers Economical But if more than that then better off getting grab   Cons  Some stations don‚Äôt have escalators which makes it difficult for elderly and those requiring wheelchair access  I was traveling with elderly parents so mostly used Grab except once at which time my parents had to climb and descend stairs which was difficult  They have different packages Do download Grab as well and compare what suits you better   If we travel as a couple again we will try it out more

title: Quick, cheap and easy!
review: If you are looking to get into the city from the airport then jump on the rail link It saves you a lot of hassles if you  travelling solo or in a small group Its exactly 30mins each way at THB45 one way Be prepared to jam in though I stayed in Sukhumvit so I got onto the BTS and waited 4 or 5 stops to get to Nana station Its definitely cheaper and less time consuming then jumping into a cab especially with BKK traffic

title: Easy and cheap

title: Easy to use

title: first and cheap
review: I always use Airport Link and BTS train to go to hotel when I travel to Bangkok and arrive before 1100 at night It's first and cheap you should use these when you stay hotel near BTS station and when you come to Thai by personal vacation

title: Fast and Efficient - But not the best design
review: From the airport into the heart of Bangkok this is cheap fast and safe I always take the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Makkasan (cost Bt 35  $1) From Makkasan I can either take a taxi  or walk for 5 minutes to catch the Bangkok Metro (MRT) The downside Trains are not very regular 15  20 minutes between trains Trains get very crowded very quickly  if you are in the middle of the train with your luggage I suggest that you move to the door the stop before In my experience taxi drivers don't like taking me to Makkansan Station when trying to get the train back to the airport They would rather take you to the airport themselves Other than that unbeatable value Where else can you get an airport train for $1 that takes you to the heart of the city in 20 minutes Hong Kong is $20

title: Great if you need to go nearby

title: Easy Travel
review: Catch a cab and be prepared to wait and wait for the traffic the sky train really rocks aircon and easy to use What a pleasure

title: Great way to get out of Suvarnabhumi airport
review: If you want to avoid taxi and Bangkok traffic jam use Rail Link going from (or to) Suvarnabhumi (BKK) airport Use express train if possible It is super convenient There are 2 express lines Makkasan and Phaya Thai I used express train to Phaya Thai (that gets you to the BTS Sukhuvmit lane) and then either by taxi or BTS (if it's peek traffic hour take BTS)  However Phaya Thai express is currently (form April 2014) under renovation so you can only take City Train which is slow and has many stops Use taxi if you have luggage Once Phaya Thai express is back use it instead It is fast and convenient to get you to area around Sukhuvmit (for example between Phaya Thai BTS  and Nana there are only 4 stops) If you are going towards Makkasan (and can use MRT) use it

title: good connection to the city if you are on a budget
review: It is a good connection to the city if you are on a really really tight budget for a few baht you get to the city center Considering that a taxi to any precise destination in the city is about 400 Baht 10 EUR 12 USD you might want to skip that As a tip  go up to the top floor (departures) and pick a taxi from there You will find metered taxis (ask before getting in) that will be even less than 400 baht

title: Cheap and Efficient
review: I had taken a taxi to my hotel in the past and as it was too early to get to my hotel I decided on trying out the Rail Link After hunting for it I found it in the basement of the airport The link seems to run every 30 minutes which is quite convenient The fair of 45 Bhat is quite a bit lower then the $500 bhat the taxi's charge There are ATM type ticket dispensers located outside the station and really friendly staff to show you how to use it  Be advised that the train is getting popular and anything more then 3 pcs of luggage per person would be a challenge to manage as it gets crowded fast The train's final destination is Phaya Thai which connects to the BTS system This station also has ticket booths for BTS passes Be advised that although this train station has elevators to assist with the luggage the BTS system does not As such the prudent thing to do from this station would be to get a taxi from here to your hotel Naturally not being the wisest I went on the BTS system and navigated the seven flights of stairs downward with three pieces of luggage something after having done it I really would not recommend   I also took the Link back to the Airport  As a side note I got the feeling that a lot of taxi drivers are quite disgruntled by this system as many would not take me to the Phaya Thai station from my hotel and were trying to convince me over and over to use them to go to the Airport  As the Link runs within certain hours this option is the better of the two as you avoid all of the traffic provided the flight schedule allows for it By the way the train was quite empty at the Phaya Thai station easily accommodating the luggage

title: Lovely experience in Bangkok

title: Better than taking a taxi any day

title: The Best & Easiest Way To Get Round Bangkok
review: By far the best way to get around Bangkok and avoid the daily traffic and fumes is by using the Skytain (aka BTS) It's a modern elevated train system that "flys" above it all Next best is the underground subway (MRT) however with the BTS you have city scenery to watch as you propel towards your destination and the system is larger The trains are fast secure clean air conditioned have TVs to watch and are fun to ride They are also relatively inexpensive recommend getting a day pass or Rabbit card which you can periodically top off which is what I do I live here and use the BTS every day   Yes the train cars can at times get crowded particularly at the end of business days but it's something you deal with Crowded train car Just wait for the next oneit's still the best means for getting around far distances The good thing is that the city is expanding additional lines into outer parts of Bangkok   One complaint I do have is the stairs you need to climb to get up to the loading area It's not very handicap senior friendly or helpfull for people with luggage from the airport If you have such issues you may consider taking a taxi instead I'm told they are planning to put in elevators into more stations That said I'm a senior and I find the stair climbing good exercise for me Overall the Skytrain (BTS) system is a great way to travel within this large city

title: Crowded! Get to the Station Early
review: We used this service several times going back and forth to the airport as we used Bangkok as a stopover  It is challenging in peaktime as the train is also a commuter service  When we arrived in Bangkok 6am on a Monday the train was reasonably quiet until the 2nd or 3rd stop by which time our bags and ourselves were wedged in  Would recommend you get seats by the door if you can  Returning to the airport on the Wednesday afternoon was even more challenging  Make sure you leave yourself PLENTY of time  When we arrived at the station there were already queues (few travellers) and when the train eventually arrived it was already packed and we couldn't get on  Eventually a second train arrived and we managed to squeeze on (standing room only)  that was around 330pm  The commuters are accommodating for travellers with bags  once you get on  However the airport link train is much better than getting a taxi  the traffic is even less predictable

title: Efficiancy with safety and low stress
review: In Bangkok one is treated to the world's only four selfsustaining and profitable mass transit systems the MRT subway the BTS skytrain the amazing bus system and the Airport Rail Link  The rail link is not available to you if you arrive at Suvarnabhumi after midnight or before 600am and this might be its only drawback  Should you be arriving or departing during operating hours it is foolish not to take it  Even if your destination is not on the mas transit routes you will be wellserved to take your taxi from the terminus of the route when coming in to town  You'll save fortyfive minutes (or more) coming in and an hour (or more) going out not to mention saving on cab fare and hassle  If you are going from town to the airport and have luggage just check it in at Makhassan Station (yes you can do an airport checkin right at the rail link  I've done it several times and no lost luggage) and forget itall hassles solved  If you have no luggage leave town from the Phaya Thai station where there is less congestion    The link is cheap fast hassle free safe at all hours clean family friendly and the only smart way to go a mustdo

title: Crushed to the doors!
review: Noone can fault this for price or public convenience as the other reviews already state However as a resident  rather than a tourist  I feel a little balance should be restored to the rating of this 'attraction' (transport) to highlight the current concern  Ever since the Sukhumvit line has extended to Bearing station the BTS has been severely overcrowdedThe owners and operators have done little to ease the growing mass of commuters I have seen one larger train (just once) in the past few months and am surprised they have not had the foresight to match the new extensions of the line by rebalancing the volumes of people with extra carriages or trains  Although the train ride is great I have witnessed ticket machines failing and mass queues at Asoke both for change and tickets like most other services it is far from perfect all of the time For the elderly and disabled there are 'some' escalators but sadly no lifts or wheelchair access to the platforms roughly 1 in 4 staircases has an escalator from the street to the ticket booth so expect to climb the stairs most of the time A worrying article in last week's news about a train's doors opening between stations is another reminder that nothing is perfect and BTS operators should always be looking to improve safety measures and comfort for passengers   If you have found yourself crushed against the doors you will certainly understand where I am coming from in this respect last second passengers push in to the door space cue a safety 'bleep bleep bleep' which is now a common occurrence on every journey Meanwhile passengers on the other side of the car are already pushed up leaning on the doors god knows what would happen if they started opening in the middle of the tracks  Somehow I just can't see the necessary adjustments for this service being carried out with any urgency in the near future In summary Skytrain should certainly not be patting itself on the back for a job well done just yet

review: you should use skytrain (BTS) in Bangkok to access most places like Siam Paragon Central World MBK center Chatuchak Silom area etc This train doesn't reach all places such as Grand Palace and Wat Pho but from nearest station you can continue by boat or bus The price is around 4050 bahttrip for further location and 1030 baht for near ones The aircon works very well inside the train also very clean as we are not allowed to eatdrink inside The train will be very crowded in the morning and after office hour This is the best choice to explore Bangkok instead of taking taxirenting car because you will waste your time in hell traffic jam

title: Clean and fast
review: This is my first time to use the Airport Rail Link in Bangkok All my previous visits was always have a taxi to take me from airport to hotel since its not an expensive anyway But this is a good value to try and the seat is spacious clean and comfort You can bring all your luggage along with you Have a try

title: Use it!
review: The best way to get around Bangkok It's cheap clean and safe to use at anytime of day Never get stuck in the crazy traffic again

title: So easy to use
review: Just do it English language option on screens Save all those little coins and use them here Can be busy but great air con and regular

title: not expensive.
review: Great way to travel round the city not expensive and much better than dealing with the rude taxi drivers  Can get very busy at peak times

title: Could've Been So Much Better
review: Compared to virtually any other modern airrail link the BKK system is really nothing short of an expensive disaster But that is to be expected so was Suvarnabhumi itself   The problem is that this is not an "airport express" taking you quickly and directly into the heart of the city it's a commuter train that happens to terminate at the airport and thus is used by the locals as such making it extremely crowded What is needed is an actual "airport express" that takes you straight to the city and would thus not be of any interest to daily commuters The train is also mysteriously short of carriages  three  and does not make the best use of the what little space it has  That said if you are staying near any of the major stations or the connections with the BTS stations and are on your own with minimal baggage it's a decent option and substantially cheaper than getting a taxi If in a couple or a family with several items of luggage then it's advisable to get a taxi

title: Great

title: Easy travel
review: 35 Baht for one way ticket Taxi costs around 300 Baht to city center If you travel alone or as a couple you can easily use it

title: Great Public transportation

title: Easiest way to get to and from the airport to the BTS system
review: If you are staying BTS station somewhere in Bangkok the easiest and probably the fastest way to get to and from the airport is via the rail link  It is also the least expensive option  The trains are clean modern and have sufficient room for people with luggage  The only negative is that it does not run 24 hours a day which means that if you are on a flight that is arriving or taking off from Midnight to morning it might not be such a good option

title: Clean and efficient

title: Easily accessible

title: SKY BTS TRAIN
review: Whilst on our three month holiday we used the Sky Train quite regularly  It is very easy to get from A  B as it is always on time and very clean One is not allowed to eat or drink whilst on the Sky Train  The Thai people are very kind and nice who always give up their seats for both of us when we are standing which is seldom done now a days We do enjoy using the Sky Train besides the Taxi Service as the fares are very good value for money  As we stay at the Adelphi Suites the Sky Train is only a few minutes walk mean really close We would definitely recommend the use of Sky Train especially after the rush hour in the morning Good Luck Give it a try Clare and Keith France (Mr and Mrs)

title: Effecient.

title: A good way of getting cheap arial view of Bangkok from the skytrain
review: It cost 145 bhatt for a oneday ticket and we took the greeline and jumped off at Siam Center A quick nice way to get about in Bangkok

title: The only way to commute.

title: I was afraid to die from total refrigeration
review: It was most horrible experience I ever had before job interview I'm very heatloving men and so when I decided to enter this train just to try out I was shocked by air temperature inside I think it was around 1415 degrees on Celsius ( while outside temperature was about 42 on Celsius ) Yes this train *is* the fastest ever method to travel over Bangkok especially in the evening when all city cars stop in huge traffic jams But after I ran away from it on my station my glasses were steamed up ( which is not surprising given this huge difference in temperatures I don't know how Thai people use this without getting sick instantly

title: convenience in the concrete jungle chaotic traffic

review: The BTS Skytrain connects you to the tourist attractions and areas in Bangkok in a quick efficient manner  We couldn't believe how clean the trains were inside and out  Service at the ticket office is friendly

title: Amazing transport from the airport;
review: I absolutely love the airport link  Usually in less than 45 minutes one can get from major hotels to the airport link with a simple connection  Traffic jams or not this thing runs on time and quickly  much unlike taxis who have to suffer through unbelievable traffic in Bangkok

title: Gets you anywhere!
review: This is a wonderful way to get around Bangkok and explore the city It's cheaper less time consuming and safe

title: The old express trains have been suspended
review: The Airport Rail Link is an average experience which could be an excellent one i rode this train on day 2 of its operation a couple for years back a slick 15 minute ride from Suvarnabhumi to Makkasan city terminal with no stops Trouble was few people used it at 100 Baht it was only a couple of dollars cheaper than a taxi and Makkasan Terminal was too far to walk to Sukhumvit and too close for a taxi to want the job So the SRT punted it to local commuters with great success  so much success that they needed the underused express train sets to cope with the demand   The result was that when I used the service from Ratchaprarop station to the airport a couple of weeks ago I found standing room only and nowhere to stow my suitcase Effectively the airport users have become an inconvenience   On the plus side it only takes 25 minutes which is quicker than a taxi at 40 Baht it must be one of the cheapest airport links around and it is clean and airconditioned  The SRT needs to invest in new train sets But when this will happen is anyones guess

title: fast (~30-40min), cheap (45 BAT), convenient

review: Visiting the railway as part of my holiday in Thailand I became aware that it offered so much more  We spent four days at kanchanaburi and had to arrange transport to and from Bangkok but as we were not tied to arrangements we discovered that we could catch the train at Nam Tuk and for 100 baht we could have a 5 hour trip all the way to Bangkok Lovely sights along the way

title: This tour with Sara is awesome!
review: Sara provided an amazing tour for our group  I love that they pick you up from your hotel Sara is extremely knowledgeable about Bangkok snd Thailand  She even tried to teach us a little Thai during our drive out to the markets She gave us great insights about the train and floating markets all with a wonderful sense of humor  She kept calling my husband James Mr James Bond  It was hilarious If you have any reservations about doing this tour with Sara don't  Book it now

title: Easy to Use
review: This skytrain can be crowded especially during rush hour but it is easy to use and fast so getting to your destination is a breeze I highly recommend this mode of transport in Bangkok

title: The Wonder of Thailand
review: The Bangkok BTS was established since the 1992 but not in operational  till 1999 BTS has gone thru the toughest time and had been at red since the fare was not cheap in terms of Thai Standard and was unable to attract motorists to use instead of driving  By 2005 more stations are in used and sgnificantly move massive of passengers daily  Nowadays  BTS has been an important commutor for locals as well as Foreigners especially along Sukhumvit the toughest trafficway of Thailand  Whenever I need to go the center of Bangkok I will definitely make use of the BTS  Recent years BTS has been linked with Subway and that makes BTS moreever important to Bangkokist  The BTS was first running with two Cars and recently has been four Cars  I can't imagine not long from now 5 cars will be running

title: Cheap and efficient
review: The fast train has stopped running due to loss making but the commuter train is still running at B45 per trip and take you to the city within 35 mins  If you have small luggage and can manage a couple of staircases this is an excellent choice  Taxi fare for the same journey can easily cost you B500

title: Really convenient
review: This is a very convenient way of transpo in Bangkok The train was clean and fairly fast I won't hesitate on giving it a fivestar rating

title: GREAT Rail system!!
review: Don't be afraid of the Bangkok subway system  The toll vending machines are very intuitive the route maps are easy to understand and every station has a human being to sell tokens and help you if you need information  The easiest subway I have ever ridden

title: Great way to travel

title: We used the BTS Skytrain everyday! Super easy and convenient.
review: We used the airport rail link from BKK airport to transfer to the BTS skytrain From there it was a 35 minute walk to our hotel During our stay in Bangkok we utilize public transportation with ease and only paid for a taxi once to get to the DMT airport If you're wanting to explore in the heart of Bangkok the Airport Rail Link and BTS Skytrain will fulfill your trasportation needs Place we explored using BTS Skytrain The Grand Palace Weekend Market Terminal 21 Mall Siam Center Madame Tassauds nightlife off "Nana" station and Chao Phraya River

title: Most convenience transport

title: Comfortable

title: So easy, so quick

title: Fast and very cheap
review: It was Dec 31 and all Bangkok center  was close to traffic so we took train to the airport 45 bat per person (free when the center is close to traffic  You can connect from many station to this fast train

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: If you need to get around the BTS is the best way The amount of traffic in the capital is crazy Unless you want to go on a motor cycle taxi The BTS (Skytrain) fare is really cheap brand new had air condition and it come every 7 mins It does get really crowded during rush hours but it move along quick If you stay in the capital for a while it is best to get a "T" card Which can be purchase at any train station where the 'T" employee work at the booth Which runs about 180 baht Then you can add money to the card and pay for the ride Easy and convenient  Tips  Can't eat or drink on the train On the platform must form a line to get into the train Can't just cut in front of other folks Also  if you bring a back pack the security have to check your bag

title: Getting around
review: Fantastic way to see Bangkok Very reliable and you can purchase a ticket that suits you from one destination to another day ticket 3 day ticket and so on You can get on and off as many times as you like and even connects to the train at various stations Reasonably priced as well

title: Cheap and very convenient to the airport

title: Fast and Efficient

title: Absolutely convenient
