title: Convenient
review: The BTS was not very cheap but at least it was much cheaper than taking a cab I saved quite a lot by taking BTS (or MRT) instead of cab and spent around 400 baht (including 100 baht for rabbit card) on BTS for my four nights stay at Bangkok I traveled by BTS most of the time (unless it was late at night and the place I went was far from the station) Would recommend buying the rabbit card if you're planning to travel by BTS (more convenient and avoid long queue at certain stationshours)

title: Love the MRT
review: Great service easy to use with tokens for single journeys  very reasonable and reliable  A really good way to get around Bangkok

title: Convenient if Pricey
review: This is the fastest way around Bangkok  if it serves the area you want to go  Mostly it doesn't  Inside is clean and organized  Why do you queue to buy a ticket at a window only to be given change for the machines  No clue  Despite a slightly inflated cost this is definitely the easiest way around when you can use it  Connection from Phaya Thai station to the airport is excellent

title: easy and quick
review: This is a great way to get to the airport especially during high traffic times  it is fast and comfortable and keeps you from sitting in traffic worrying about when you'll get there

title: Easy and accessible.
review: A very convenient way to get around Bangkok for a very small price Stations connect in many locations to MRT or bus stops and of course at Phaya Thai station to the Airport Link train that takes you directly to Suvarnabhumi

title: Skytrain
review: The Skytrain is easy to use and is an easy way to get around Bangkok  I use it and the Airport Link to get to my hotel  The stop was only two blocks from my hotel

title: Disappointing experience
review: Our guide and driver were good but the mini van was cramped and uncomfortable If you're over 16 metres5'6" tall there is no leg room and no seat belts The ac was good and staff were friendly and professional but given the amount of time in the mini van it was just too cramped  I would look elsewhere if ever I was going again for smaller numbers in the tour group so that you get more space  One last note both the railway market and floating market appeared to exist more for tourism than anything else They lacked any sense of authenticity and the animals kept for photos with tourists appeared miserable Left the floating market upset for the snakes and primates used for photo opps and disappointed by both markets

title: Great way to beat Bangkok traffic
review: Fast on time and great way to beat busy Bangkok traffic during peak traffic periods  Early in the morning or late at night though (assuming no traffic) taxi still quicker

title: Reliable and speedy travel to many tourist sites
review: Its an above ground train and it is clean regular and very affordable to travel on Note that they don't have ticket booths anymore so make sure you have the name of the station you wish to get to and familiarise with the direction of your intended destination Tickets are dispensed at machines near the entrance of each station Some machines only accept coins and there is a counter where you can exchange notes for coins Beats the traffic jams and a good view of the surrounding buildings as you travel along the line

title: Take train to city from airport
review: It not totally connect some part you have to carry bag yourself from place to place But the good thing is escape from bad traffic in rush hour

title: Just the ticket
review: If you need to travel to the main airport from the city or visa versa then this rail link provides a decent and fast service at a good price

title: Cheap and easy transport
review: BTS Skytrain is a cheap and easy way to reach different parts of the city Unfortunately it doesn't reach every quarter yet you have to walk a lot or take the bus But still a good way to go around Bangkok

title: I prefer these trains to the buses.
review: I like the sleepers I like the ordinary trains I especially like the option of buying from hawkers wandering the trains selling all kinds of food and drink The prices are not much more than Thailand street food The fare on an ordinary train is B50

title: Fast and Convenient
review: Easy to understand system good signage good coverage (except for the area near the royal palace) inexpensive

title: Worth a visit - very local!
review: We took Sky Train to talat Phlu station walked about 10 minutes to get to the market Interesting experience having meal next to railway and watching the trains passing by Options of street food thai dessert really love this area would recommend a visit

title: Forget the Taxis
review: Afraid to get ripped of by the taxis Just take the City Line to Phaya Thai and take the BTS from there Only 45 Baht and 30mins take you in the city centre I much prefer to mingle with the city and get a feeling of the people living there rather than isolating myself in a taxi

title: Polite local people
review: I am amazed at how polite the local people are to the kids under 6 or 7 years old They will always yield seats for them You can see from their face that they really love children

title: Safer than a taxi
review: It's cheap safe and runs frequently   Our hotel was a block or two away so we hopped on a tuktuk for 100 baht and it dropped us off right in front of the station It was clean and fairly comfortable and took all of 20 minutes to get to the airport It cost much less than a cab took less time and we weren't worried if we'd make it there alive or uninjured  I wanted to slap myself for not trying this sooner

title: Skytrain's subterranean brother!
review: I've been using MRT more than the BTS Skytrain to get around Bangkok but the combination of the two is very powerful  I wouldn't consider staying anywhere in Bangkok that is not a short walk from one of the systems' stations  The alternative to using the two public transit systems is sitting stalled in Bangkok's traffic  MRT is just as clean and efficient as BTS  Unfortunately it uses a different system of payment though they are talking about using a universal card 'any year now'  If you will be riding more than a few times I'd strongly suggest getting a prepaid card It will get you into the system much faster at rush hour when the singletoken machines have long queues  A few downsides to the MRT 1) You can only by a single token from your current station to elsewhere You can't buy a round trip 2) The MRT and the BTS (currently) has two separate systems for multitrip cards

title: Good cheap transport
review: Easy to avoid huge traffic system is also convenient foreigners traveling around Bangkok city is a very comfortable fast ride to any shopping or fooding

title: Crowded..... but a good way to usiness areas of BKKsee the b
review: This train is still a great "value" if you want to get around to some of the main business areas of Bangkok  And now offers service to the airport

title: It'll get you there, but it's crowded
review: If ever there was an airport link not being used to it's full potential it's this one I know the express service hasn't run in a number of years but I feel that the current allstations service isn't frequent enough nor the trains long enough to really cope with the amount of traffic they get On each of the times I was used it it was full as we left the airport and more people tried to squeeze on at each stop  Cheaper than a taxi by far Possibly less hassle Potentially quicker (but not always) but overall far far less comfortable

title: Bangkok Skytrain is a good system
review: The train has AC and a reasonable map ticketing is easy for someone speaking or reading english  Reasonable cost of about 2030 Baht to use  However must pay separately to use MRT line  Could use a more extensivse system

title: Safe / Efficient Transportation Option
review: On our recent visit to Bangkok we made frequent use of the MRT  We found it safe inexpensive and efficient  We were pleasantly surprised by its cleanliness and order

title: Cheap, fast and clean.
review: Excellent Trains are cheap regular and clean (no freenewspapers in sight) Bangkok is humid so it's great to get on an air conditioned train after a long day shopping or sightseeing  No haggling with tuktuk drivers

title: Nice mode of transportation
review: The Airport Rail Link is good service Frequency of running is good They are clean It is better to take this service than hire a taxi while visiting the main business areas it saves time

title: So easy!
review: Think they run every 10mins or soreally cheap and the staff are helpful

title: Efficient, clean and easy to use
review: Easy to work out where you need to be going regular service and always someone on hand to help if you need it

title: Efficient travel into / out of town
review: If you are a single traveler or even two probably the best way into the city or back to the airport Trains are good  running frequently Also very affordable Only improvements could be ac room at station while waiting (on way back to airport) and better connectivity in the city Where there are 'connections' eg to metro you need to walk a bit and climb stairs (bear this in mind if you have anything other than a small case or luggage)

title: Wow
review: Everything  at the skytrain is so organised  and clean  Perfect  to use while you're  on holidays there  Very safe as well

title: Easy and cheap
review: Hard to get change to buy tickets but it was very easy to follow the map and it wasnt overcrowded like we thought it might be

title: Easy Service but Crowded!
review: We had around 8 hours to kill waiting for our flight from Suvarnabhumi so we decided to take the train into central Bangkok to do a bit of last minute shoppingeating  The tourist information kiosk at the airport (1st flr) advised us to go to Makkasan and get the MRT to Sukumvit or Si Lom  The ticket system is pretty simple you just pick the station you want to go to (single journey only) and they will give you the option of how many people are travelling (this is all in English)  You pay your money (it's very good value  i think we paid 35 Baht each) and you get a token which you scan at the ticket barrier  There are manned ticket kiosks too if you need them and the attendants all speak English  The train is very busy think London Underground crowded and on the journey into Bangkok there were no announcements and the signage at the stations aren't great so we had to count how many stations we had been to to ensure we didn't miss our stop (however on the journey back there were announcements plus we were going to the last station so wasn't an issue) It's a great way to ensure you don't get tied up in the Bangkok traffic jams so I recommend for ease of service and reliability but not for the overcrowding which I expect could be terrible with loads of luggage with you  We had left our luggage at the Left Luggage counter in Suvarnabhumi (4th floor for departures or 2nd floor for arrivals)  Excellent 24hr service 100 Baht for each piece of luggage but they have restrictions no electricals or items of value should be left with them

title: Easy way to get around
review: Our hotel boat provided a free shuttle to a BTS station We found it clean and was  well airconditioned  If you don't have the proper change  you need to wait in a line and an attendant will help you and provide you with change You then go to a machine to purchase your ticket ( a 2 step process) The sky train does connect with the subway in 3 stations It is the fastest way to get around the city and bypass the traffic  Very inexpensive

title: Good service and price
review: As with BTS you can get day and multi day passes I prefer being above ground but you usually need both to get everywhere

title: One of the best ways to get around Bangkok
review: I've visited Bangkok many times not my most favorite place to be now If your in a hurry to get around because the traffic is SOOO Bad the best way is a motor bike taxi (on every street corner nearly) this can be a little bit on the wild side but is by far the quickest The Skytrain is the next alternative and maybe safer If your a budding motorbike rider like me you'll take the risk on the bike Good luck

title: Well marked instructions for purchasing tickets from machine, best way around the city
review: Traffic in Bangkok is not worth fighting  even in a Tuk Tuk you can be stopped for long periods of time in traffic Motorcycles are fast but dangerous and most no longer give the passengers a helmet The Skytrain is wonderful Goes often tickets easy to get at machine (good instructions in English) or at a booth Even crowded the people are courteous and do not push to get on or off

title: Most convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: Easiest way to get around Bangkok the city which has too much of road traffic Some of the  stations are connected  to Malls and Hotels via the Sky walks

title: Very easy to use
review: Very easy and cheap to use the gave maps inside the bts stations I highly recommend going to the weekend market using the sky train

title: Simplest way to get around town
review: If you want to travel around Bangkok quickly  this is the way It is easy to use and tickets can be bought from a machine or a real person There are maps everywhere making it easy to see how to get where you need to go We found locals really wanting to help us It is air conditioned and reasonably priced so what more could you ask

title: Amazing!
review: I highly recommend using the link as a cheap and quick way to get into the city from the airport You're bypassing all of the traffic and it links you into the BTS

title: Best & quickest mode of travel
review: helpful staff at times gets a bit crowded but great way to to travel the city  Ask your hotel or look at posted routes to know your exit

title: fantastic
review: so easy to use buy a card that you can top up at the ticket booth one that is not for tourists as it is valid for 5 years and can be passed on the friends top it up for at least 200 baht this will save you the time standing in cues

title: take the city train, and save $$$
review: It only takes 10 minutes longer and might be quicker if one is ready to depart  Fast cleansometimes crowded

title: cheap quick travel
review: if you want to get around bangkok quickly cheap and fast use the sky train no hassle just on and off you can buy a day pass or just pay for your 1 journey

title: easy to use
review: I used this on my most recent trip to Bangkok and it was everywhere and easy to use People are friendly and will help you if you get lost

title: Favourite public transport
review: After years of dealing with miserable public transport systems it was a pleasure riding the sky trains  From smiling people to crazy cat food adverts to views of the city I actually looked forward to riding the skytrain

title: Train to Airport
review: I took the train to airport from BTS  Phaya Thai Station to the Airport Station is about 6 stations (30 mins) away Convenient and easy  One option to get away from traffic jam

title: Fast way to commute
review: I liked the skytrain as its very fast way to commute Nice n clean stations The staff is friendly n ready to help Easy ways are present to locate trains leading to ur destination

title: Fabulous trip into the city
review: We rode the airport rail link for the first time yesterday and were completely satisfied To ride from the airport to the final stop in the city is 45 bahta fraction of the cost of a taxi We didn't have luggage with us and thought to ourselves that the ride would be complicated with luggage but there were many riding with luggage Along the route are metro stations that link to the BTS stations giving you lots if options are getting around Bangkok Follow the signs at the airport for rail link which is on the bottom floor marked B Grab a free map of the transit system on that floor Excellent ride for an excellent price

title: Quick and cheap
review: can be very very crowded at certain times of the day Fast and efficient service Not really user friendly if you have a lot of luggage but for single or couples with one small bag or backpack its great About  40 baht each

title: 12 hours
review: IF you are taking the train to Chiang make sure to get the lower seats on a sleep train and i highly recommend that you stay in the first class rather than second class It is nice but very long They will make announcement of Chiang Mai station make sure it is the right one Look at your GPS or IPHONE he will tell you Chiang mai will be written on a wooden penal if you are at the right place

title: Much cheaper and economical means of transport to the Airport
review: The hotel we were staying at asked for 1200 THB the taxi we came in from Airport to the hotel took 350 (exclusive of toll) but it took me 87 THB to get to the Airport via the BTS (42) and Airport Rail Link (45) Go to Phaya Thai (N2) station of the BTS and then go downstairs and on your East will be the Airport Rail Link Phaya Thai is the first station of Airport Rail Link but still it will get you there on time no extra charges and drops you right inside the Airport

title: Good trip
review: Excellent service and friendly tour guide from MsSara really enjoyable from this trip very recommendedüëçüëçüëç

title: traffic
review: traffic in Bangkok is a nightmare to get around using the sky train is easy and economical Easy once you know how to

title: Travel
review: You can get on the train and in a short time you can be at the main markets in Bangkok or any number of other shopping centres

title: Excellent service
review: Such an excellent public transport facility so good I would not use a taxi It's very easy to find your way around and the cost is extremely reasonable

title: Must use!
review: Very clean andfast way to get from the Airport to the heart of the city in under an hour Very cheap compared with the taxi and free of traffic

title: A Historical Landmark
review: Travel with Local guides from TakeMeTour  This place has so much to learn from it is considered as one of the most dangerous railways   Very beautiful scenery   Cant imagine how the POWs and the forced labourers with difficult living conditions constructed the railway

title: Travel fast.
review: Travelled on the Airport Rail Link several times Fast efficient clean on time easy relaxing as to driving in mega busy Bangkok Cheap and easy to purchase yellow button ( which is the ticket) Simply  GO GO GO Luv it

title: Easy peasy transport around Bangkok
review: Loved the convenience of BTS Skytrain to go virtually anywhere for our touristy treks We stayed centrally and got around to main thoroughfares via BTS Make sure to always have coins on you so you can avoid the lineups for a money change  We also used the BTS to get to the airport and it was extremely convenient Make sure to go early especally during rush hours

title: Great Station Don't Eat At The Foodcourt
review: Safe and friendly station but keep an eye on your valuables Avoid the food court We didn't The food was awful We left it and went to the hawkers for bbq chicken Which was nice

title: Excellent
review: Skytrain is the only way to get around bangkok's busy roads it connects to main shopping centres is spotlessly clean and easy to use and very affordable

title: Easy to use, clean and cheap!
review: Although not an expansive service area it is still a easy to use and cool service to get about central Bangkok Great for shopping trips such as up to Chatuchak market and then on to Siam Square )

title: The Perfect way to Shopping around center of Bangkok
review: BTS was easiest way for traveller to go around center of Bangkok areaThe skytrain has skywalk that good for traveller can walk though siam station to chidlom station The skywalk is clean and safe way to walk in that area Recommend to use skywalk

title: Cheap and Fast
review: Bangkok is known for its traffic jams and one way to avoid is using BTS It is both cheap and best It connect many important tourist destinations

title: Cool Ride
review: Great way to get around town and enjoy the view AC is not quite as effective as the MRT but the scenic aspect is very pleasing Take a ride to Sappan Thaksin and catch the water taxis on the river

title: A valuable piece of history
review: A scenic place to visit at Kanchanaburi which is about 3 hours drive from Bangkok Capital You can be vanpooled from a depot around victory monument for about 140THB There is also a museum around which I recommend to visit to learn about the history the death railway Really interesting stuff such as DEATH also represents the nationalities of those who died building the railway Dutch English Australian Thai and Holland In addition I also recommend the train ride which will take you around hills fields and towns The scenery was beautiful Note that the train is old slow and nonairconditioned

title: Great during Heavy Traffic Hours
review: Very clean efficient and air conditioned  If you are traveling alone with many heavy suitcases I would recommend taking a taxi  I have used this system when going to the airport to meet someone arriving from overseas  They are also building an airport link to the old airport Don Muang but that may only be finished in 2 years

title: Always worth going on the excursion. Enjoyed the experience.
review: The experience was interesting to take the train into the markets The boats were all going same time so hard to shop but I managed mango sticky rice Yummy Enjoyed buying a cold beer as well I like the row boats the motor boats should be banned in the market Very stinky and loud We all disliked this We all liked shopping on foot through the markets and trying all the food and great cloths etc

title: Fastest route to the airport from the city
review: It is really worth using if you have not too heavy luggage running late or just go to pick up someone but you don't drive It can be very crowded as well and has limited operating hours as any public transportation

title: Excited !!!
review: So convenient and the kids enjoyed the rides BTS ticketing staffs were friendly and helpful when we asked for direction and how to connect between trains

title: Dont bother with taxis!
review: Traffic in Bangkok is extreme  my advice is choose a hotel near the BTS and avoid taxis at all cost

title: Speedy
review: A fast efficent way to see the city Stops at almost all the attractions Very clean and safe Also very cheap perfect for the budget traveller

title: Cleanless
review: It is like a underground but it has been the cleanless underground which we have been I strong recommend to move in Bangkok

title: Public transporcie
review: Fab way to get around BKK fairly cheap highly efficient Only problem   freezing interior of trains

title: Cheap & fast
review: Its convenient to travel a fast & clean transportation   45bahts per pax & can reach most of the destination (major malls) its cost THB Bahts500 for taxi with toll fee

title: A great way to beat the traffic
review: If the skytrain goes past where you want to go it is ideal otherwise it is not very extensive and you cant use your skytrain ticket on the underground

title: CROWDED at rush hour, avoid if claustraphobic
review: Definitely the way to go  Traffic in Bangkok is pure misery  BUT if you take the skytrain during rush hour be prepared for something beyond comprehension  It made Tokyo subway look "roomy"  People were absolutely jammed together  Forget about personal space I had several rumps pushed against me with no choice  Each stop seemed to gain more people somehow though many people could not get on at all  Advice  plan to NOT travel around 6pm at all  Travel earlier (best option) or way later

title: Bangkok transport
review: Bangkok has  three modern train services  Sky Train (BTS) Underground (MRT) and Airport Link After navigating your first trip on each you will find that they all are very user friendly  The Sky Train (BTS) or in Thai  Rot Fai Fah (engine in sky) is convenient goes places you want to go is often crowded easy to use and buy tickets but is generally  very hot waiting at the stations   The Underground (MRT) or in Thai Rot Fai Tai Din (engine underground) is easy to buy tickets not crowded cool but generally does not go anywhere you want to go The best station to interchange with the Sky Train is Sukhumvit (MRT name) and Asok (BTS name)  To get from the airport to central Bangkok if you have no or little luggage the  Airport Link is very useful If you have luggage it is very hard work at the connections There are two train types Fast Train that goes to Makkasan (which is not at all convenient for anything) and the Slower Train called the City Line which is a stopping train  and  connects with the BTS at Phaya Thai (in central Bangkok) and is currently very cheap (only Baht 45) and is highly recommended

title: BTS
review: You can go anywhere (almost) by BTS  You may want to consider getting a 199 bht travel card  Not sure what the deal is but there are posters all around the station  Coins are required for most automated ticketing machines so you may want to keep some coins handy  Otherwise you can always get change from station control  Beats waiting in the Bangkok jam in a taxi

title: Max 2 persons otherwise take a taxi
review: Expensive when you're with a family better take a taxi Traveling to the airport and beat rush hour better take the train to avoid traffic jam

title: Really good
review: Really good train service  on time and get you to your stop fast best part is you can ride it to the airport  so amazing for travels

title: Great Service
review: The ticketing system here is very easy and the maps are very much self explanatory The frequency of the skytrain is almost every 10 to 15 mins

title: A lifesaver
review: Morning evening flights which land in Bangkok avoid the rush take the link it will drop you in the heart of the city take a cab ride you will save 45 mins the traffic specially now the Chinese new year is killing worth spending 100  baths rather than spending 700 paying toll and wasting time in traffic

title: Cool method of transport
review: Easy to understand method of traveling Beautifully clean carriages no litter or graffiti great air con & a system where travellers queue to get onto the train instead of a mad stampede A pleasure to use Staff very helpful too

title: fast cheap and affective
review: Don't bother with Taxis sky train is clean fast and very effective it may come across very daunting at first but once you have your daily pass its nothing but easy

title: Excellent facility
review: Regular and frequent on time service Excellent Air conditioned trains English voice over identifying stations as train approaches

title: Just a mean of transportation people
review: Yes it is efficient yes it is clean and the AC is very nice But it is jus a mean of transportation Cannot understan why according to tripadvisor standars this is one of the top things to see in BKK

title: Great mode of transport but sometimes many steps to climb
review: some had an awful lot of steps and walkways and more steps and more steps hard on dodgy knees But cool ac and quick transportation

title: Great Mode of Transport.
review: Went from Nana Station to On Nut This train is the same since last 10 years only change is that the advertising boards which have come before boarding Very comfortable even at peak hours 2 minutes service

title: BRING LOTS OF CHANGE!
review: This is a great way to travel through Bangkok Very convenient and the air conditioned cars make it a very comfortable escape from the heat The stops are quite close so you won't be on the train very long  To get from DMK airport to the skytrain you need to take bus A1 out of exit 6 The fare for the bus is 30 baht per person and it takes you to Mo Chit station   The only downside is that if you're travelling during rush hour or at a very popular attraction there are huge lines for tickets You can only buy tickets from the ticket machines NOT the ticket booth The ticket booth only gives you change for ticket machines So keep as much change on you as possible to avoid lining up   The average trip should cost you 42 baht The most expensive fare is 52 baht

title: very convenient and practical
review: its a practical way to get in to the city without any hassle and bargaining with the taxi drivers in Bkk Just try to come early especially when you are not coming from the first station if your flight is around 10 PM You wouldn't want to be caught in the crowd during the rush hour and you wont get enough space for your luggage

title: Very efficient and reliable way to move
review: I wish there was an Airport Rail link from our other international airport (DMK) here in Bangkok because some times I just book a flight from BKK because of the Rail Link being so convenient to get in or out of town  Not only is it cheap but at rush hour when you see the taxis just crawling you are zipping by in a nice AC train without any worries about missing your flight  Coming from BKK the link is also very convenient because it links you to the BTS which in turns also links you to the MRT so you have pretty much the whole city at your disposal

title: Super useful, super packed
review: Skytrain is really easy to use and get around (its about $4 per person for a full day pass) its very clean and air conditioned (which was required given how hot it was) But it was PACKED so be ready to be packed in like sardines Easy to get to subwaymetro line from it too (requires a separate ticket)

title: Great way to see the country side!
review: We were on a group tour of about 18 people So they booked our ticket in advance for us We were traveling from Phitsanulok at 855am and arriving in Bangkok at 240pm in midJanuary We were riding second class which cost 339baht ($1450cad) I am not sure if they had a group discount or not It had above head storage but mostly only fit carry on suit cases (perfect for us) and some travel packs Big rolling suit cases had to stay on by the doors in specific areas If you are planning on traveling with large suitcase this might not be the best transportation for you The seats were tight but very comfortable The bathrooms were grossed in the terminal and on the train  Locals got on and off selling food & beverages for very reasonable prices   It was a great way to see some of the country side while moving from town to town

title: Skin the traffic
review: Bangkok‚Äôs traffic is so worse that you waste half of your day on the road in traffic so obviously nobody would want to ruin holiday in traffic Best way to take BTS its very convenient and user friendly to reach destination fastüëçüëç

title: Quick Easy Cheap
review: We commuted from Airport to other Shopping destinations through Airport link and BTS Gives you a upper view of Bangkok and is much cheaper and faster Saves you from the Road Traffic All you need is a map which you will get in plenty at hotels and you can commute at nominal costAlthough it was crowded at night return trip to airport locals were kind enough to give us seats considering our infant in hand So our total experience of Rail Metro was excellent Also you don't feel cheated because the Cabs charge high unless you know what to pay Ticket vending machines are very easy to use

title: Fast smooth and user friendly
review: Accessible efficient cost effective and fast  As the sky train is exactly thatso high it's a delight to look into the many delights of bangkok's many shopping centres and boutiques dentists () Andother attractions from a lofty perspective  The system is clean and if you have a fear of heights you can always view the on board televisual advertisements that play non stop Usually advertising skin bleaching and whitening agents () Ironic as many years European and antipodean cousins come here for a tan Whilst all commercials in Thailand use huge amounts of light on presenters faces to make them more () Appealing  Anyhow do use the sky train it's really a treat If you are a fan of architecture as I am it's amazing particularly if you get a seat then you have a bird'seye view

title: Wish I'd used this before!
review: The Airport Rail Link is a mere 20 minutes from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the BTS Phaya Thai station from where one can connect to the BTS Skytrain and travel speedily and in comfort to the train station closest to one's destination and if necessary finish the trip with a taxi can or tuktuk I'm my opinion this is hands down better than utilizing the airport's taxis which unfortunately often refuse to use their meters and greatly overcharge customers One drawback to the trains though they may be crowded

title: Efficient Airport to Bangkok Link
review: Bought a ticket from the machine which gives you change and a travel token for 40baht less than a ¬£1 for a fast efficient and clean ride to the centre of Bangkok Because the train track is elevated you can admire the views on your way

title: No Cheating by Taxi Driver
review: BTS can basically take you to lots of tourist spots without the hassle of negotiating fee with taxi driver or even cheating by them By buying oneday pass at THB140 you can travel to distant spots without queuing up for single ride BTS ticket

title: Fast, clean, AC
review: Very clean and air conditioned trains  Beats the terrible traffic in many parts of Bangkok  Not as cheap as the bus but if BTS is closeby then it is a good option compared to being stuck in traffic in a taxi or bus

title: Fast and stable
review: Very convenient and fast moving Very stable and comfortable If you miss the train  don't worry  you need not wait very long and the next one will be here very fast I heard that there are toilets in the station but no

title: Great mode of transportation
review: Was extremely happy that i was able to use this mode of transportation Convenientfast and efficient

title: One of the best public transport systems  in the world!
review: A wonderful way to get around  Bangkok Fast efficient ckean and easy to use Once of the best public transport systems that I have been on

title: fastest moving in Bangkok
review: If you want to move fast within Bangkok the Skytrain no matter which line is the best alternative Unluckily the lines still don't reach all corners so that you have to take afterwards either a Taxi of a Tuk Tuk (preferably though more expensive) The only disadvantage of the Skytrain is the relatively high price of 35+ Bath

title: A great little system
review: Very surprised at how efficient easy and clean the skytrain was I suggest using this as the primary method of getting around as Bangkok traffic can be brutal at times

title: Convenient Transportation In Bangkok
review: MRT is a convenient and easy way to go around in Bangkok  It is also cheap and run frequently  It is also quick and safe

title: Would recommend #9 sleeper train.
review: I did allot of research into the best way to get from Bangkok to Chiang Mai We decided to choose the train and from reviews opted for the number 9 sleeper train 2nd class AC Many of my friends have previously got the bus but I liked the idea of having you're own bed and air conditioning especially as we'd be travelling over night  The trains are very clean and look newer than I was expecting The beds are laid out like bunks I opted for top bunk but infact the top bunks are lighter so if you're looking for a good nights sleep then shot gun the bottom bunk A member of staff comes and makes the bed for you with fresh new sheets and you are given a blanket and pillow  The train is fairly smooth and quiet so is easy to get a good nights sleep The train stops every now and again which is why I think it takes 13hrs but it's saving you a nights worth of accommodation so I think it's a great way to travel is good value for money and would recommend to anyone looking to travel from Bangkok to Chiang Mai

title: Quick, easy & a great way to travel around Bangkok!
review: We didn't take the Skytrain till our last day in Bangkok & I could kick myself for not doing it sooner It was clean quick & so easy to get around such a busy place Tickets were easy to purchase they make great souviners too

title: Fast, cheap and crowded
review: The Skytrain is the only way to beat the heavy and constant traffic jams in Bangkok and it is a must for getting across town It's cheap efficient and clean but it is mostly very crowded Look out for pickpockets

title: The most convenient
review: We totally recommend the rabbit card We spend a few days in Bangkok and it's clearly the best choice

title: Cheap and Efficient
review: This is the easiet and cheapest way (80bhat) to get to downtown central Bangkok It is at the basement of the airport and the trip duration is around 45 minutes to get to Asok BTS

title: Tick two boxes in one go!
review: Nice manner from the guide who also provided useful tips for this and other Thailand experiences Went on a Wednesday Timing coincides with many other tour groups so inevitably very crowded at Railway market and floating market Returned to Bangkok  at 3304pm (beating the traffic) but I was hoping a 'half day' tour would be a morning tour starting and finishing earlier The aircon on the minibus could have been a little bit cooler and maybe using the microphone would help Overall an efficient and pleasant way to get to two popular destinations that are difficult to reach on your own

title: effortless and good
review: excellent addition to the city nice and easy way to ease on in and good connection at makassan and end terminal for the btsmrt well worth it

title: Top! Would do it again.
review: Very good guide Lots of allround information about Bangkok & Thailand Would definitely go again Lots of insider tips including about prices

title: Best way to get around
review: We travelled from our hotel by Grab twice and both times spent an extra 30 mins due to the horrendous and ever present traffic jams There is a flyover being built in the centre and 4 lanes of busy traffic are forced into 2 lanes We tried the BTS service for 6 stops from Nana at 30bht each which took just 10 mins not over 40 and 210 bht by Grab Try itthe steps up to the overhead are a pain but the trains are clean with ac

title: Clean, fast and economical way to get around Bangkok
review: This elevated railway system is a great way to get around Bangkok especially those places that are not accessible by river ferry Avoid the rush hour but otherwise it's clean and pleasant

title: GETTING AROUND
review: Getting around is easy by using the "Skytrain"  a 'Day Ticket' for unlimited travel can be purchased from station Ticket Offices priced at 140 Baht However morning & evening 'peaks' are most definitely 'Crush Hours' and the airconditioning in the carriages can be pretty cold for anyone wearing 'light' clothing

title: Wahhh
review: this is the best way to go city if you are single or family members I think time saving no no need to think about traffic very goodhelping nature of all staff

title: fast and efficient
review: i love the skytrain it takes you around bangkok in double quick time and its very inexpensive i wished they had one in pattaya

title: Quick and convenient.
review: Quick and convenient way to get to Bangkok We had to get to Hualampong which required one switchover which was pretty painless

title: Great Way to Get to Downtown Bangkok Quickly
review: I travel to Bangkok International Airport 2 or 3 times a year I always take the airport rail link to the BTS I enjoyed the express service but unfortunately it is no longer an option however the city line is still way better than taking a taxis and only adds 15 minutes more to the final destination And it is a cheap (45 baht) and efficient way to travel to the city of Bangkok

title: Great experience on historical railway
review: We had a ride on the Death Railway as part of our Bridge Over the River Kwai tour for a one and half hour ride  Was a fantastic ride for the historical significance and experience and also the wonderful scenery that can be viewed from the train  Recommend the first class cabin (300 baht) as it is less crowded more comfortable and you get provided water and snacks

title: Good public transport mode
review: Convenient fast and economical  public transport mode for all in Bangkok with connectivity to city buses and sky train

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: BTS system is easy to use and navigate Rates are affordable Only advise is to get a map of the rail lines

title: Fast, Efficient and Cheap Mode of Transport
review: Great way of getting round Bangkok at a cheap rate It's safe clean and efficient

title: Easy to navigate, inexpensive, great resource for travelers
review: We rode the train multiple times while in Bangkok It is clean safe and easy to navigate Our rides were often under a dollar one way Even a novice traveler will feel safe using the train system

title: Scenic way to get across town to avoid the congestion
review: While the streets were gridlocked the skytrain moves around quickly and relatively inexpensively Fares are dependent on the distance you travel (1552 Baht) The trains are clean and the signs & announcements are in English so it's very easy to get around Unfortunately the skytrain or subway does not run into the old city so you'll need to either connect with a bus or water taxi to get there This makes for a scenic trip but it also means allow 4560 min to get to the Palace Area from Saladeng Also the train charges children full fare if they are over a certain height Don't remember what the height was but our 4 yr old was over the height for full fare

title: Best way to get around central Bangkok
review: If you don't wanna be stuck in hours of unpredictable traffic jams and the place you're wanting to go isn't too far from one of the two lines the skytrain is really the best mode of transport to use It's pretty efficient and faster than taking a cab cheap too The only hassle is during rush hour when it get very packed this can be annoying but overall a good way to easily get from A to B

title: Best way to travel around the city and to international airport
review: Save time money and mood by utilizing the Skytrain After getting scammed again and again by taxis (even metered taxis will take you the longest way to your destination possible)

title: It's public transportation.
review: I don't understand why this is the top attraction I'm very confused It's public transportation sure the view is nice and it's clean and fast but I would not tell my friends to vist this Your in Bangkok there is so much more to see

title: Finished too early
review: Very convenient to reach the town from the airport which located in nowhere plus airport taxi are very good at taking advantage This one is recommended as trustworthy Only few problems that bothered me it's stop too early which it's around midnight and secondly it takes long time to cath the next one

title: Worthed the trip !
review: I took a day trip from Bangkok to see the Bridge of the River Kwai but I discovered so much more Took the train ride for about two hours Was just  beautiful Saw fields of tapioca banana trees mountain range line of the Myanmar border rode along the beautiful river Worth the trip and time However that trip was matched with a trip to an elephant farm that you should avoid at all cost = Animal and children exploitation  That will be subject of another review concerning that specific farm Chose to go to the falls instead

title: Just like the normal train but nice
review: The train looks well maintained and easy to use especially for foreigners who do not read Thai They also have exact fare selfservice payment But the train and train station tends to be crowded atnear Chatuchak market

title: easy transportation aBangkok
review: Sky train is very convenient but way overcrowded You have to push your way into train quite often Try to travel in off hours

title: Very clean and efficient.
review: Directions in english are available but in some stations not translated to a ticket buying machines a little trouble of following sometimes Locals are very friendly to help

title: Touristy but a good place for food
review: This place is on every visitor's itinerary and it can be a bit too crowded We caught pictures of the train running with people on board but what we loved most was food from the pushcart vendors nearby It was cheap and delicious (Or maybe we were just too hungry)

title: Good and cheap
review: Took the train from airport and it works really well If it is a rush hour train is faster It is cheap as well

title: Great Service, On Time;
review: This is probably the easiest way to get around Bangkok avoiding the notorious traffic jams It may not be as comfortable as flagging a taxi but you definitely will get to your destination on time without having to be stuck in a jam for an hour or more This is good

title: Easy!
review: I was nervous about using the BTS as I was with my two kids on my own (age 5 & 8) while my husband was in hospital But it was so simple and the kids loved it   There was a stop out front of our hotel and stops at all the main attractions If you are unsure there are ticket cubicles at each stop where the staff can help you Ask for the map if you aren't sure Each stop is well sign posted for entrances and exits   Price is cheap transport is fast  much faster than taxis we found  My only comment  it might be a bit daunting if you have kids in prams just because they get so squished and navigating would be hard

title: I return here often to use the train
review: I love this train ride over the bridge on the Kwai and northwards to Nam Tok The train is an older one with windows are open but it is all fun and it is a rush to be brought deep into the countryside of Thailand into the mountains

title: Crazy markets fun!
review: A fun trip The railway markets were bonkers but fun The flaring markets were more relaxed and we really enjoyed the authentic Thai food at the open air food court Tip hit up the coconut ice cream  the coconuts come from the nearby plantations so the flavour is awesome  The mangos are also local and ripe  the mango and sticky rice dessert got hoovered up by Mrs Uberdan   Be ready for a reasonable drive each way to get there  circa 2 hours each way Worth the wait and most of us had a sleep on the comfy air conditioned van

title: quick, cheap, clean
review: Traffic in Bangkok is horrendous  If you book a hotel not too far from one of the airport link stations you can walk to and from or get a cheap taxi  Only cost me 40bht on the train each way You'll save money and a lot of time

title: To much advertising
review: A perfect way to get around in the city It¬¥s clean and pretty easy to find your way   But all this advertising I almost went dizzy I have never seen so much in one place

title: Very fast and cheap
review: Very good mode of transport very fast cheap and  hassle free   just check on net or ask someone for nearest station where you want to visit

title: Busy busy busy
review: Don't use this if you suffer from claustrophobia However on the plus side a Filipina maid groped me in the crush )

title: It's fast but often very crowded
review: It's fast but often very crowded  Sometimes you can't even squeeze in and have to wait for the next one for a vey long time  There should be more trains and come more often esp during the rush hours

title: Best Bangkok water and train market tour!
review: This tour was simply amazing Worth every penny and a definite must do in Bangkok Sara was a wonderful tour guide and provided us tons of information about the history of both the train and water market and Thailand in general She made sure all of us were taken care of and even brought us to her favorite restaurant   1010 tour

title: Great Travel
review: Easy to use and speedy Easiest way to get around  especially to MBK Centre a great shopping experience

title: Airport to Chatrium Riverside
review: This is the cheapest and fastest way to get to the hotel  the train takes you from the airport to a station about 1 km from the hotel as you get off the train walk towards the river for about 3 minutes and the hotel boat will take you directly to the hotel dock

title: Well located
review: A tad confusing  you queue for a ticket only to be given coins to join another queue at the ticket machine  Passengers were impeccably lined up to let people off the train first no stress no pushing  Once we worked the system out it was easy to use

title: Fantastic
review: Brilliant way to get around the city staff very helpful in stations if not sure where your going and which ticket to buy

title: Fastest and cheapest way to and fro Airport
review: Fastest way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to down town 45baht and 30mins to Phaya Thai Station which is linked to Phaya Thai BTS Most convenient way to beat peak hour traffic

title: quick access  from city to airport, cheap.
review: This service is great if you not have to much luggage with you It is not starting from the city centre Hence you will need to use the normal city BTS and connect to the airport rail link If you wish to avoid taxies and not have much luggage you can use this facility

title: Excellent transportAtion
review: Super convenient Runs every 23 minutes Reasonably priced  Too bad it didn't run to Khao San Road or to Chinatown

title: Good
review: The ticket cost is little expensive (around 25 Baht for travelling from one station to say next to next station) The speed and management of the skytrain is great  the announcements are clear (in English as well) and well in advance Overall a descent experience

title: Love it
review: Greatest Thing  Ever  Especially if you need airport transportation and a key to the city  Very clean

title: Super Clean and Cool!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a jewel of Bangkok Super clean well air conditioned inexpensive and the absolute best way to get around parts of Bangkok and avoid sitting in traffic jams

title: Good way to get around, depending on what time you go
review: The maps on the train are crazy and it's hard to understand but it's cheap and it's fast Depending on what time of the day you are traveling you are either going to have a smooth ride or the worst time of your life with sweaty thais gawking at the "whites" (if you are white) We ended up getting off at an industrial area once and it was the wrong stop for us but it was kind of cool because we walked into the city again on our own and that was 2 pretty interesting hours

title: Convenient
review: We use skytain every day on holiday Positive is fast cheap and easy Negative is sometimes busy and some place cannot go

title: Transport
review: very crowded but the best way to travel around bangkok

title: Disappointed
review: There were many great parts to this tour  The driver and private car the lunch was superb  But unfortunately the negative was too much  The tour guide was a nicekind man but the lowerest energy guide we have ever had  He literally slept in the car from Bangkok to our destination and on the way back the same  If we had questions we didn't want to wake him up to ask  At Hells fire canyon I was really frustrated to read that the audio guide would have told me more than the guide  He had advice about photo ops but very limited about history and relevance to the sites we were seeing  A total waste of time for the private tour  I am not sure if it was lack of energy or lack of knowledge on the guide's part

title: Great way to get around
review: We used this as a primary mode of transportation from our hotel with our 4 year old twins  It was clean cheap and easy to use and gets you to a lot of the main tourist attractions  It was at certain times of day very crowded but still a great mode of transportation

title: Crowded but cool
review: Very crowded and you are lucky if you get a seat Sometimes you dont even have room to stand inside the train so you must wait for the next train which takes maybe 510 minutes to arrive But it has AC so thats good You also get a very nice view of the city through the windows

title: Really worth it
review: About 50 sgd for 2 attractions and a half dday It was really enjoyable and affordable and I made a new friend on the trip

title: Good.
review: Liked the air conditioning and the scenic views over Bangkok if you could get near a window Not having been to Thailand since 2007 I was shocked at how busy it has become I guess it can only get worse

title: Free river launch to sky train and ferry jetty.
review: Loved sightseeing from the river easy access to river ferry boats and markets Recommend night market with Big Wheel and lots of shops and restaurants

title: Ronking
review: This airport rail link was so accessible service are good staff are very attentive they are willing to assist and attend your queries in case you don‚Äôt know which platform are you going to

title: Efficient and cost saving way of getting to and from airport (BKK)
review: Took the airport rail to Phaya Thai which is the final station that is situated near town (Pratunam) It is very efficient as it only takes approximately 2030 mins to reach the destination compared to taking a coach or taxi from the airport which can take you 45 mins to more than an hour depending on traffic condition It is also very cheap as it only cost abt 45 baht per person The only feedback is the staff Isn't Thailand supposed to be the Land of Smile But we were greeted with very grouchy and unfriendly staff at the airport rail station I guess this needs improvement Other than that all perfect

title: Great connection, but cold!
review: Make sure you bring a jacket on the skytrain as the air conditioning in the trains are cranked up quite a bit Trains run regularly well

title: Bangkok Airport to Hotel to Airport
review: I used this rail upon arriving at the airport directly to my hotel in Pratunam Everything was a breeze NO hassle in traveling from the airport to hotel and back to the airport As long as you have a handy luggage no problem walking from the rail station to the hotel I would  definitely use this rail again when I go back to Bangkok this November

title: Maeklong Railway Market and Damnoensaduak Floating Market with a Small Group
review: We had 9 people in our group and it was a very enjoyable experience  what an eye opener Imagine the excitement of a market that is right on the railway tracks with trains coming by 8x per day Our guide Tawee was excellent  he had everything well researched and gave us brilliant talks about the markets we visited and even Thailand in general We wish him a wonderful year ahead The tour itself was well organized and everything ran like clockwork even with unexpected delays (not by the tour operator but by guests) The length of the tour was just right  anything longer would have been exhausting A fabulous experience not to be missed

title: Skytrain
review: We travelled on the Skytrain to go to a Shopping Centre from the Shangrila hotel I cannot give you the name of the station we left at or arrived at as the Thai names are difficult to remember It was about 7 stops and we decided to try and miss the worst of the commuter work rush and started out at about 930 There are 2 to 3 flights of stairs to get to the station and no lifts were seen  At the platform area there is a diagram of the stations on route We had the name of the station we needed and proceeded to the pay window  The lady there spoke enough English to change our large note and she told us again the station we needed and how much it would be We were told to go over to the machine and pay At the machine you have a board with station names on and the fee to the side Ours was 37 bahts per person about 84 pence only one way tickets no return tickets Thai people are respectful of others and they queue in lines where they know the train doors will open when stopped it is respectful to join a queue line We boarded a train about 5 minutes later There are very few seats and mainly standing only also the train was full Plenty of overhead straps and poles to hang onto and you do need them as with most trains they can be jerky Most shopping centres open at 10 o'clock so our fellow passengers were mainly young workers all on their mobile phones Overall I enjoyed our short journey and it gives a different perspective of the city with excellent views Thai people are so helpful and there is no need to worry if you get lost there is always someone around that will help you also travelling by Skytrain is very inexpensive but if you have a problem with stairs or walking any length make sure they have a lift available first

title: Easy and fast
review: BTS is the above ground public transit  the counterpart to the MRT   The trains are well air conditioned and easy to figure out which is great (English and Thai available)

title: Quick and cheap
review: It's so much better to use than a taxi if you can as it's quicker and cheaper and gives you a better view coming into bangkok

title: Cheap as Chips
review: This is a great way to get from the airport to the city We took this service returning to Bangkok after 2 12 weeks of tripping around Thailand We never took it back to the Airport as there was no escalators or lifts at the stop near our hotel to the Skytrain to connect with Airport Rail Instead we took a CRAZY taxi I will a bit more carefully when choosing a taxi next time

title: Good transport
review: it"s the best way to travel around Bangkok Most ticket sellers can speak English but you have to be sure which way you are travelling The BTS  also has the metro line near it Avoid peak times unless you want to be a squashed sardine

title: Great experience!
review: Sara was probably one my favourite part of this journey friendly and fun Felt like home About the tour we have the opportunity to see more than we expected Amazing day

title: Bangkok's Skytrain is a must for easy sightseeing with less traffic
review: We only had a few days in Bangkok before heading on to Phuket so we wanted to get the most out it The Skytrain is super efficient and takes unnecessary traffic delays away from your sightseeing itinerary It's easy to use Most hotels will give you a city map which shows the train map as well Inside the train carriages are telly screens and as you approach a station the station name will appear along the bottom of the screen making sure you know where you are Ideally located stations means that you're never too far from main areas The Skytrain tracks run above the roads so you just use the escalators or lifts to reach the streets below

title: Brilliant
review: Very affordable and spotless clean Very easy to navigate and station announcements in Thai and English But a day ticket for around ¬£220Just be wary of the tut tut touts when leaving any station they will tell you a whole host of lies and rip you off

title: No Fuss - Simple and Direct
review: We decided to forgo an expensive (relatively speaking) taxi or airport transfer and to take the train From landing and collecting our bags it was simple to stroll down to the trains and catch one (35 baht per person)  we transferred at Petchaburi to catch the Metro (as our hotel was close to a metro station) Nice and easy All signs are in English and in Thai  no problems at all and this was our first time in Bangkok And so much better than sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Quick way to get around
review: Definitely should be the preferred choice of transportation if you want to avoid all the traffic jams and want peace of mind safe reliable and cheap

title: Great way to travel!
review: Loved this was a very cheap convenient way to get around unlike England Got you there quick away from the busy traffic Felt safe too were security as you went and at the stations anyone with rucksacks got them checked

title: Yeah, the SKY train will save you a lot of money for travelling
review: If you are in the city this train is gonna save you from alot of troubles you might go through Sky train will lead you to any destination that you actually want to go and the place you are looking for will be a few minutes walk from the stations it takes you to You need to hold the google maps from one hand while travelling We only took a cab once during our 7 days stay and sky train became a part of everyday life For the first time it could be vrry confusing But after one ride you'll learn the whole routine Recommended to use if you need to travel alot

title: Great inexpensive way to get into the city
review: If you don't have too much luggage and want to avoid some of the infamous traffic jams that the city is renowned for this is a great inexpensive way to get  into Bangkok It will take you into Bangkok and you can catch a taxi or tuk tuk there

title: Fast clean and oh so cool
review: This is a great way to get around the city if only to cool down for a few minutes from the heat and humidity The link is a good way of getting to the railway station and the beginning of Chinatown to all the attractions in the Sukhumavit road area all the way down to Silom and Lumpini The stations all have ticket machines of ticket counters for change or tickets the signage is easy to follow and the station guides are very clear to use The security is a little tighter than it used to be since the terrorist attacks on Bangkok in 2015 but this only makes you feel safer There is a security gate you walk through and you may be asked to open your bags as a security officer is on duty at all stations

title: Get the rabbit card...
review: The skytrain has gone through several improvements over the last few years   The 4 most noticable are  1) higher prices   It wasnt too long ago 40 baht got you to either end of train lines   Now you need 65+ baht to go from one end to another  if you include extensions   2) safety doors to prevent suicide jumps or accidents until the train comes to a complete stop   3) BTS transit lines are getting extended  It's a good thing   4) longer lines   Use the rabbit card to breeze through the lines   Rabbit card can be used in just about any 7eleven in bangkok and also lots of shops including Siam Paragon seems to accept Rabbit Card  So not only BTS stations use it   Only downfall is that MRT cannot accept it They want you to get their card

title: Great to get around especially during rush hour
review: air conditioned carriages are a bonus  Minus will be having to walk up so many stairs to get to the platform  This was a little difficult when getting the train to the airport with luggage

title: BTS is great
review: The easiest way to get around Bangkok Combined with ferries and Tuktuk‚Äôs the BTS makes Bangkok incredibly accessible and cheap to get around It‚Äôs also air conditioned too

title: BTS Bangkork
review: Bangkork is crowded and BTS is playing very important role on it to move people from place to place   I find the BTS system is so simple easy to use and convenient We can get the ticket by using note or coins on some station and some are only coin accepted to by ticket Therefore you need to change the coin at the counter

title: great way to travel and cheap
review: We took the rail to travel around town we had a day pass so we could get on and off as we wished The can be crowded so you may have to stand but this wasn't a issue  Best way to get to the markets

title: Quick and cheap
review: Easy walk from arrivals to station easy ticketing regular trains smooth ac travel to a large station with access to transport Couldn't be better

title: Transit
review: Skytrain is user friendly air conditioned efficient cost based on distance travelled but still relatively cheap allows easy access to waterfront

title: better than singapore
review: first I would like to say it was as if I had travelled back 20 years ago when the Singapore new trains are starting in use it is wonderful how the thais have maintain the trains and mostly are always on time unlike Singapore which always breaks down even till date u still can hear people complaining anyway it is amazing that the trains are on time and it is best way to travel in Bangkok as the traffic congestion is terrible fascinating thai have really maintain it well  well done

title: Best mood of public transportation in Bangkok
review: Please go around the city with BTS which is convenientreliable and cheapOpen until 12pm midnight Easily accessible to most of famous places around the cityRecommend to buy daily pass at 140 baht if you need to hop inout the city

title: liked Skytrain but limits to where it can get you
review: one of the first things we did was get a Rabbit card knowing we would access the Skytrain system multiple times  the trains are in good shape and during rush hours the trains are packed  you are looking for the end station in the direction you want to go similar to many metro systems in other cities around the world  similarly to this mode of transportation there are limits to how close you can get to some of your destinations because Skytrain does not operate in many areas of Bangkok leaving you to access their underground MRT (that also has its limits) or to travel by bus taxi or tuktuk  definitely worth having a multipass Rabbit card or one with enough value in it because the queue to purchase single trips were always long at the booth or at the machines  we found security presence on the platforms to be good and people are good at lining up to board the trains  would highly recommend accessing websites that show you not only what is around the different stations but also show you the layout of the station so you have some orientation of which exit to take and what streets are nearby  being above ground it gives you sights of the city as well

title: A lot easier than I expected
review: The only mode of transportation you really need to hear covers pretty much the whole city of Bangkok very inexpensive reliable and comfortable

title: Pretty efficent rail system
review: Had a quick return trip on the BTS from our hotel to MBK Very happy and a cheap way to get around above the traffic

title: Best Way to move in Bangkok
review: Due to the terrible traffic in BKK I can only recommend to use the BTS to everyone clean fast just the best way to move around

title: A great way to go to City centre
review: The Airport Railway is one of the best ways to go to Bangkok City Centre from the airport It is very fast very confortable and you have connection with MTR and BTS

title: Best means of transport in Sukhumvit
review: Very cheap and the easiest way to travel in BKK in the area

title: very easy to commute
review: nice and clean trains excellent commute systemdo travel all around the city with its sister btswell done

title: Disastrous
review: Schedule incomprehensible leaves you in the middle of nowhere with no taxis and a long walk to the MRT subway Advertised checkin service only available for Thai Airways flights Its quick and clean once you get on the train but the wait was at least 45 minutes

title: Cheap and easy travel...
review: The Skytrain links all sides of Bangkok and is the best way to travel  As tourists we didn't know what to expect but it is so simple to use nonthreatening cheap and quick We bought a day pass to save the hassle of buying different tickets each time we wanted to change Can get crowded but you are in a city centre

title: Easy to Use Transportation
review: The Sky Train is easy to use once you get the hang of it  We purchased a card for 100 Baht ( $400Cdn ) and put another 100 Bahts of credit on the card We picked up a map of the system    You scan your card to enter  and again at the  exit  The train cards are air conditioned which is very nice  Each car has a map of the stops above the doors  They announce each stop as they approach it  The Sky Train is a very clean and quick way to move around the city

title: The only thing you need.
review: So easy So easy So cheap So easy Don't bother with a taxi The meter ticks up and up sitting in traffic BTS You just speed over the city for a few baht

title: Convenient but too crowded
review: We took the BTS only on day 1 and soon realised that travelling in overly crowded aky trains wasn't our cup of tea so we adhered to taxis which are reasonable too

title: Clean a must
review: I enjoyed every day drip on the train The people working at the station speak better English that the ones at the hotels They are professional and willing to help and assist  The trains are super clean and the ac is fantastic

title: Inner city Train travel, easy to use, clean and air conditioned
review: While the first time might be a little daunting staff are helpful and have english skills all the announcements are in both Thai and English grab yourself a map from the staff showing all the stations check which one you need to get off at gets crowded at peak times but that's to be expected inexpensive there can often be a lot of stairs to get up to the stations but usually there is an elevator nearby Life is an adventure give it a go and once you have tried it you will find it a very convenient way to get around this big city

title: Great way to beat the horrific traffic of Bangkok
review: Bangkok's BTS is a thoroughly modern very well organized mass transit system that provides much needed relief in getting around this wonderful yet frequently crowded city

title: Good service at good price
review: Good service  cover almost all the city and you can travel with ease  Due to the security measures the security guards will check your bag at the entrance

title: Very handy
review: Great way to get around central Bangkok and avoid the horrendous traffic during the day Prices are very cheap for an all day pass It does get very busy and crowded during peaks hours Could definitely do with more trains running but coming from London I'm use to being packed in like sardines

title: Great trip
review: Great trip We went for private tour to save time Group tour follows exactly same route just takes more time to pick up  drop off people at different hotels Group option is definitely better value for money

title: Very easy.
review: If you used to use MRT in Sing you will like Bangkok BTS Fast and easy But it is lightly hard to find right exit doors And you must remember machine ticket only accept small valued cash I did not know and I tried to push 500 baht into machine of course it didn't accept Be so shy

title: Revisited
review: BTW sky train and MRT best way to get around city MRT probably better for wheelchair users Access to sky train use a joining office block or department store look for BTS flag Select price of destination the machines take 1510 bhat coins some larger stops take notes The the ticket as a small hole and arrow in it this goes in the barrier Or if long stay buy top up card deposit refunded when leaving Stand on appropriate arrows on platform away from yellow lines if the arrows are facing you this means you'll get trampled on as passengers get off so join the 2 orderly queues either sideIf you are a backpacker take it off as you are taking up 3 spaces and everytime you turn around you'll knock over other passengers

title: Safe, Inexpensive and Efficient Travel
review: We spent a total of 4 days in Bangkok and I believe we ended up riding the BTS a total of 3 of those days I downloaded one of the many free train apps that you can get before I arrived in Bangkok and found our closest train stop to our hotel (12 mile walkno problem)  From there it was as easy as finding our destination buying our ticket (carry Baht coins with you) and getting to the right platform for the right train  You can get a rabbit pass if you plan on riding a lot but for our short trips we just carried some coins with us  We saw some police around the stations and everyone basically minds their own business on the train itself so we always felt 100% safe  Our latest ride back to the vicinity of our hotel was around 11pm and it still didn‚Äôt feel scary at all (well lit)  All in all a definite recommendation if inexpensive transport is needed

title: A cofortable way of traveling in BK
review: When we are in Bangkok we always use the skytrain It is a plessant experience when the sun is at it¬¥s highest and the heat is 40+ deg and you come into the AC cooled train The train stops at many of the main facillities in the city and you never have to wait for more than 1015 mins

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Whilst the taxi can be cheap you are often caught up in the infamous Bangkok traffic so this is ideal for getting around

title: Rapid and economical way to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: I recently used Airport Rail Link from Phaya Thai Terminal to Suvarnabhumi Airport The fare is cheaper comparing to taking a taxi all the way through In stead of approx Baht 300 I paid Baht 55+45 (taxi from home to Phaya Thai Terminal plus rail link fare) It's only one third  of what I  normally spent   Another advantageous point was the shortened travel time from around 1 hour to half an hour It's great

title: Cheap and air conditioned.
review: Nice way to get into the city if traveling light  Otherwise consider taking a taxi  The Bangkok stations aren't in the city center around Siam or Silom but are rather a short taxi ride away  Trains are very clean and air conditioned which is very nice if lugging bags

title: Fast
review: Fast and convenient way into town from the airport Buy your token at the vending machines at the airport

title: Air conditioned sustainable transport VS a hot taxi?
review: Easy choice  We found the SkyTrain to be easy cheap and very comfortable  We took it from Sukhumvit Asoke to Chatachuk market  Nice to see the city from up high and really enjoyed the AC

title: Easy to use and get around
review: After you spend 5min getting climatised to the airport and the bangkok way of doing things you will find out the sky train and standard rail to be quite good  Just be wary about directions distances and where is a good place to go we lost a lot of time going to places and misdirections   People here gladly tell you what they feel like "Just down the road" may infact be 5km away

title: efficient way to get around bangkok
review: one of the best public transportation system in the world  very efficient cheap and gets you to key locations throughout Bangkok

title: The fastest and cheapest way
review: It is the fastest cheapest and easiest way to get to the airport from downtown about 30 minutes If you want to take a taxi it takes about an hour even more during rush hour and it cost three times as much as Rail link

title: so convenient
review: The Skytrain is fantastic  quick clean and inexpensive   It is a great way to avoid the notorious Bangkok traffic jams

title: Much better ( and cheaper) than a taxi.
review: Having suffered at the hands of the airport taxi drivers on  a number of occasions ( meter not working going a long way round etc) we decided to use the airport rail link to get initially to Phya Thai station Clean cheap and easy to use Cost us about 45 baht each ( ticket machines easy to use and both English and Thai language available) We didn't have any luggage which made it easier although we saw a number of passengers with large suitcases Trains run frequently so there is never long to wait Announcements are made in both English and Thai and are visually displayed as well   Was much busier later in the day on our return to the airport but nothing like the London underground at rush hour The journey from the airport to Phya Thai took about 20 minutes Would certainly use the rail link again

title: Skytrain
review: Great way to get around BKK and very reasonably priced Their stations are very conveniently placed You can also link to Phaya Tai to connect to the airport  usually costs under $5 for the trip

title: Beat the traffic chaos
review: Clean Air conditioned and reliable Although crowded during peak hours the sky train is a fast and efficient way to get around and certainly beats the other forms of public transport in the areas of the city that it serves

title: Prepare to climb
review: There is no doubt that the BTS is the best method of transport in BKK It‚Äôs fast clean and run every 46 minutes However it‚Äôs about 3 stories high with only one escalator in each station which not easy to find If you thought of using elevator good luck in finding one  I just wonder how the Thai developers such a great method of transportation without thinking about the potential people who may use it  According to the Health App I climbed 14 floors each day in BKK just by taking the bts wow

title: Speedy and cheap
review: Best and cheapest option for solo travelers or couples without a lot of luggage to get into the city from Suvardnabumi airport Choose a hotel near a City Link station

title: Great public transport

title: fast and precise
review: cheap traveling through Bangkok for just a few Bath

title: Great connectivity at Bangkok

title: The fastest way to approach Bangkoks city center.
review: Avoid the usual horrible Bangkok traffic jam with taxis or buses and choose the cheapest (BHT 45) and fastest means of reaching your downtown location

title: Fast, Efficient, and Affordable..!!!
review: Just like BTS MRT lets you travel hassle free within the Bangkok city It's an underground metro unlike BTS and covers good part of the city It do intersects with BTS as well at certain junctions but one needs to exit MRT completely to board the BTS or vice versa It also provides connectivity to the Airport Link at the Makkasan Station which is a big plus It is very convenient efficient and super clean It do gets crowded during peak hours but you can always skip one and get into the other one Highly recommended

title: Great and cheap!

title: Great trip

review: Bangkok is a city in gridlock  The skytrain allows you to bypass the roads and travel in a time efficient way  Get the day pass for 240 baht
