review: when we stay in bangkok thie fisrt decision for the hotel is is it near BTS or not because this is important also the fare is cheap even for the 45 people if the travel together is cheaper with taxi but when solo travel this is the chosen one

title: Great experience !
review: Unreal Great experience and the guide was awesome Highly recommend it if you are in Bangkok  Takes most of the day but well worth it

title: Fast and efficient
review: I like this rail system which connect Bangkok international airport right to central Bangkok The train is fast too less than 30 minutes for the whole journey

title: No frills and convenient transport in downtown Bangkok!
review: Cheap and reliable way to commute in downtown Bangkok not forgetting the often jam packed traffic in the city Most downtown locations are covered by the BTS but the only cons are that you need be in long queues at auto ticketing machines or station staff in the day and be with enough coins Be careful that BTS stops service pretty early and at around 11pm given that Bangkok is a never sleeping town and tickets are valid for the day only

title: Excellent Way To Travel
review: The BTS Skytrain system is one of the best ways to travel when in Bangkok As an American expat I regularly use the network when going home and sometimes going into work The track runs along many of the main outlets on Sukhumvit Rd from hotels to shopping centers and some landmarks   The best thing is that if one is staying for a longer duration like half a month or longer a good idea to follow is to obtain what was just rolled out last year the Rabbit Cards These are special cards that one can obtain at most (if not all) BTS station ticket counters for a varying fee so that the user can easily access the stations without restrain to having to constantly pump coins into the machines or exchange bills for their fare The cards can also easily be 'topped up' to add more value at anytime    With the new Rabbit Card it will give the user more convenient access and more freedom of movement without having to toggle with coins or banknotes each and every time they wish to go to a particular destination   Finally as another recent reviewer has said about the BTS in general if one wishes to beat the traffic on Sukhumvit Rd below best to take the Skytrain It's cool (air conditioned that is) cheap very quick and most importantly can get travelers where they need to go (or at least pretty close to it)   So the next time you're in Bangkok and planning a trip in or around the city see if you can make the Skytrain part of your trip and as your mode of transportation

title: Pretty Skytrain

title: Cold but efficient
review: We have done this trip twice now once each way both ways were ok if somewhat chilly because of Thailands obsession with air con its a good way to travel and save on a hotel for the night Each journey was different has once we were on bottom bunk and once on top top is best and warmer but a bit more pricey it's definitely an experience and I would highly recommend it because in England there's nothing like it

title: Easy way to get around
review: Very useful for traveling the general routes I use so much I have a pass

title: Give the taxi's a miss - use the BTS
review: We have visited Bangkok many times over the past 30 years  The traffic in Bangkok is crazy  Get a BTS map and use it for as much of your travel throughout the city as you can  Not only will you save money but you will save time  The trains are very clean and efficient

title: Simple and cheap transportation
review: The MRT in Bangkok is simple to use has air condition and is very cheap so it is definately a good way to go around Also it is usually not too busy The only limitation the subway has is the fact that is does not cover the whole city

title: Use it Friday night if you go to town without any bag
review: It took a long long long time to finish I mean to get some trains running on the track It finally opened a couple of years ago There are two types of trains going into Suvarnabhumi airport on the same track A non stop one and a slower one A taxi into BKK will run you meter  around 200 B (+ or  depending on traffic) plus 50 B surcharge + toll if any 75 B soon to go up The Express will cost you over 100 Baht and like just about every train will drop you off at the train station from where you will need to take a train  underground MRT APat Makhasan or sky train  BTS at Phaya Thai or a taxi or both Alternatively you take the regular train to town Price varies on destination but is a fraction of the Express Now when you off load you have escalators at Makhasan and steps at Phaya Thai Not convenient with luggage A walk and another queue to buy your ticket  The only time it is worth it is Friday nights from 5 to 9 when traffic from the airport to BKK and in town is horrendous But there again not easy if you have suitcases Last but not least the airline check in ( like in Hong Kong) does not operate So really not much benefit except if you have spent all your money and need to go to or from the airport Sure is better and faster than walking

title: Very convenient
review: Easy way of traveling between the airport and city center Perfect connection on the Skytrain Very safe and clean trains

title: Best BKK transport
review: Best way to avoid the terrible BKK traffic  busy crowded but has air con

title: Good trip - be advised: Fare is one-way !
review: Exciting to go by train from Kanchanaburi station over the bridge and balancing on wooden sticks close to the wall You get softdrinks snacks and a certificate included in the 300B ONEWAY ticket Got off at Sapan Tham Krasae and returned by TUKTUK to Kanchanaburi Station for 100B Train return would be another 300B

title: Cheap travel
review: Good speedy and air conditioned  There are connections to the main shopping areas also to all main sights

title: Ease Transportation by Train
review: You can easily connect to every where using BTS Skytrain Buy ticket using the machine Officials can change note to coins Mostly written in English

title: Clean, Reliable and Inexpensive
review: I wish we had Skytrain where we live  Easy to get about has good links helpful station staff frequent trains clean and cheap transport  not to mention air conditioned  You can even use your Rabbit card at the Food Hall in Siam Pargon too

title: Clean and effecient

title: Better Choice
review: In Bangkok as we all know the traffic is very bad So MRT is the best choice as it could save time money and so energy

review: This is the fastest and cheapest way tofrom the airport if you are located near the metro link We've stayed near the Makkasan station and took us about 20 minutes (35 baht) to get to the airport Highly recommended

title: Speedy, efficient but don't take food on it
review: This was our choice of method for transportation around Bangkok The trains are speedy efficient clean and economical Being air conditioned helps too in the intense heat At time of writing the highest fare was $160 CDN per person Fares are determined based on distance travelled and often stop near major attractions Our son loved writing the train as he called it and meeting new people

review: I was a bit stressed as it was my first Bangkok experience and travelling from the airport is always a big issue But this train service is excellent always running on time However it can get really busy during peak hours

review: It is fastest and cheapest way to get into city It is very convenient and is interconnected with BTS

title: Best way to get around!

review: the one downside is that it can be a super crowded experience but its a very uncomplicated way to travel from and to the airport not for those aiming at the khaosan area mind you the 2 transfer stations you are most likely to use areMakasan and Phaya thai the last stop maximum price begining to end is 45 bhat

title: Efficient people mover in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain in Bangkok is the most efficient form of land transport  considering the traffic condition most of the time However it is not friendly at all to older people and people with handicaps  In most stations it requires climbing up and down stairs Escalators are provided in some stations only

title: Fast safe and cool city transportation
review: The bts brings you evert where you want It's safe fast and cool because the airco is excellent Your bars are always checken by patient and smiling personel

title: Very cool Tour!
review: We weren‚Äòt expecting all too much and booked very late the day before It was a really top organised and very impressing tour that got us a little bit out of bangkok and experiencing two very special markets you won‚Äòt see anywhere else Duy our tour guide informed us very well and also told us some things about the history of thailand He was very kind helpfull and highly motivated The pickup from the hotel worked perfektly I would recommend this tour to everyone

title: Best travel to and from the airport
review: Best way to get from the airport to Bangkok It is efficient and very clean It is also way cheaper than taxi a taxi It is convenient in that it leaves from the basement floor of the airport and runs pretty regularly

title: Very efficient service. On schedule every time
review: The station located at popular location and shopping mall Connected with Metro another efficient public transport

title: Best way to get around
review: Cheap easy and very well run Use the tickets booths rather than the machines as they only take cards Enjoy the feeling of being part of Bangkok

title: A 'must' to get around Bangkok
review: Cheap as chips air conditioned regular and enjoyable  Buy a day travel card saves you rooting for loose change and queuing  Spotlessly clean and a pleasure to ride on Just be aware no eating or drinking on the train so our recently purchased coffee had to be dumped before travelling  The London Underground could learn a few things

title: Inexpensive Transportation
review: This is a great way to get around town quickly and at a low cost It helps to have exact change if possible

title: Fast, clean, cheap and efficient.
review: There is no need to use taxis or Tuk Tuks anymore  The BTS offers stops and stations along Shukumvit and beyond taking you across the city very fast and with stations in popular areas for dining and entertainment  Connections to the underground are good  The only downside is that the BTS does not extend as far as the river so many of the major tourist sites have to be accessed from Hua Lamphong by taxi An expensive and soul destroying business where you will be over charged as a tourist

title: Clean and convenient
review: It's clean fast and convenient and takes you to places Stations are clean too It can be very full on rush hour I wish there are accessible elevators on every station as travellers with luggages or PWD would find it more friendly to commute

title: Rode this to the airport when I left Bangkok
review: Line links up to the BTS skytrain and takes you directly to the airport Again it's easy to find directions and other folks are helpful The Airport Link has plenty of room for luggage etc and again can be busy

title: Awesome and would do it again
review: This tour was fun and interesting The family had a good time seeing the different foods and other items we could buy from the local vendors  The weather was hot but we made it through Seeing the train come through the market was amazing also Definitely worth every penny

title: Fast and cheap but...
review: Traveling from the airport to Makkasan or Phaya Thai is great even with luggage and you ll get a seat Too bad the express service is still not running but 30 minutes is still much faster even with the taxi to the hotel But coming back is another story It can be VERY crowded No seats and not fun with luggage but it's still much faster Cost 45 baht instead of 400 baht And you miss the wild ride on the freeway

title: Quick and Direct
review: Coming from Sydney where the airport train costs 20 Aud  for 2 stations this is fantastic no traffic  no anxiety into the city in 30 minutes connects to most other public transport modes

title: Among the best mass transportation systems
review: Clean and fast better than many european public transports People are respectful and you can still decently use it in peak hours

title: Easy to use
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way of traveling in Bangkok The roads are always crammed full with cars and you can use the BTS to beat the jams in aircon comfort

title: The easiest way to travel in BKK
review: If you wanna go to each and every part of BKK this is the way  Cheap and very comfortable  Forget the taxi and Tuk Tuk and start using that

title: Always Cloudy
review: Train No is less then every time cloudy as difficult to travel for foreigner especially who has big baggage

title: Easy
review: Easy to use and would stay close to next time make sure you get a map from the ticketing office Day pass a great idea

title: Cheapest and fastest means of transport in Thailand.
review: If u know the railroute I can assure you that u can save a lot of Baht on travel in Thailand by opting for the BTS Its the fastest way to reach places too and the BTS route maps are available in all hotels and even at the airports always keep one handy

title: Safe and Fast
review: To avoid time fly in transportation in Bangkok it is a one of a choiceCompare price to the sky train I think that it is cheaper for a distance ride

title: Train to closest station to hotel, taxi from there.
review: We caught the train to and from the airport when coming and going from Bangkok Around 20 minutes to the city It can take much longer sitting in Bangkok traffic   We catch the train to the closest station to our hotel and then grab a taxi from outside Train costs about 30 bath and is easy to catch from the airport

title: Cheap, yet a bit inconvenient way to airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is another part of Bankok's already great public transportation system and much cheaper than taking a limo or taxi For travellers with lots of luggage it will be dificult when trying to connect with the BTS at Priya Thai BTS Station

title: Clean and efficient Transport in Bangkok
review: Traffic can be a nightmare in Bangkok when you commute by taxi or cars BTS is a great alternative as it is very efficient It stops in all major malls and Bangkok tourists attractions It is cheap clean and relatively easy to understand directions You can only use coins in the machines that have English language option as well as other languages Coin exchange is available at the information kiosk in every station

title: Fast, Easy and Spacious
review: It is so easy when u take this airport railway from suvkvubumi airport to town The price around 35baht per trip and is much easy to accessif u want to change to BTS alight at Asok and exit to change it Or if u want to chanfe to metro (MRT) alight at Makkasan and walk to Petriburi MRT Is easy

title: Quick & Easy
review: The best and cheapest way to travel during rush hour or if the taxis and tooktooks are overcharging

title: Easy way to BTS
review: We wanted to experience local traffic and used this shuttle train to BTS sky train Easy to use easy to find from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport

title: Quick and Affordable

title: great way to go around bangkok.
review: the directions are easy to understand  if you are to reload your bts card you need cash they dont accept credit card

title: Quick and efficient and makes getting around the city to all the main attractions quick, cheap and easy.
review: The BTS is such a lifesaver as its super easy to use and pretty hard to get lost as its all clearly labelled  Its an affordable way to get around the city with little or no fuss

title: Fast and cheap way to reach city center
review: ARL is the fastest (less than 40 minX and cheapest (45 THB) service to take passengers from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok city center The service starts from 5 am to midnight The end of the line is at Phraya Thai station where one can take BTS to other destinations I like it as it is convenient and fast However there are not enough trains to run especially the rush hours The administration need to add more trains as soon as possible and extend the service to serve passengers who may arrive very early or very late

title: Convenient travelling
review: It's fast and safe and the price is reasonable For us we took the BTS straight to the end to Chatuchak market and when we arrived there we just walked down the stairway and pass a field and we were at Chatuchak No traffic jam You need to stop at Mo Chit station

title: Very useful for person who live in Bangkok

title: Very convenient and economical

title: Very convenient !

title: Love public transportation
review: The sky train is great I used it almost everyday that I was in Bangkok  The fares are very reasonable and the ticket machines are Farley easy to figure out even for an American

title: Skytrain
review: Very good Fast and clean Easy way to Travel trough Bangkoküòä We spend five days in Bangkok and try different ways of traveling THE train was the fastest and safest way for us

title: Absolutely the cheapest and fastest transport in Bangkok

review: This is probably the fastest way to get you through the city but it doesnt cover the Old City unfortunately

title: Easy

title: fast and safe
review: This a fast cheap and safe way of transport in the city but take care service stops around midnight

title: Perfect Transport System
review: Being relatively new BST is an example of what every city should strive for It's clean efficient and runs frequently and very reasonably priced If only the issued had a daypasses  Please carry plenty of coins as automachines don't accept notes (although that is going to change) You can get change at ticket office but queues can be long

title: Fast and inexpensive trip to the city center
review: Finding the Rail Link at the airport in Bangkok is easy and access is convenient  The trains run on a regular schedule and transport you from BKK airport to downtown in about 30 minutes  Connections to the BTS and MRT ( Skytrain and underground metro system respectively) are easy and well annotated  Easier than a taxi if you don't have lots of luggage  One suitcase and a carryon bag per person are probably all you want to try managing on the skytrain though

title: Quick, cheap and easy
review: Best way to travel into Bangkok from the airport ¬£1 for a 2030 minute journey = bargain Signs from the airport are easy to follow ticket machine was in English too which really helped No issues as it was clean and tidy and left feeling severely impressed

title: A fast, clean and safe transportation in Bangkok
review: To avoid the traffic in Bangkok which is very often I would recommend to take the BTS Skytrain a fast clean convenient and safe transportation You can reach almost every touristic places and luxury malls Definitely the best option to travel in Bangkok

title: Gala Ride with airport link
review: Very convenient clean and fast transport to reach city from Airport Even a first time visitor can understand the route with the Map and it cost only THB 45 from Airport to city with 20 minutes great rideWith Bangkok traffic this a boon to tourist

title: Most efficiency way to travel around Bangkok
review: Traffic in the big city are terrible To avoid the bad traffic experience in BangkokThe BTS Skytrain is the best to hop around Bangkok city It easy to access to many major attraction area mostly in the downtown  Don't miss

title: Mass transit is an attraction?
review: I'm not sure how a city rail system qualifies as an attraction or a "thing to do"   The trains are normally crowded and not too pleasant an experience in my opinion  However it is a well run system that allows you to avoid the more unpleasant experience of Bangkok traffic

title: Effortless and easy transport to anywhere within BKK
review: Absolutely love traveling throughout BKK with the MRT Its easy and all staff on the platforms are helpful and assist you if you get a little lost

title: Best way to beat the jam, although can be crowded in peak hours
review: Best way to beat the jam although can be crowded in peak hours  Prepare lots of coins because most machines accept coins only Station staff only change dollar note to coin but do not allow you to buy ticket at their counters  Identify the destination station on the map next to ticket booth There should be a 2digit number (the price of ticket)  Press the button on the ticket booth  Slot in the coin

title: good service
review: went into Bangkok by sky train and found it very fast and cost effective only down side is no lifts or escalators once in Bangkok so if you have a lot of luggage then have a think first

title: Fantastic way to get to the airport.
review: Cheap and efficient way to get to the international airport I traveled on the airport rail link by myself (28 year old female) and felt completely safe    Great signage to find platforms etc   To get from my hostel near Siam station to the airport was approx $3 AUD  can't beat that price Highly recommend

title: A great local experience
review: I went on a tour to Maeklong market and got to see the train pass by the shops and stalls lining the railroad It was a memorable experience I'd recommend to anyone who visits Bangkok The venue is an hour's worth of a ride away from central bangkok but they offer pickup at your hotel within the city for just an additional $2 or so Our guide Tim Tim was friendly and had a good sense of humor that kept us all laughing throughout the tour I would definitely recommend them

title: Second class overnight sleeper to Chiang Mai
review: Very friendly staff comfortable bed we'll definitely travel this way again soon Eye mask ear plugs warm jumper long trousers are essential  the aircon is very effective  The lights were not turned off or down during the night I was on a top bunk and the light next to my head was so bright that it shone through my eye mask Please could you ask smokers to smoke cigarettes in an area which does not result in smoke blowing into the carriage There were two passengers smoking just the other side of the toilets and the smoke blew into the carriage  very 1980s and no longer acceptable

title: A Great Way to move around
review: A Great Way to move around if only of long waiting times and a little expensive The air con was great comfort from the heat of the city

title: Qucik, efficient and cheap!
review: Definitely the best way to avoid the notorious Bangkok traffic Well connected regular and air conditioned   Phaya Thai station connects you to the airport link for Suvarnabhumi Airport   Mo Chit will take you to a taxi rank where you can then take a 15 minute ride to  Don Muang Airport for around ‡∏ø100

title: Busy BTS
review: Good fast and easy to access however the ticket machine only accept coin and we need to change the money note into coin everytime when we buy the tickets

title: Easy to use, clean. Definitely use if you can. Taxi's can take a long time.
review: We used it to get to Terminal 21 really easy And cheap Clean Safe too Easy to buy tickets at the station

title: Forget the 200baht taxi ride use this!
review: I wish it was 247 but it stops running around 1am but if you need to get into or out of Bkk then this is the fastest way without worrying about the traffic in Bang Kapi It ends at Phraya Thai and that stop is in between Victory monument and Siam Paragon

title: Unforgettable Experience, put on your Must Do list
review: What an amazing day to start our Thailand holiday  We were a small group of 6 with our Tour Guide Viktor  The mini van took us to BanKalong where we learnt about the salt farming in the area then we boarded the train here which took us to Maeklong railway market  wow what an experience looking out the window at all the stalls and people within touching distance as you rode in on the train  We disembarked and were given a short tour around part of the market then taken to a cafe where one of our group was given the honour of passing the drinks to the train driver as the train departed  again wow watching the train pass even over top of the some of the market goods incredible  Next we were taken to Damnoen Floating market where we had a 30 minute boat ride around the market then looked around on foot  Again such a unique experience  It was a 2 hour van ride back to Bangkok but it was all definitely worth every minute

title: Fast efficient
review: This is the only fast efficient way of transfering to and from the airport with interchanges at MRT and SkyTrain stations you can travel any where

title: Short journey to Terminal 21
review: Brilliant journey of only a few stops but train on time clean efficient and very good price wise Thought we may struggle language wise but the staff and announcements were brilliant (English) Would definitely recommend

title: Most convenient way to get to AP
review: Best way to and from Survanabhumi  No traffic clean fast cool  Make sure to have your token ready at exits though

title: Convenient means of transportation
review: The sky train in Bangkok is the most convenient transportation system especially during the rush hours which drives you crazy if you are using taxis or cars It is clean affordable and connects essential or main areas of Bangkok which tourists or visitors visit The price is also reasonable and you have various options of buying tickets depending the length of your stay in Bangkok

title: Convenient but not comfortable
review: Sometimes it is too cold and sometimes too hot  Temperature control needs to be worked on  Security is hogwash

title: Best way for travel in BKK
review: Best way for travel in BKK not much route as in other country but nice and clean Crowded during rush hours

title: fun loving holiday makers
review: love food and drink sight seeing street markets street food ferry system and all the piers  Get a rabbit card for train travel and use orange line ferry for value  Definitely make the time to go to Pier 13 Prah Athrit for food drink massage shopping and a great diversity of amazing people

title: Small BTS Network in Bangkok
review: BTS network was small in Bangkok and it could not reach many tourist spots Using metered taxi was more convenient and cheaper if you are travelling in group of 3  4

title: Bts skytrain
review: We used the bts skytrain a few times while in Bangkok I highly recommend it It is very convenient clean and very safe and a great way to get around without having to take on the traffic of Bangkok

title: Great option
review: Wow what a great way to get into the city Inexpensive clean easy air conditioned and much faster and less hassle than a taxi Only wish they operated late night and early morning (24 hours)

title: Superlative way to get out of the airport ans where you are going!
review: FORGET cabs You need to take the Airport Rail Link out of the airport area and then use the SkyTrain Check FIRST whether your hotel is near the skytrain

title: Sarah is the GOAT
review: Sarah was the best guide She went out of her way to make sure the tour was fun and safe and no one was left behind English friendly and bring Bhat with you  Worth it

title: BTS card u can now use it for travel and food
review: Get a BTS card fr station Is so convenient when u travel juz tap in n out No need to dig out coins n small notes to purchase per trip tix N BTS card can be use to purchase food at foodcourt in Paragon mall n MBK etc

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Used Express line and City line both  Absurdly as it is useful because it come directly inside the airport 25 min from checkins and 5 min from binary of BTS of PayaThai  Price is not expensive for Express line very cheap for City Line

title: clean and packed during peak hours!!
review: Convenient and the best mode of transport to venture within BKK to avoid its notorious traffic jam Best to get a "Rabbit Card" if u think u will come to BKK often or else buying a ticket (accepting coins only) will be a nightmare during peak hours (8 to 9am and 5 to 6pm) the train is always clean but can be super cold (personally feels like 20 degree 68 Fahrenheit) especially when u need to adjust the change in temperature when entering the cabin during a hot weather Usually safe but still do look out for your belongings

title: Nice train
review: While the train is limited if you need to go anywhere that has a stop the train is very fast new clean and easy to use

title: Best deal in town
review: The airport link train is the best deal in the city For a maximum of 45b you can ride from the airport into downtown Bangkok There are multiple station stops where you can transfer to subway skytrain or city line trains The trip from the airport to the end of the line at Phaya Thai station takes a maximum of about 45 minutes Cars are clean and well air conditioned Not much room for luggage so if you come to town really loaded down with bags you might want to take a taxi instead

title: very useful
review: available from airport to city center good value took this airport rail link then took a tuktuk to hotel

title: BTS So easy to get around Bangkok hassle free
review: What a great and efficient system the beauty about the BTS is that you get to stop at most Shopping Malls in Bangkok and so easy to use clean and air conditioned so cheap

title: Convenient
review: A safe cheap and convenient transportation to and fro from the airport to town and vice versa If you stay near where the rail link is it will be much much easier to move around to all places when one needed to change from BTS station and the Mrt station

title: One of the best public elevated train systems
review: The most convenient way to get around Bangkok It is busy most of the day  especially during the morning and afternoon rush hours There are two main linesthe Silom line and the Sukhumvit line The two line interchange at the Siam station Along with the BTS you can interchange with the MRT (subway) and maneuver much of Bangkok For first time visitors to Bangkok I suggest getting a hotel close to the BTS until you get acquainted with the bus system and the canal system The BTS system closes at midnight After midnight you will have to use Bangkok's notorious taxis

title: No need to take a taxi!
review: My husband lived in Bangkok before the Skytrain and during our recent trip to the city was super impressed with the speed cleanliness and efficiency of the train  Added to this that it is an inexpensive safe and reliable way to get around an insanely busy city It also has great views of the CBD and surrounds I was particularly taken with the golf course in the middle of a race course  Tip walk quickly through the turnstile or it will bite you (i got clamped twice due to my 'driving Miss Daisy' way of walking everywhere

title: The A/C is amazing!
review: This is how all cities should design their 'tube' The air condition was amazing especially given the time of year we visited London underground should take note

title: Fast, Cheap, Efficient, Easy
review: This is an excellent option to get around Bangkok as it comes often super cheap to ride and has air condition  It does get crowded but it's a great way to escape the heat and avoid traffic jam and taxituktuk scams  It is very easy to use there are two major routes north east and south west and they connect at Siam    Tip have coins of 1510 for the machines as they only take those currency options  Otherwise you'd have to line up at the counter which the queues can be long and most of the time end up back at the machines as they counter will not sell the tickets to us sometimes

title: Excellent connectivity
review: You cannot ask for anything more in the name of public transport The trains are very comfortable and not at all crowded covers most of the destinations around the city has a vast rich around Bangkok

title: Easy access to Bangkok
review: A fast and efficient service from the airport to Bangkok  Regular service is great and well priced but can get busy at rush hours and seating could have a little more comfort

title: Half - day getaway for the local exotic market experience
review: You get train ride into the market and get to experience the train passing thru on the ground next to the stall  once in a lifetime which is worth it Then you get to have lunch & hop on a boat to the water market  which was very interesting as well The duration is just right and our guide eddy is kind and attentive to details

title: Time saving!
review: if you are on the tight schedule BTS skytrain will be your best option for travelling around Bangkok The train is clean with good maintain We bought their 1 day pass cost us 140 Baht which you can travelling around BKK freely Strongly recommended

title: Good choice to / from airport
review: From airport to the center of city only 45Baht and takes time 40  45 mins then you can transfer to the other trains it Save time and money

title: so organise
review: The skytrain is very comfortable for short or long distance and it's very easy to understand how it works the map of train

title: Nice
review: Really love the sky train  Its fast and cheap  Watch out for rush hour because then it is a bit crazy  I would highly recommend this as a way around town

title: convenient but no lifts
review: we love traveling by BTS because it is so convenient but it is too packed in peak time and no lift for luggages We had to carry luggages by stairsLucky it was not heavy

title: The SKYTRAIN is a good option
review: This is a good option and often also the fastest way to get around Bangkok It is quicker when the traffic is slow and have AC In the peak hours the skytrain can be crowdy Price if 2 or 3 people it starts to get cheaper to take taxi but if you are 1 or 2 it is cheaper or about the same price Another option is also the boats on the canals When I want to move around quick it is skytrain and mototbike taxi that is my choice

title: Use it!
review: We thought we might not use this as a taxi would be quicker and easier However the airport rail link is so cheap and often much quicker than taxis that get stuck in the bad Bangkok traffic

title: Amazing
review: Highly recommend Guide is very helpful and spoke English The floating markets were such fun and a great experience )

title: Fast and hassle-free way to get downtown
review: It might be a long walk to finally get on the train but if you don't have too much luggage to haul around def the easiest way to get downtown Especially if you can get easily irritated by taxi drivers after just landing after a long flight üòâ

title: Surprised
review: It's a fairly damning indictment that this is #2 on TA when you have so many other attractions in Bangkok   Unfortunately with this review it helps keep it's status as it's rating is based on the sheer volume of feedbacks and unlike cultural or activity based things to do people aren't going to criticise a clean and efficient system   A single journey of 15 minutes from the National Stadium via a stop at Siam to the Sunday market is 60 Bht (¬£130) That's expensive in real terms   The reason why I haven't scored it any higher is because based on Thailand's economy and standard of living it's expensive compared to other capital cities train system

title: Good experience
review: For a first time user and as a tourist it's bit confusing about tickets and route bit crowded More stairs use only on high traffic times Side glasses full of posters no views of city ( SkyTrain name is ok but less views from top

title: Cheap but not nasty
review: Bts is fast and reliable clean and modern just a bit overcrowed in peak hour People are polite though so if you don‚Äôt  mind a bit shoulder rubbing witn strangers this is the transport for you

title: No escalators or elevators in some stations!
review: Really easy way in and out of the city and what I always use when over but just to keep in mind carrying luggage up & down flights of stairs at some stations is far from easy )

title: Cool oasis
review: Such an easy way to get around Bangkok Not all stations have lifts and there are steep stairs but trains are on time frequent and air conditioned

title: I Love the BTS
review: This single amenity makes Bangkok so much more traversable and enjoyable I use the BTS almost everyday for commuting and sightseeing If you‚Äôre going to be in Bangkok for any length of time get a Rabbit card It gives you a discount that adds up quickly

title: Can‚Äôt beat it for efficiency speed and comfort
review: Great way to get around the city Cheap travel in spotless and air conditioned comfort Here‚Äôs wishing the uk transport system was this good

title: Clean and cold
review: With the help of our guide we used the sky train to get around the city quickly and inexpensively  Unlike the crazy traffic on the street sky train riders were polite and organized  Best of all it is airconditioned

title: A good idea but not realised right
review: Right now the Thai engineers managed to "kill" most trains  They not even ordered the spare parts to repair Nearly had to stop the service because not enough trains which are usable Build b German companies but destroyed by Thai  A problem is also that you arrive in Bangkok with your luggage and there is no taxi no one who can help Very nice if tourist are in Bangkok first time and they stay late in evening with luggage on a street and there is no taxi

title: Make You Think
review: Humbling to think that such a beautiful location has such a sad past   As a student of WWII I knew the facts about the railway but it was so moving to be there

title: Fantastic and honest company
review: I didn‚Äôt actually take this tour because there was some confusion about my booking (if you want hotel pickup make sure to pick that option)  Nonetheless I wanted to give them a review because of their quality customer service and honesty  they did the right thing and gave me a refund even though by the rules they didn‚Äôt have to   That said do take the tour because both markets are a fantastic experience and trust me going it alone is not a easy task

title: Easy
review: For the hassle it's just as easy to get a taxi as they're very cheap anyway Use it if you're on a tight budget

title: Clean and inexpensive!
review: The train and station are both very clean Directions are in English and very easy to follow The price is very low

title: Excellent way of getting around
review: We had a rail card day pass we got with a deal with the Amari Watergate Found it really easy to use and get around Bangkok

title: Skytrain
review: It's really a sky train ) driving on top of the street of Bangkok really easy to use and very cheap

title: Absolute MUST Do!
review: This is an excellent company The pickup from Grande Centre Point Terminal 21 was easy As we were not staying in central Bangkok we caught the Blue Line to Sukhumvit station The Grande is right there The van picked us up at exactly the arranged time This was arranged via email with the company through our Trip Advisor booking The experience was fantastic We were with our adult daughter and loved every minute We didn't plan anything after the trip so that we didn't have to stress about the Bangkok traffic heading back to the MBK drop off A great Mall for shopping and food  Sara our guide was interesting (good English) really cared about us and she was funny We were told what to expect well in advance throughout the day Toilet stops along the way were brief but long enough to go 'peepee' and get a coffee Excellent facilities at these stops  Lunch at the floating market was cheap and delicious Service was efficient and menus in English Sara helped us We had 12 in our airconditioned van and really enjoyed the company of the other nationalities The driver was excellent and cared that we were cool and safe We did not do the train trip we stayed in the van out to the market town and got to do the markets for a longer time We did not regret our decision We were right on the track  inches from the train when it arrived into the market A wicked experience It was busy noisy and huge fun The trip out of Bangkok is just as interesting and I won't spoil the little surprises you see in the hinterland This trip is a MUST DO

title: Fast, clean, cool
review: MRT is the Bangkok version of the underground or tube or metro It is reliable fast clean and the airconditioning system is keeping the air cool (but not extremely cool as it is the case of the BTS) making it a very pleasant travel experience

title: Best way to get to the Airport
review: Easy to use very clear signs And of course the most important thing is  it's fast and you are sure to reach the airport on time It can be a bit crowded during rush hour but then again so does every single train in the world To top it all off its the cheapest way to travel

title: Suvarnabhumi to Central Bangkok with ease !
review: Buy your token at the ticket counter on the lower ground floor of Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport and enjoy a stress free ride to Central Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: It‚Äôs convenient review ends there However if you‚Äôre carrying too many bags (which most of the trips to Bangkok is about) and are win a bunch of tired and cranky young children  I would highly recommend taking a taxi after 9pm to avoid the traffic jams

title: Great transport
review: It's a great way to go to same places in Bangkok the only downside is that doesn't go to all the main places of the city only some of then The temples khao san road and some others you have to find a different way to go there

title: Fast and safe way to travel in BKK
review: There are few places on this earth where I actually prefer to use public transport over driving myself but this is one of them  Fast clean and safe

title: Fast, clean, and airconditioning

review: It‚Äôs the quickest and best way to get around The trains are new and air conditioned with tv screens  Firstly do your homework and study the train map If you‚Äôre not within walking distant to a train stop then you may want to take a taxi to the station especially during week days during rush hours Taxis are cheap Bangkok traffic jams can be your biggest nightmare and ruin your precious limited vacation time If you can‚Äôt find a taxi in your area then download the Grab app to get one If you‚Äôre not far from where you are going and traffic is not bad then stay in your taxi to your destination  When getting to the station make sure you have coins handy to buy tickets at the machines otherwise you will experience a lengthy wait time at the customer service counter  Also there‚Äôs 2 different companies that run the mass transit train systems If you have ever been to Tokyo it‚Äôs the same way In Bangkok the above ground and underground lines are independent from each other but do connect at various stations So study your map and good luck

title: Quick and cheap but crowded
review: Bangkok's Airport Rail Link provides a quick and cheap way into the city from the new airport (Suvarnabhumi) avoiding the inevitable huge motorway snarl ups which always delay taxis and buses  But because the originallyplanned express service no longer runs airport passengers mingle with normal commuters from the various intermediate stations and it can get very busy particularly at peak times  If you are going from the central stations out to the airport allow plenty of time as you may not get on the first train particularly if you have large luggage (for which there is no storage space on the trains themselves)  But it's quick and cheap  45 baht one way  Buy a plastic token at ticket machines or ticket offices (cash only) which opens the gates to the platforms  You can also get a smartcard (but note this is incompatible with either the MRT or the BTS (Rabbit) smartcards so it's unlikely to be much use to tourists)  Deposit your token in a slot at the other end to open the exit gate and you're done  Get off at Makkasan station if you want the MRT (metro) or go all the way to Paya Thai if you need the BTS Skytrain  Note that the Paya Thai interchange does not have lifts or escalators to all levels and so you may need to carry your luggage up and down some stairs to reach the necessary platforms

title: Chaing Mai to Bangkok
review: The Chiang Mai station is good and it was easy to find our train We booked a private 2 berth first class compartment We got our own private cabin be it rather small with bunk beds a sink and lockable door The beds are seats until you needed to sleep We found enough space for our luggage 4 large bags as we had been travelling for 45 days  There were two toilets for the carriage one was a squat very dirty and smelly and of course no toilet paper the other was a European toilet somewhat better but not good We boarded the train in plenty of time after being dropped off by our amazing driver We had no trouble making the beds up ourselves much to the surprise of the conductor who is usually expected to do this for you   They are basic but clean enough and comfortable  I slept very well but then I am 4 foot 11 so don't need much space I do love train trips trains are an easy way to travel and save you paying for both accommodation and flights and you don't loss the time waiting in airports We had a meal at night and breakfast preordered but could eat neither of them they were pretty bad and  very cold Would do as the locals did and take our own food next time just as well our driver gave us some mandarins to take on the journey The train left on time and we traveled though Chiang Mai to the outskirts of town There were of course lots of paddy fields and pagodas Then the train travels up into the hills just as night falls giving some nice views Each station we stopped at had different colored rocks and planters to differentiate it from other stations rather cute After a good nights sleep we awoke to see people with small fires beside the tracks in the early morning light then the train passed into the slums of Bangkok  The train stopped at one stop and you could easily have reached out the window and touched the shacks along the edge of the tracks This area just before Bangkok's main station is very poor and you can see another side of Bangkok from here up close but not through the glass   If you want a different way to travel where you can see lots of the countryside meet people or not keep out of boring airports then this is a great way to travel It appears this Thai trains usually runs on time

title: Quick, convenient ‚Äì beats sitting in Bangkok traffic! But...
review: Quite possibly the cheapest way of getting into Bangkok is by train  The train runs fairly regularly from the main airport to the downtown The only issue with this is it stops about 11 times along the way‚Ä¶ And by the time the train reaches the downtown it is absolutely packed And I mean wedged kind of packed Good luck getting off at some stops  The other problem for the Traveler‚Ä¶ Is that the train stops in the midtown and unless you want to get onto another train you will need to find a taxi to complete your journey to most hotels  For the very small fee that the train costs this could be worth it to most people‚Ä¶ However a taxi from the airport to Riverside Bangkok (as in example ) on a good day in traffic is under 500thb and is so much more convenient

title: Fastest way to Novotel BKK Ploenchit  hotel
review: Arrived at Suvarnabhumi Airport and tried the airport rail link for the second time For only 45 THB from airport to phaya thai station I was able to save money  Never tried taking taxi

title: Very good to get around Bangkok

title: Clean & short waiting interval

title: Overnight Train from Ayutthaya to Chiang Mai
review: I had a great experience on the overnight train from Ayutthaya to Chiang Mai  The second class tickets were purchases for me in advance as I was part of a tour group  We were told the train was brand new as it had only been in operation for 3 weeks  The train arrive 45 minutes late in Ayutthaya this is expected and happens quite often from what I was told  My seat was located in car 8 and I was assigned to seat 28 which was a bottom bunk and is much superior than the top bunk for several reasons  The bottom bunk is a bit wider plus has a window and complete privacy when the curtains were drawn  There was a power port a pouch for a smartphone and a complimentary bottle of water while the luggage is stored under the seats  The train attendant transforms the seats to beds around 9PM then back to seats again at 6AM  The AC in the sleeper car works well as it was quite cool but bearable for me although the dining car was freezing cold  The dining car also had dinner snacks and drinks for sale I had the spicy chicken stirfry which was pretty good although small portions and a bit pricey  The bathrooms are shared that is the vanity and sink is however the toilets were separate individual compartments that were very clean  I had a good sleep on the train and if I could be guaranteed the same train I would do it all over again as it was a great experience  I would completely recommend taking this new train to a friend or any traveler  Note that I emailed Thailand Train Ticket and they confirmed that on November 11 2016 the State Railway of Thailand opened a new Diesel Rail Special Express Train to Chiang Mai the train number is #9

review: Our guide Kiwi and our driver were fabulous  While it takes you an hour to get to your first destination Kiwi pointed out things of interest along the way The Railway Market is fascinating and hard to describe unless you experience it Riding the train to the market was really fun  The Floating Market was quite an experience ‚ÄòBumper boats‚Äô as you are navigating the canals watching all the other boats filled with things to sell We had a wonderful lunch in the market after our boat trip The only thing I would caution is I wish they gave you more time to look around in each market Be prepared your shopping time in these two wonderful markets is very limited

title: Only way to travel
review: Unless you have all day to kill this is the only way to travel in Bangkok at certain times of the day It's still packed but very efficient for moving around central Bangkok At those peak times will save you hours

title: Fast but boring
review: It is pretty cheap to use a taxi with the meter on  BTS is great and chep if you travel alone Otherwise it's more fun to use tuktuk or taxi Also you have to carry your possibly heavy luggage up and down the stairs

title: efficient & easy to use
review: Liked the efficiency and ease of getting around to avoid the gridlock of the streets  Airconditioned and if you like shopping the links are fantastic  We used the BTS to reach Jim Thompson house

title: Convenient, clean, reliable
review: I enjoyed hopping on the BTS to get across Bangkok It gets you to most important sights  markets The ticketing machine was very intuitive to use with an English option All stations are written in Thai and English super easy to navigate The connections between lines are super smart you don't have to switch floors you simply walk across the platform  Thai people have a great habbit of forming lines during busy times so even during rush hour you can simply line up and get on a train

title: Easy
review: The BTS Skytrain is so easy and affordable to use Buy a day pass and that makes it even cheaper Gets a bit packed at peak times with standing room only but still definitely worth using

title: World Class Train System in Bangkok
review: Absolutely fantastic a truly Worldclass Train System in Bangkok A modern wonder of Marble and Stainless Steel Everything (the Trains Train Platform Train Stations etc) are clean The best way to travel around Bangkok Cheaply Easily and Quickly  Ticketing is easy using a Touchscreen which dispenses a Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) Token and you can pay both in Coins and Paper Bills The machine only gives changes in Coins though The menu is available in Thai or English and you can choose either   Lots of Foreigners take it sometimes with their luggage probably either coming from or going to the airport since the system now integrates with an Airport Line  Foreigners tend to slow down the ticket queue a lot though and the Tokens and Coins are dispensed around your knee area so sometimes kind of hard to reach around and look for the Token and Coins  There is only one line now the Blue Line but as I understand more are being planned Interconnects with the BTS Skytrain seamlessly at certain stations

title: Quick, inexpensive and convenient
review: I used this mode of transportation the entire weekend to save money and to save time sitting in traffic  It was easy to figure out fares and the train was clean and super convenient

title: Take this to avoid the hassle of traffic
review: If your house or hotel is not far from the rail link the BTS or the subway use this if you don't have a lot of luggage to avoid travelling via taxi during rush hour traffic  I used it once and I will use it again during peak traffic hours  It was a fun ride the first time though there was not that much to see and I liked the idea that I would get home at a set time rather than take a risk of wasting money sitting in an expensive airport taxi or limo

title: Smart & faster way to get to the city or back
review: This is the most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok city from the airport or vice versa We used the Airport Rail Link for the first time last week while in Bangkok   We found the service fast cheap and efficient Better than annoying and expensive taxi any day Makkasan is the junction where you can go from the airport to connect with other rail lines Inside the airport it‚Äôs easy to manage just follow the signs It's well marked Doesn‚Äôt take more than 30 minutes to reach   The train stops at 34 stops in between and you can see locals traveling in it as well

title: Amazing way to connect

title: Better than taxi

title: Convenient

title: Great facility for travellers

title: easy
review: easy to use afforadable and frequent  you may wait a couple of trains at rush hour and be prepared to be stuffed in at such times by the train stuffers but it will get you where you need to go

title: Simple.
review: We had a twelve hour stopover in Bangkok having arrived from Krabi in the morning  We decided to take the ARL downtown  The station is simple to navigate to in the basement of the terminal  just go down  All instructions for the ticket machines are in English or use the counter service  There are ARL staff at every point you may make a mistake or require assistance  It is a simple token systemchoose one of seven stations insert money and receive token the rest is simple  The fast service was off on the day we travelled so had to use the 30 minute service to Phaya Thai station (45bht)  This was the nearest for the Khao San Road (40 minuets onward by taxi)  Clean air conditioned train

title: excellent system
review: We used the BTS the week we were there and we found it to be an excellent system Very well air conditioned frequent trains and cheap Also easy to navigate and to understand how it works

title: Good way to travel to and fro from the airport
review: The airport rail link service was fast clean and efficient It links the airport to a BTS skytrain station and a MRT station making it a convenient way to travel The fares were also reasonable and it minimises the tendency for you to be stuck on the roads due to traffic congestion

title: fast connection to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: travel relaxed to the new airport in Bangkok  did it several times and never regret it only disadvantage is earliest start at 6am  latest at 1151pm

title: Super transportation
review: I like the timing Very clean On time But don't be late after 11 pm It's very easy to take tickets Safe place and cheaper than the taxi Helpful stuff

title: Always packed
review: Always packed but they will give up their seat for kids or elderly Pretty fast to wait for the next train to arrive etc

title: Excellent way to travel!
review: However the payment system is a bit "complicated"time consuming when crowded Which it was most of the time in January

title: Fantastic trip, brilliant guide, excellent value
review: Great trip Mrs Lucky our guide was full of useful information and well organised We thought we were going to the railway market to see the train coming in but in fact we were taken to a stop about halfway along the line and then travelled on the train to the market (about 30 minutes)  it was brilliant We then went on the minibus to the floating market which was a unique experience  travelling round all the boat stalls by boat We were given time to get lunch (not provided as part of the trip) and then headed back to one of the shopping malls in the centre of Bangkok You don't get taken back to your hotel but we knew that in advance Really enjoyable trip with a brilliant guide and excellent value Highly recommended

title: Long. Interesting countryside. Fascinating trip.
review: We travelled on the second class AC day train which was plenty comfortable but slow We left Bangkok at 830 am and arrived on schedule 12 hours later Staff handed out complimentary drinks and snacks for morning and afternoon tea and lunch   We're tall but the leg room was OK and you could walk along the carriage We found the countryside really interesting and felt we got a much better appreciation for how huge and varied Thailand is   It was easy to get a red truck taxi from the Chiang Mai railway station to our hotel  near the old city  Two of us for 150 baht seemed reasonable   Take toilet paper cos not always available Usual flexible water jet arrangement in toilets Take bottled water too

title: Fast and Cheap Way of Getting to Suvarnabhumi Int'l Airport
review: Train stops running at midnightish so if your flight is before then awesome way really of getting to airport If you are near the BTS take it to Phayathai BTS station where the airport rail link connects Or if you are near the MRT take it to Phetchaburi MRT station where it connects to airport rail link Makassan station The ride is 30 mins approximately from Phayathai (first stop of airport rail link) to the airport And it costs about 45 baht So dirt cheap and fast Only concern would be there have been the rare moments when the train has stopped working which would be a nightmare if you are trying to catch a flight But rare

title: Easy and affordable
review: If you are travelling on your own or with some one else the best and quickest way in to bkk is the airportlink very good price clean and fast

title: fast & convenient

title: Fast and on time
review: Reasonable price It takes around 35 mins from the airport to city Clear direction from airport express to BTS Better pre order the ticket from KLOOK
