review: What a difference from the London Underground Train arrives when it says it will and train is nice and cool TFL take note

title: One of the best rail links in the world
review: The first time I flew in Bkk the rail link to the new and current airport had not been completed  The trip into the center of a strange city by public was a nightmare  Not only does or at least at time did have the slowest moving city traffic in the world there were also no announcement in English  The ride took 90 minutes and I got off near the victory monument  I was lost confused and frustrated  That's all in the past now    The modern rail link is fast and cheap  You can get from the airport to the city in 25 minutes and for around $1  Forget taking a bus or a tax    The rail link loses one point for not running 24 hours  Flight do land and take off outside the operational time of the rail link so if you're on a red eye you will need to take a taxi to the airport

title: Easy and clean
review: If the Skytrain is going near your destination it's an easy and reasonably priced way to go  Trains are clean and only sometimes crowded  Signage in English is sufficient to allow you to figure it out  The clerk at the ticket booth gave us change to use the ticket machine

title: Very easy!
review: Very clean easy to use and a great way to get to the airport It is cheaper than a cab and you don't have to worry about getting stuck in traffic

title: Unforgettable experience
review: Incredible and unforgettable experiences the visits to the railway market and the floating market were excellent All schedules were met and the guide explained details of the markets and Thailand to us The van that transferred us was new and had very good air conditioning and the group was small everything was fine Although when I hired it I knew it was in English I would have liked there to also be options in Spanish

title: Great public transport
review: Quick and wide access to many areas around Bangkok Clean and well maintained is definitely an plus point for public transport and BTS is obviously having it

title: safe fast and cheap way to travel
review: We used the sky train on our last day and found it very user friendly cheap and easy to get on and off The train is air conditioned so was very nice to step into from the heat of Bangkok and very clean We only used it for relatively short distances but was ideal to get around

title: Easy way to travel about the city
review: Excellent modern air conditioned trains frequent service easy to follow directions Don't bother with buying individual tickets just get a day ticket  its only 120 Baht and gives you any number of journeys in the day Well worth it

title: Chiang Mai to Bangkok
review: The number 14 Express isn't a fast train It's an express because it doesn't have as many stops so don't think you'll be zipping through the Thai countryside at a rate of knots you won't We booked because the friends we were travelling with hadn't had the experience of the sleeper train and they were impressed on the whole The staff were helpful the food was good(when did that happen We'd always had to buy from the people who get on and off at the stops) and the beds were clean We wanted to get off at Don Muang which threw them a little and we ended up not getting off there at all but getting off at the next station Howeverit was only a 50 baht taxi ride back to the airport The scenery you see on board is amazing try to look out of the back door as you go over bridges and my kids loved their compartments And pack earplugs these trains are not quiet

title: Easy to navigate
review: I've been using the Airport Rail Link for about 10 years It's so convenient to accessing the BTS I travel mainly with a carryon so it's not overwhelming They offer an elevator at both ends of the train if you're traveling with more than a carryon The entrance at the airport has been upgraded with machines that take bills to allow you to easily buy tokens and that has cut down considerably on the wait

title: Best way to airport
review: I took the airport express for go to Sukumvit area from the airport Frequent service with low prices makes it the ideal mode of transportation to reach airport  It cost me just THB35 to reach makkason station

title: great way to get around
review: The skytrain and an easy well thought out way to get around

title: Clean & efficient
review: Clean efficient quick and good value Easy to use  Very happy to use this instead of taxi as these usually take much longer due to heavy traffic

title: Easy transportation
review: Our kids loved the Skytrain and it make getting in and out of the city easy and affordable Tickets can be bought at the teller or machine

title: a good choice for fast travel to city center for a reasonable price
review: i went to bangkok couple of times and the last trip i decided to use the airport rail link with my friends its quite accessible and its just downstair from BKK airport  at first someone approach me and say that the rail way are closed very crowded bla bla bla just use taxi or hire a rental for cheaper price and the guy using the airport staff id likebut its all just the same scam tactic that the use in bangkok just dont believe them and check it in the nearest information center if you doubt  if you guys use taxi there are more chance you got stuck in very bad traffic and got a very high rates for taxi and dont forget everytime i got into taxi in bangkok most of them tried to scam and turn off the meter

title: FAST & CHEAP
review: For up to two or three people this is the easiest and fastest way to get into the city and the SkylinkSubwayMetro system in Bangkok The entrance is on the lowest floor of the terminal so if you need a ride from the airport into town this is worth trying

title: Best way to get to bangkok international airport
review: The new MRT link from Bangkok city to Suvarnabhumi International Airport has taken all the hassle out of travelling to and from the airport No more haggling with taxi drivers who don't want to use the meter No more sitting in traffic jams now you can jump on a new airconditioned train and using MRT BTS and Skytrain links you can get to most places quickly and inexpensively The only drawback is the line only runs to midnight so those arriving in the early hours will still have to use the taxis I understand that a link to Don Muang is also planned with similar benefits

title: Convenient from airport to Sukhimvit
review: If you're looking to get into town quickly without spending time in the traffic the airport link is for you It is usually packed and you sometimes have to wait up to 15 minutes for a train The only difference is that its a lot cheaper than a taxi

title: Great Service
review: The muchawaited Airport Rail Link (0600midnight) that connects downtown Bangkok with Suvarnabhumi International Airport is a smart alternative to the airport‚Äôs express buses or taxis The City Line makes six stops between downtown (Phayathai Station) and the airport completing each run in 30 minutes making this a quick and convenient transport option for getting in and out of Bangkok  The Airport Rail Link connects you to the MRT underground at Makkasan City Interchange Station (MRT Petchaburi Station) and the BTS Skytrain at Phayathai Station Please note the baggage checkin at Makkasan Station is no longer available   From Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi) the entrance to the Airport Rail Link service is on the First Floor

title: Easy to get around
review: I use the Skytrain anytime I am in Bangkokeasy to use essy to navigatecost is minimal and there are lots of places to go The stops are convenient to many areas and I find it fun to see the different parts of the city

title: BTS Sky train BKK
review: Get a Rabbit card and put credit on it to save time going through the barriers at the stations The best and fastest way round the town

title: Very efficient
review: Fast and clean trains connect with two lines various zones in Bangkok Quite expensive for the local people a ticket ranges around 40 baths 8more or less one euro) depending on the distance If you are sweaty for the high humidity of the city pay attention to the air conditioning that is quite strong and cold

title: Best option
review: Taxis and tucs tucs are very bad in town  The best option is bts  Is the only transportation we used in our Bangkok stay It is pity does not arrive khao Sam area

title: Convinient
review: Traffic in Bangkok can get crazy and this train will help you move faster around the city Not to worry if you are not familiar with the city it will mention the name of the stage keep your ears open most people there do not understand English

title: Quick
review: It's the best way to travel especially at weekends evenings and hwnt it's far where you're going It"s fast It"s nor cheap however in some stations you walk long and it's freezing cold inside trains you get a shock whn you enter Bets way to catch a cold because sometimes it's 35 degrees outside and 18 degrees inside the train

title: Recom
review: Very convenient and doesn't have to wait for taxi and traffic jam Simply take the rail link to the city with affordable price and save your traveling time

title: Average Train
review: Easy way to transport and so convenient way as an visitor i would take city art map and go wherever i want always looking for easy transport no more hurdle on traveling

title: fast and central
review: Great Connectivity to the heart of the  City and aslo several good  connections on the way to the  Thai Rail System one can easily get from the baggage area to the  train in a jiffy

title: Fast
review: I love BTS so much and I always use it because it's fast very clean not so expensive very easy if you to visit Bangkok it's better to use the BTS and MRT to get the experience enjoy

title: Modern, efficient, clean
review: Modern clean and highly efficient way to travel around Bangkok and bypass much of the traffic  We were staying at the Shangri La on the river and this was a fantastic way to quickly travel to other areas of Bangkok

title: Like the London Underground but Over ground!
review: Very efficient and economical way to travel around the city You can buy individual fares 24hr pass and week pass Individual fare for one stop just 15 baht at time of review Can get very crowded haing to squeeze in fortunately there was air conditioning The skytrains and stations were very clean The station I used (Rtratchadamri) was accessible by steps and lift

title: Excellent public transport
review: The BTS is Bangkoks best public transport  Connect most of the city center  Watch out for the city rush hour as the translation is loaded with people and you may not get on to the train   Unfortunately the BTS offers no tickets for visirors like a 3 days and a weekly ticket Shame  Othwise very good

title: Rush Trip
review: The place was good & exciting however the trip was so rushing therefore we could not really enjoyed the experience The guide was late when she‚Äôs picking us from our hotel she came nearly 9am from the original time 830am The guide also keep on raising her voice to us with her broken English so we kind of annoyed

title: very close to hotel
review: bts sky train is very close to hotel and well connected to chatuchuk market and sephen taskinwater front

title: The best way to visit Bangkok
review: Clean efficient air conditioned fast simple to use simply the best way to commute in Bangkok given the horrendous traffic Only down side is that it does not take you to the Royal Palace and other major attractions But solution is to take BTS to the river stop and then transfer to a taxi boat that drops you opposite Wat Arun and in front of the Royal Palace

title: Bangkok will be trouble without this train
review: Convenient cheap and u dont have to feel upset by overpriced taxi or tuktuk Btw the bts hasnt covered every part of bkk u need to find the closest station and take taxi to wherever u want

title: It was very good
review: It was a very satisfying tour It took about 15 hours one way to the first destination and a little over 2 hours on the way back due to traffic jams but if you can put up with that I think it was an extremely good tour Personally I thought it was good value for money

title: Very convenient
review: It is very accessible from the airport going to my hotel in the city to catch the airport link train Its costs 45 baht from the airport going to phaya thai station From there is a BTS station which will bring me to my hotel VERY CONVENIENT

title: Modern, fast and inexpensive1
review: Clean fast and very convenient Signs should be improved from the Metro since you've to walk about 200 m outside

title: Absolutely love it.
review: It's clean and safe to travel at any time and has no graffiti I like the TV monitor adverts in the trains I only wished I had persisted with my Thai language classes

title: Ultra cheap transport to/from Don Muang Airport!
review: If you are on some sort of mission to prove that you can survive on next to nothing as a tourist you may wish to take the train tofrom Don Muang Airport  The train station is directly across from the airport  Be warned however the train is slow hot and inconvenient

title: Safe Travel
review: This is an affordable safe clean service that beats the traffic and very high cab fares The train takes about an 30 mins whereas the cab takes over an hour  The drawbacks are that if you have lots of bags then you could have a problem Secondly the stations in the city are few and your hotel might require you to have to taxi from the station to the hotel Thirdly the stations only open 0545 making an early flight connection stressful as you would not like to miss the first train arriving at the airport about 30 to 40 mins later Fourthly the trains are very fullduring peak hours

title: good mode of transportation
review: A good mode of transportation when heading to the airport avoid during peak hours  We made the mistake of using during peak hours and we were crammed in like sardines with no room to move and hardly enough room to breathe  The other times we rode it was nowhere near as crowded and was a decent ride

title: Convenient and cheap way to town
review: Convenient and cheap way to town 45baht It is very crowd in the morning (airport to town) and in the evening (town to airport) Not sure other timing

title: metro train
review: very well maintainedeven uneducated people will understand the route easy and comfortable ac train trip can enjoy the automatic counter

title: Convenient mean of travelling within BKK!
review: It‚Äôs punctual You can plan your daily schedule well by travelling with MRT   It‚Äôs going to be extended to greater BKK in several monthsI‚Äôm really looking forward to travel to more important places via MRT   Some of the new stations‚Äô appearance are spectacular I‚Äôd love to see the real station

title: Used this twice
review: Used this train service twice and it puts Britain to shame with its downright efficiency Very inexpensive fast  comfortable and clear maps  Made our first visit to Asia easier

title: Like it
review: Pretty easy to use if you are used to city travel Easy to add money to your card and easy to navigate

title: Always buy a one day pass whilst in BKK
review: It is probably hard to imagine BKK before the BTS Most obvious thing is the sight of it as it makes its way across the city in its elevated position But from the platforms and occasionally from the trains you do gets to see some sights Apart from the MRT it is the most efficient way to get around If you think you are going to make more then one trip then I would advise buying a oneday pass It means you wont have to queue up the next time you go on it that day

title: cheapest and fastest way to travel to and from the airport
review: This train takes you to the center of Bangkok from the airport The stations also connect to the light rail network that can take you anywhere around the city Cheap and fast highly recommended

title: easy once you know the ropes
review: The first ticket we bought took us one station for 4$ The second day after researching online and actually reading (in English) directions at the station we bought a day pass for 130bhat (4$)  Although crowded during rush hours fast and efficient  When we stepped into the train the cool AC was worth the money  95* and 85% humidity outside  They got that right for sure  Don't know if you can buy a day pass from the machine we went to a teller  At our last exit was gave our pass to a patron in line

title: Great service
review: This truly is the way to move around in Bangkok The trains are clean and the frequent number of trains make it easy to travel quickly

title: A definite must to when in Thailand!
review: This trip is a definite must for visitors to Thailand Great tour great itinerary and great tour guide named Lucky The train market is such a unique experience Tip try sticky rice and mango while waiting for the train at the Maekong Station  Next went to the Floating Market which is also a unique experience Remember to bargain here Lucky was very friendly and provided some interesting insight and tips during the trip Highly recommend going on this tour

title: Best way to move around and avoid traffic.
review: The train was very clean  I guess they are new by the way they look  Airconditioning was good and the trains are not too crowded

title: Unreliable experience during rush hour
review: The airport rail was unreliable when I took it back to the airport  It was during rush hour and the train was so packed  At one time all the passengers were asked to come down from the train due to some unknown issue on the train and the subsequent train that comes I am not able to get on the train  It frustrates us as I almost missed my flight due to the long wait when I am being asked to get down the train  Do go extrememly early to avoid this experience  Otherwise it is an economical ride to skip all the jam experience

title: easy
review: We traveled by airport link from the airport to the centre of Bangkok and I found it very easy and comfortable No traffic not too many people fast and easy The ticket machines are simple to use one way ticket to the last station is very cheap  THB 45 while taxi cost THB 520 It was a great choice and I would use it again

title: Best way into Bangkok
review: No traffic no hassle   45 baht and you are going into Bangkok like a local   If you don't have much luggage it's a breeze to take and connect to the MRT or the BTS  If you have a lot of luggage  take a taxi or uber

title: SkyTrain is tops
review: Such a simple concept to travel from one area to another at the airport and yet it was superb I was very impressed with this form of transport for travellers in general

title: Easy
review: Easy to navigate and cheap to get around bangkok  Dont let it intimidate you there are English signs everywhere

title: Fast, conveneint but seats are very slim.
review: It's a great means of trasnport if your getting to the airport on time might be hampered by the often crazy Bangkok traffic It takes 26 minutes from Phaya Thai BTS and only costs 45 Baht ow We took it around rush hour 8459 coming in trains were quite full bopt not so going out Certainly recommened for single travellers and those that don't want to have to worry about traffic jams

title: Really easy to use
review: Clean and well run service Easy to use Cheap travel Only issue is doesnt go into the old city need to use tuk tuks to get there

title: Easy to use and reliable.
review: Accessed the train at makasan Easy connection from petchabury MRT Easy to use and speedy access to the airport Good value

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: The skytrain is the easier option to travel whilst in Bangkok Traffic is heavy and the skytrain offers a clean and fast alternative

title: Efficient wat to get around Bangkok
review: Although sometimes climbing up & down the steps to the actual Skytrin platform is a drag this is the most safest & quickest way to get from A to B in Bangkok You could use a motorbike taxi but that is acertainly more dangerous Whislt I have tgravelled on several MetroundergroundMRT systems in the world Bangkoks is not the best & certainly not the worst The only downfall with the Skytrain is that the majority of the platforms are not servced 100% by either escalators or elevators Most of them will have either an up or down escalator but not both Now if you are disabled this may make your journey a slight hassle This asside it still is a good way get around The best way to utilize your funds is use the Rabbit card which is a prepaid card that you can top up at any station The Rabbit card can also can be used in shops to purchase goods as well The carriages are clean & well kept No food & drinks allowed on them

title: Beats the Bangkok traffic
review: Easy to use for nonThai speakers and cheap  Trains are crowded on weekends but manageable and the speed of travel makes it worthwhile vs sitting in a traffic jam  Save your coins as ticket machines do not take notes

title: the only way to travel in bkk
review: no need to look for taxi BTS will take u to major places and then motorbike if u not like to walk traffic can keep you long time in a cab

title: Great way to get around
review: BTS system is a great way to get around Bangkok It's cool and clean Beats the huge traffic jamsSome of the stations have many many stairs If you have a pram wheelchair or have bad knees just google first to see if the stop u want is accesable Day pass THB140 good value

title: Super quick and cheap!  Get a rabbit card
review: This is by fair the best way to travel in BKK  Aircon in the selections the seats are clean and it is truly the cheapest way to move about in a traffic filled BKK rush hr

title: Confusing for me, but....
review: Luckily I was travelling with a friend who was familiar with Bangkok and the Sky Train  I honestly could not make out where we were headed based on the "maps"  I'll definitely do my homework on the Sky Train before I decide to travel through Bangkok on my own

title: Amazing
review: Amazing addition to BKK makes transport around the city very easy and accessible Things like this make BKK world class Emmaculate clean better than London etc

title: Easy to use
review: The BTS Skytrain is simple to use with most station close to shopping centers It is safe clean and quick It is user friendly and the staff are helpful and professional if you need to ask directions or questions

title: Excellent experience
review: We had an excellent day Joe our guide was very attentive and knowledgeable and with a sense of humour We saw the sights we were expecting and had time to enjoy them along with several rest stops A long but very enjoyable day

title: Nice!
review: A very fast and efficient way to go into city At least it help to avoid traffic jam when taking taxi or transfer to hotels Plus it is cheap in ticket too

title: Cut down your taxi costs and save time
review: It is unlikely to take you straight to where you want to go but you can get into town quickly and cheaply with this train from the bottom level at the airport  At two recent visits in January and February 2015 I found the Express Line out of order Still the slower City Linewhich runs the same route but with more stopsis a good complement to taxi if you can find a station close to your destination  A taxi from the train station does not carry the mandatory 50B airport charge Many taxi drivers will ask you to pay a high flat fee rather than using the meter I have found that firmly and politely insisting on the meterand if necessary mention the Tourist Policehas given me much cheaper rides

title: easy cheap and efficient!
review: the best way to get around in Bangkok  study the line in advance so you will safe time  buy the day ticket is easy and can safe you a lot of money in cause you are in the wrong line

title: Excellent Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS (Skytrain) is arguably the best way to travel within the city of Bangkok Stations are almost everywhere  they intersect with the MRT and airport rail line at certain stations Easy access to almost anywhere in Bangkok but not too cheap But it is better than bargaining with taxi or tuktuk drivers

title: Amazing value
review: Wow how easy was this to use just follow the signs it's about 4 floors down from arrivals Very cheap and airconditioning as you travel

title: Fast way to get to the city center
review: It take up to 30 min to get to the city center cost 45 THB Starts from the lowest level on Bangkok`s airport

title: Very travelers friendly
review: They announce every stop with Thai and English There are maps with lights showing the ways on top of the doors and TV with English writing the stops So English reading travelers will have no problem finding their ways

title: Economy way to get to town from airport
review: Airport railway link is one of the cheapest way to get to town from airport which also prevent from being cheated by bad taxi drivers and to avoid traffic jam as well haha however this only applicable to those user of Suvarnabhumi International Airport it took less than 30 min from Phaya Thai station to airport Seats not always available so it may not be a comfortable way of travel if you are taking heavy and bulky luggage during busy period ARL got linkage to both BTS (at Phaya Thai) and MRT (at Makassan) I have use BTS mostly drg the trip and found that The linkage from Phaya Thai ARL to BTS is very convenient and easy However most BTS station don't have escalator and lift is locked (need to call the staff if want to use it) so walking up and down staircase with luggage would be rather tiring Next round would try to stay near MRT

title: Quickly gets to the airport.  Fast and cheap.
review: I took the airport rail link both directions between Makkasan and the airport several times  It is fast and cheap  There is room for some luggage but not too much

title: Beautiful countryside and interesting history
review: We did the Burma Railway on a tour from KanchanaburiWe got to learn all about its building and got to ride the train on that part of the line from BangkokBeautiful countryside and awful history but was a great thing to do i whilst in the areaThe train isnt special in itself but the scenery makes up for it

title: Great way to get around
review: We had to get from Central World Plaza to Taksin and a cab would have taken more than 1 hour in Friday 5pm traffic We got there in 15 minutes on the Skytrain for less than $1 each

title: the most convenient way to travel.
review: Only way to reach on time and happy  is the skytrain & the BTS The cab & tuktuk drivers are getting irritating by the days just as the traffic

title: Fast easy and cheap way to travel from Airport to city
review: This train provides great way to transfer from the airport if you are not carrying too much luggage Its fast and cheap During the day this is a great way to avoid the traffic jams are reach your hotel fast At phaya thai station it connects to the BTS

title: Handy
review: Easy access also from Thonbury side on the western part of the city Best thing Bangkok offered no more taxi stuck In traffic Thanks to the Skytrrain I stayed in a beautiful condo with a fantastic river view and I was always on time for my meetings

title: Fastest way to commute during peak traffic time.
review: Fastest way to commute during peak traffic time During peak traffic time you see a lot of traffic on road and with BST you can avoid that I would not say its cheap but its value for money and saves a lot of time Know Routes before and remember the stations and its a good mode to travel specially if you are alone

title: Avoid Bangkok Traffic
review: Cut the hour's travel and take train for 1015 minutes to reach your destination Eventhough taking bus is cheaper but considering the time BTS is much more worth it than any other transportation

title: Works great
review: It's fast cheap and with ar conditioner Will take you everywhere There's a lot of tragic in Bangkok so this is a great choice

title: efficient
review: Very efficient and clean easy to use The maps above the doors inside the trains and the station names running on the bottom of the TV monitors help you understand your stop if you are new

title: Highly Recommend
review: This was a great tour and Ex was a great guide I like to have time to wander around by myself and reflect The guide provided a good balance of information and then time for me to walk around Every aspect of this trip was great with plenty of time at each stop to read and explore I also got to try some local food on the train  delicious

title: May need to queue up for a long time to get ticket at Asok
review: Since Rabbit card cannot be used for MRT if you have to get ticket at Asok (connected to BTS) there is always a long queue And return tickets are not available

title: The only way to get around
review: Love the "sky train" as It's referred to my locals They are fast you never have to wait at stations long security is always visible on the platform & you feel safe The cars have  automatic air conditioning that cools you off right away from the hot humid bangkok weather & free wifi in the train cars  The best form of transportation in Bangkok that is inexpensive

title: Travel problems!!!
review: Who want to travel via this system should be provide at least 30mins because it‚Äôs always broken All avoid traveling during rush hour

title: Painful
review: This was being built in 2006 finally started operation 2016  I used it this month as though yes finally an easy way in to town with no traffic   I did not expect getting on the train to be a major operation waiting for one to come not regular   Then many many stops later we reached end of line to change to BTS which is a lot better   The hassle with suite cases just not good unless you have a very small one and don't mind the stop stop stop stop and stop   Don't do it with lots of luggage

title: Great way to get around Town
review: No fuss way to traverse Bangkok Cheap efficient and connects with BTS canal water taxis and river taxis for even more destinations

title: A Comfortable and Cheap Ride
review: Airport to Phaya Thai cost is 45 Thai Baht it takes around 40 minutes to reach phaya thai from airport in this train which otherwise in car would take more than one hour and cost you more

title: clean and efficient
review: we used it to go shopping you have to use the machines to buy your tickets but there are plenty a people to help you

title: Great to use
review: This service saves a lot of hassle at the airportit is easy to use and cheapOne thing to make sure of that your hotel is close to itor you will have a hard time getting a taxi from the MRT station to your hotelTrains run once or twice and hour depending on the time of year and check as some do not stop at all the stations

title: Clean and efficient
review: What a great way to get around Bangkok Cheap tickets which are easy to purchase and a very clean interior carriage

title: Quick, clean....but limited
review: Great way to get around the Bangkok traffic congestion  Fairly easy to navigate and not too expensive  However very limited range and stops so may need to take another form of transportation or hike it for a while once you arrive

title: convinience in Bangkok
review: I can't imagine if BKK have no BTS what will happen BTS is the most convience way to travel in BKK althought it is not cheap compare to MRT but is still the best way to save time travel

title: View from the Skytrain.
review: While we were in Bangkok we made use of the BTS Skytrain because it was just 5 blocks from our hotel  We find it very useful and cheaper that taking tuk tuk or taxi  It was always on time  Yes it was crowded during rush hours but it did not bother us  While riding you get to see some nice views and nice buildings  We enjoyed it

title: Civilised enough and hope it can reach out to more destinations sometime
review: Not as frequent as in HK or Singapore but people are very gentle and polite compared to some countries that are very aggressive people Still a great way to travel around especially during peak hour If you have more than 3 people and not peak hourtake a taxi instead as it is cheaper

title: Nothing New
review: As expected it was not something extra ordinary it was normal a simple public transport I could barely see the expats in it Anyways it was ok

title: Perfect Transportation
review: The best transportation option in Bangkok to use as its save time and money Trains are very clean and always on time

title: Very easy to use
review: On our recent trip to Bangkok we used the BTS Skytrain often because traffic was terrible The BTS is very easy to use and cheap

title: Clean, modern, fast and easy to use
review: Hopefully BTS would consider changing their Skytrain ticket machines or allow ticket offices to sell tickets so we don't have to queue twice once to get change and than again to buy a ticket Otherwise it is an excellent transport system

title: Efficient
review: A great way to get around Bangkok as you'll never get stuck in traffic The cars are also air conditioned which is good because it can get very crowded

title: For ease and convenience
review: I have spent hours on the sky train over many years and it beats taxis hands down It saves time and money and you can transition to the MRT easily for other locations

title: Means of Transportation
review: Very cleanfast and timely means of transportation very cheap too The metro rail is placed strategically so you can get into the train from almost any place especially the sukhumvits

title: Great mode of transportation!
review: The airport rail link was very accessible The train station is connected to the airport which makes it very convenient to travellers The fare is very affordable as compared to using a taxi to get to the airport Highly recommended

title: Best Transport in Bangkok
review: Very convenient and price is reasonable to travel to downtown from Airport Would suggest people to take the Airport Rail is they are travelling in light travel baggage

title: clean
review: it is very clean and on time I think there should be more stops like Taiwan so we don't have to take taxi to places where we want to go

title: Great for getting around Bangkok city
review: The train is clean and efficient and gets you to pretty much anywhere in the heart of Bangkok city Purchasing of ticket is also easy as there are 3 way to do it over the counter automated machine which only accepts coins automated machine which accepts both cash and coins (good for purchasing multiple tickets) There are also clear signage for exits to attractions nearby the BTS station

title: Great way to get round town
review: Great way to get round town Regular  efficient  easy to use and air conditioned Beat the Bangkok traffic

title: Fast, Cheap and Efficient
review: Hands down the best way to get to the airport and get to town For just 45 Baht you can get to the airport or to your hotel The trains are clean cool and fast

title: Why take Taxi when you have this!
review: It was our first time taking this as the previous trips to Bangkok were all taxis It's so easy and convenient to locate the airport railway link from Suvarnabhumi Airport There's often crowds as everyone's having the same mindset in saving cost Go right to the end as usually seats are more and spacious standing area too To Phaya Thai for example once alight and switch to BTS train and gets to the stations where most hotels are located So easy

title: Best way to travel in rush hour

title: Efficient way to get around teh city
review: We had always used the skytrain to commute during our trips to Bangkok It is hassle free no traffic jams clean and no haggling with taxi or tuktuk drivers This time of visit we tried using the rabbit card It definitely made our journey easier No need to queue for tickets or exchange money to get coins   Some tourists (especially from my home country) are reluctant to try this mode of transportation due to being told that it‚Äôs confusing and unclean Which is not true at all Instructions are well written in english and if you do need to ask for information people at the desk and security guards at the stations are more than willing to help   It does get crowded during peak hours and on weekends People were courteous though They would give up seat for my elderly mother and my toddler most of the time

title: Clean, efficient, safe and cheap service
review: After years of riding the Brussels metro this system is a delight Very smooth stopping and starting easy to stand during the journey Plenty of maps and information inside the train to let you know where you are and what the next station is At one station I saw a security guard waiting especially to help a blind man from the train and guide him from the station

title: Quick and cheap way to reach the city from the Suvarnabhumi airport
review: There is no faster way to reach the city from Bangkok's main airport (those coming on budget airlines from Don Muang would need to take the A1 express bus for thb40 to Mo Chit BTS station or grab a taxi there is a new train line that is under construction as of April 2016 so there will be another option later this year) Makkasan Station (near to Petchaburi MRT) only cost thb40 per person and the end of the line Phaya Thai Station is only thb45 (to connect with Phaya Thai BTS) Takes around 30 minutes to get to the end of the line and can get crowded with locals stopping at other stations along the way Boarding from the airport will usually mean you can get a seat but those with a lot of luggage will struggle a bit It is far cheaper than most other airport rail links in other cities

title: Honest review full tour details
review: Hi guys I feel like an honest review is really needed here I‚Äôm glad I went but wouldn‚Äôt go again Firstly you need to allow 8 hours not 6 What happens is they pick you up for your hotel you drive to another meeting place of all the vans and wait around half an hour for all the vans to be full Then it‚Äôs a 2 hour van ride to the railway tracks where you wait around 15 for the train and jump on a train Then train takes you half an hour to the market where you jump off You only have 15 minutes here to look at the market and grab a drink The back in the van for half an hour to get to the floating market You hop on a floating boat which is amazing and go down the markets However it is a bit awkward with other people in the boat to ask the lady to stop at every shop We did stop at the ice cream and mango sticky rice stall though and it was amazing Then you get to this area on land with a lot more stalls and food places You get around 30 minutes here We bought some dresses and nicnacks for home Beautiful artwork and so much more Then they round you up again for a 2 hour slog back to Bangkok but they don‚Äôt drop you back to your hotel They drop you to the MBK shopping mall and you have to get your own taxi back As I said I am glad I did it but wouldn‚Äôt do it again and wish I knew the time was longer (we had things on in the afternoon) and how much driving there was

title: Worth seeing the Floating Market; Railway Market was brief.
review: Overall I‚Äôm glad I did this excursion I especially loved seeing the Floating Market That alone was worth seeing I surprisingly enjoyed the Floating Market more than the Railway Market The tour included a boat ride through the Floating Market which was a lot of fun  I think the main downside of the tour was the Railway Market portion felt too short We only had a short time to explore the market and see the trains A local told me the best time to see the trains are earlier in the day before 8am because later in the morning gets too touristy She said there are trains at 830am and 900am that are probably better times to go see the market (our train sighting was at 1130 and it was packed with tourists) If I had felt comfortable navigating to the area on my own I would have tried to get to the market earlier in the day around 8am but I opted to do the tour because the market is hard to access on your own from Bangkok I was told to get to the Railway Market independently you‚Äôd basically need to take a Grab and negotiate with the Grab driver to wait for you which felt too unreliable for me as a solo traveler who does not speak Thai So in the end I do think it‚Äôs better going as part of an organized tour even if the timing was not ideal  Our guide for the trip was friendly and professional She was enthusiastic and had great positive energy She was also diligent about making sure nobody was missing from the group I especially appreciated that she organized bathroom breaks at nicer bathrooms on the way there and back   I‚Äôm still glad I did the tour because it would have been too challenging for me to try and get to the Railway and Floating Markets on my own Both markets are definitely worth seeing if in Bangkok However I personally would have preferred leaving earlier in the day to get the the Railway Market at 8am to see the 830 and 900 trains and then have more time to explore the market I still would recommend this tour to other travelers because the markets are fun to see and definitely unique

title: Needs expanding
review: Easy and quick way to get around Bangkok Cheap and easy to work out (you just pay the amount shown next to the station you select to get off at) From what I gathered it's a relatively new system of public transport in Bangkok so there's only a couple of lines that run but it works well and is very quick easy and clean

title: Best way to get around!
review: Considering the heavy traffic you might get caught in while on the way to your destination I highly recommend using the BTS train everywhere you go   Train tickets (one way) costs around 20 baht to 30 baht However if you are planning on a whole day out you might want to consider getting the Unlimited day pass at only 150baht  However do embrace yourself for quite a crowd on days like Friday evenings  Saturday evenings   Main shopping districts and areas are easily accessible via BTS  Siam Shopping District  Siam Station  National Stadium Station MBK mall  National Stadium Station Boats to Asiatique  Wat Pho  Wat Arun  Saphan Taksin Station  Worth the ride rather than being stuck in traffic

title: I pity the fool that goes to Bangkok and don't take the MR.T!
review: We took the MRT (the MrT as we called it) as much as we possibly could while in Bangkok because we loved it  It was almost impossibly clean incredibly efficient and the other riders were beyond polite and respectful  There is a glass wall between the waiting are and the tracks so there is zero safety concern there The maps are very easy to read even for someone who speaks no Thai at all and all of the automated ticket machines have a "switch to English" option so even getting started is super fast and easy The fares are based on how far you need to go so you don't end up paying a lot for one stop like on some other systems they dispense a little plastic token that you swipe over a sensor to get in and then insert into a slot at the end of your ride  We generally took it for a ride of about 9 stops and the average fare was between 3040 Baht My favourite part of taking the MrT (other than calling it the MrT) was the animated video they would play on the trains for riders which showed what to do and not to do while using the system It featured these adorable little sausage shaped people and never stopped being hilarious

title: Transport
review: The BTS has and continues to be a critical service in Bangkok The service is fast and efficient although these days the trains can be quite crowded but the Thais being as naturally polite as they are there is never a problem when squeezing in  Also now gets you tofrom the main international airport providing your luggage is easily handled  And by far more safer than jumping into the tuttuktaxi coffin options  Highly recommended
