review: BTS is fabulous Always on time clean air conditioning great and although mostly very crowded was very organised No pushing or bad manners and you always feel safe with guards on every platform

title: A time saver
review: We took the Airport Rail Link from the airport to connect to a train that goes to the downtown area The frequency of trains in the airport link is about 1 train in 15 mins However the wait will be worth it because Bangkok's traffic is crazy throughout the day

title: Integrated system
review: 1 It take minimum 7 THB( depends on location ) to take you to your destination I went from BTS silom to National Stadium for that cheap price Faster than tuk tuk  2 Suitable mode of transport if you wanna go to Siam discovery Siam Paragon and MBK 3 For halal eateries seeker this is probably the most straightforward mode of transport to go to Yana Restaurants and many other in MBK mall and around  4 The train was clean ontime cheap and integrated Free maps connecting all Bangkok attraction is available at train stations counter

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: The sky train is the easy way to get around Bangkok The traffic in Bangkok can be a nightmare So I find it so much easier to jump on and off the sky train and get to the places I want to see hassle free

title: fast and certainly reasonable
review: Once you have sorted the transfer to Skytrain [usually at Praya Thai station} this is a clearly superior way to the airport than taking ripoff taxis  Bangkok transportation planners made this needlessly complicated with the Skytrain transfer

title: Well run!
review: In traffic congested Bangkok using the skytrain to different shops and sites is important The Skytrain is a MUST

title: Cheapest and Fastest
review: Arriving at Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport clear immigration collect baggage and go down to Level B Thats where you can buy the Airport Rail tickets Runs on frequent intervals Hop on and head towards Bangkok city We got off at Ratchaprarop Stn the 2nd last station where we walked about 10min to our hotel Very cheap fast and convenient However its very warm and stuffy inside the train air conditioning not really working and its really sweaty when its packed Hope they will improve on it

title: Trip into the City
review: Took a trip into the city and found it real easy Just ask for directions for the Skytrain and when their have a look at the board with directions on for trains You are at the yellow circle so you can work how many stops away to where you need to stop Very easy top work out and people wait in lines real regemental Arrows will guide you the ones going on wait for those coming off then just walk aboard Happy travels

title: Easiest and cheapest way
review: It is the best way to go to the city from or to the BKK airport  Comfortable and clean in about 30 minutes you can reach skytrain station in the center of Bangkok

title: Not on time, not easy to use
review: Too many people on rush hours is onething But the process of management there is bad You have to exchage the money to coin then you have to buy the ticket at the machine

title: Impressive
review: I loved using the BTS Skytrain to get around in Bangkok very efficient air conditioned really easy to use and if you register your rabbit card you can get discounts at loads of places Puts many western towns to shame especially as this is in addition to their metro service One thing to be aware of is that most stations have concrete steps down to the main roadpavement and no lift so may not be suitable if you have a heavy suitcase etc

title: Very Easy
review: We used the airport rail link to return from Bangkok to the airport on our way home   We rode the BTS Skytrain to Phaya Thai and it's a short walk to the airport rail link station  45 baht per adult for the trip and about 30 minutes  This sure beats the cab ride not just for price but for time  In Bangkok the trip to the airport could vary between 40 minutes and 90 minutes depending on the time you travel and the amount of traffic   Using the MRT or  BTS Skytrain and the airport rail link guarantees a smooth trip to the airport  However be aware that during peak times (79am 47pm) the BTS Skytrain can be packed to the rafters so getting on is a problem even without luggage

title: excellent
review: We used the BTS Skytrine to travel around Bangkok it was easy and quick to use there is a long time to ticket office but you can use the machines if you know what your doing Cheap and good with air conditioning and TV

title: 1st Class Metro/ Tube
review: This is the standard way to travel around Bangkok There are a few rules when using the service   NO Eating NO Drinking   There is aircondition in the metro it is always cold in the metro Some times too cold but its great when you want to cool down after been on the hot hot streets all day  There is a TV running adverts in the carriages you'll spot them immediately WITH audio   There is a constant reminder to off seats to though who need them more   I will say the metro is very full (At least when I used it)

title: Excellent, but...
review: Great clean inexpensive and efficient way to beat the traffic if you are going where it goes The Skytrain does not serve the Grand Palace or riverfront temples For that you need to take a river boat which is fun and very cheap but you have to get to the river first Also the Skytrain has lots of stairs very few escalators and I did not see any elevators (but that doesn't mean there aren't any)

title: nice but limited
review: the BTS is only 2 lines in center not even reaching the temples of bangkok so very limited and too expensive best to take taxi if 2 or more in group

title: Best way to get to and from the airport to centre of Bangkok
review: Cheap fast and efficient Beat the traffic Can be crowded Used it a few times Convenient connections with sky train and metro en route

title: Easy way to get to the airport. But where is express train?
review: I have never been able to catch express train as they only run it one per hour Also heard a rumor that there is no express train in service The regular train are okay and will get you to airport in 30 minutes from downtown Bangkok but could get very crowded

title: The Only Way to Navigate Bangkok!
review: The BTS is seriously the best Peak can certainly be a squeeze with usage increasing However it is still the best way to avoid Bangkok

title: Quick rides!
review: The best way to get around Bangkok very fast Cheap and clean Only one negative When you go through the gates do it fast I have some blue and purple marks where the closing gates hit me And my husband as well And no we went through asap

title: Very Convenient
review: I stayed in a hotel just under the BTS station and with just 2 transit I can reach hotel without the traffic jam First take the rail link from airport to Phaya Thai station Transfer to BTS & drop at Siam station Transit to National Stadium line and get down on National Stadium Mercure Bangkok Siam is just few steps away

title: Daily travelled from WongWian Yai station
review: Excellent way to see the city used it everyday and loved the AC and easiness to get around Used the link to Phaya Thai Airport Link which was cheaper then using a taxi

title: Excellent
review: It's cheap efficient and the various lines take you to most of the cities attractions It's easy to use and is well signed in English letting you know which number platform you need to use

title: Great service
review: This is a great way to travel whilst in Bangkok The train is fully air conditioned and sometimes a shawl is necessary to keep the chill off Oh to have this service to replace the London Underground It is not expensive and would recommend buying a Rabbit Card which you can keep topping up rather than purchasing individual tickets

title: Wonderful!
review: Trip to Phya Thai station costs ~45Baht Quick clean and convenient Highly recommended if you're travelling with less than 4 persons Otherwise it MIGHT be cheaper to get to town via a taxi (if you're splitting the price by 4)

title: Great and inexpensive way to travel.
review: The Skytrain is one of the best ways to get around Bangkok both quickly and it is relatively inexpensive It is a great way to avoid traffic jams which often occur in Bangkok

title: Nice way to get around
review: This is a nice way to get around in busy Bangkok It is very clean comfortable and has AC Really cheaper than cabs and scooters and a lot safer too Will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go

title: I always use it and always will
review: I can't hark on enough about how cheap useful it is as a means to travel around Bangkok Particularly if you plan to travel a lot or far in a day (buy a daypss) and especially if you get lost However in December I was unlucky enough to experience the Skytrain when it wasn't working   Most likely a rareity but still the customer service dealing with it was woeful I was heading for the bus station and stood on the platform of E2 for 25 minutes with the approaching train visible in the distance There was no communication from any official throughout the whole time Even the platform guard remained focussed that noone stood near the yellow line Suffice to say I eventually lugged my luggage down the stairs and saw the cashiers handing out refunds so I submitted my ticket and got mine   Believe it or not I did not have one free car taxi pass me until I approached my final destination Previously as I walked along Sukhumvit I did stop in at another station only to find the barriers closed which led me to wonder if anyone was still waiting on E2

title: Travel by your self is the best
review: In Bangkok Especially when everybody finish work the skytrain and the underground is the best You can join the train to the airport with the skytrain lane too

title: Effective and Efficient Travelling on BTS
review: My family and I enjoyed travelling on the BTS skytrain around the city of Bangkok It‚Äôs pricing and swift movement make it a must to use for all travellers using the system  Everyone knows how traffic can be in Bangkok so using the Skytrain to get around makes common sense and reduces waisted time in traffic  Well done to BTS and the Thai Government for such an effective transportation system

title: Easiest Way to get into Bangkok from the Airport
review: I work in Bangkok so when I have to travel for business I make sure that I take the Airport Rail Link Compared to the 400b (minimum) that it will cost you to get into Bangkok the Airport Rail Link is a steal at only 45b It is not 24 hrs so you have to check your arrivaldeparture times to make sure that you are able to catch it otherwise you are taking a taxi I believe it only runs from 6am to 11pm but I have never had a problem catching it since I don't mind hanging out in the airport for a little bit longer for the convenience The end of the line connects you to the BTS Skytrain and from there you can pretty much get to any hotel along Sukhumwit

title: very convenience!!
review: My trip was perfect and no need to stuck in traffic I always travelling by skytrain^ ^ very convenience and cheap

title: Tour the city
review: If traveling around Bangkok if you are near the BTS use it 150 baht will get you a day pass till 1200am So many places to see

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS is by far the easiest way to get around Bangkok With many stations located around the central Bangkok and not the need to go underground Much easier to see Bangkok from the sky train rather than see nothing on the Subway

title: Fast and cheap
review: This is the easiest way to get from the airport to the center of Bangkok Forget pushy taxis and enjoy the scenery from the elevated railway

title: Time saver
review: Commuting in Bangkok has never been easier with BTS You can save a lot of time traveling in the Thailand capital city with ease For example from our hotel on Sukhumvit Soi 103 to MBK takes only 20 minutes how cool is that Highly highly recommend for us all travelers BTS is the way to go

title: Easy to use
review: My husband and I usually only take taxis or private cars when travelling but we found the Skytrain in Bangkok very easy and comfortable to use  Also it was a lot faster than using a taxi because of traffic congestion  We liked the fact that it was airconditioned and everyone lines up when getting on the train  very civilized

title: Incredible and inexpensive trip
review: Our tour guide did an excellent job during our trip She's great at explaining things in details clear and precise  The floating market was quite something and I would recommend it to anyone who hasn't done it yet Train rides and train railway market are absolutely fun   Overall  my experienced from this trip was truly a wonderful one

title: Trains are way too small
review: Trains are way too small Crowded most times of the day in central areas  Signs are very poor at most of the stations There are few signs that actually say the name of the station you're at There are a whole lot of exit signs though   Bangkok BTS and MRT don't seem to be connected which doesn't make much sense   Buying tickets is very confusing you need to go to the desk to tell the attendant which station you are going unless you know the 'zone' you're going to to buy a ticket at the machine  Have no idea where elevators are ever located at stations making it near impossible if you have a baby stroller  Compared to train systems in China Hong Kong Japan or Korea Bangkok's system is poor

title: A unique, instagram-worthy experience, but‚Ä¶
review: The day began with a hotel pickup I was the first pick up of the day and they gave me a chance to speak to the tour guide one on one Kay was a polite and talkative guide with a good command of English We stopped at two more hotels to pick up other tourists before arriving at Riverwalk where we would collect the remainder of our group In total they were 11 people of this tour and K did a good job of interacting with everyone The drive out of Bangkok was approximately an hour long and we were comfortable in our air condition minivan We arrived at a traditional third class train station and waited 15 minutes for the train to arrive We boarded and scramble to get seats For the next 25 minutes we stopped at three other stations and picked up additional passengers The train was filled with a mix of foreigners and local Thais As we drove into the station we could see shop owners and tourists alike pressing themselves against the walls in order to avoid being swept aside by the train that was moving mere inches from their faces It was a unique experience When we got off the train we were told that we had about 25 minutes to explore the market before the train would make the return journey and we would be able to see the same side from on the ground I like this aspect because we got to vantage points and perspectives to this unique experience While at the market we were able to buy some drinks and try some fried snacks We also tried some coconut rice that have been cooked inside of bamboo shoots Within border the bus again and traveled about 40 minutes to the floating market Once there we boarded the little boats and were escorted through the canals for roughly 30 minutes There were a mix of motor boats and ones that were paddled like ours To be honest I prefer the paddle boats and wish that they were less motor boats because they were noisy smelly and aggressive The floating market is primarily a tourist attraction and that‚Äôs exhibited by the items that were on sale Carvings Tshirts paintings coconut ice cream and the like we‚Äôre all geared towards tourist dollars As long as you understand this it‚Äôs still an enjoyable experience because you can get a sense of what it used to be When we got off the boats we had another half hour to explore and fill ourselves up with tasty Thai treats in the local food market The drive back to Bangkok took approximately two hours and 15 minutes because of traffic You should expect this at a minimum We were let off at the MBK shopping mall so please notice when you purchase your ticket because you will not be returned to your pick up spot But MBK is a sight worth exploring and frankly you‚Äôll get much better prices on all those tourist items here so I recommend you do your shopping at this spot   I got fantastic photos and really did enjoy the experience As a solo traveler I really appreciated Kay‚Äôs friendliness and attention to detail Overhearing some of the other tour guides I‚Äôm convinced that we had one of the best It isn‚Äôt the most authentic experience but as long as you know what you‚Äôre going in for it still a worthwhile day trip Recommend

title: Fastest transport in Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain has been very amazing It's better to take the skytrain than to deal with Bangkok traffic It's fast and convenient It might be a little expensive but it's worth it if you think about the amount of time you save The central station is Siam It's very easy to use If you don't have enough change just go to the windows by the entrance and they'll help you with that For more frequent users of the BTS Skytrain it is cheaper to get the Rabbit Card and just top up if you run out of credits Tourists who don't have a lot of luggages it's not a problem to take the Skytrain to Phyathai station and then use the Airport Link It's faster and cheaper than taxi

title: Very efficient
review: A very efficient (fast and cheap) way to go to and from the airport No traffic unlike when we requested for airport pickup in another trip Not crowded

title: Decent Travel Alternative
review: We used the BTS to make half the trip from our hotel to the Muay Thai match  We could have taken Uber the whole way and would have been about the same price but the BTS stop was right by hotel and we wanted to check it out Very intuitive you just find your stop see what the cost is and buy a ticket for that exact cost (assuming you are not using a pass)  Only took us a few minutes to figure out Very limited coverage of the city but a fun option if you want to take a break from Uber

title: Cheap, convenient and efficient
review: The airport rail is a efficient travel method to avoid the bad jam in bkk during peak hour It is cheap and very convenient if you are traveling by from the main airport Highly recommended

title: A Must See
review: This is a great experience The hotel pick up was a nice perk Great way to see some local activities It is a longer ride in an Air conditioned van which was a nice addition The railway market was totally worth experiencing Such amazing local products Then on to the floating market which provides us with the opportunity to see many local products at deep discounted prices We had the opportunity to eat delicious local Thai food and my daughter loved the opportunity to hold a lemur and snake

title: Clean Skytrain, overly crowded, and not handicap or luggage friendly
review: The train is clean very crowded and wish they will have more escalator going up and down If you have a suitcase or luggage most station you will have to carry it up or down if you handicap so help you God

title: Quick and convenient
review: A good way to get to the airport convenient just be careful with rush hour as it can get VERY crowded

title: Best option
review: I think the sky train is the best option by far Having taken a taxi and the sky train the train wins hands down on price comfort and no need to deal with a dodgy taxi driver

title: Cheap option
review: If you are familiar with Bangkok and do not have too much luggage this is a great cheap way to get to and from the airport Super efficient way to get around

title: Bucket list check offs!!
review: Interesting place to check off a bucket list  A lot of people at the railway  Buy a seat so you  watch the train come for 20 Bht Expect a heavy crowd since it is a popular spot  The floating market is also a bucket list but a lot of boats

title: Trip to the River Kwai
review: We did a private tour through Viator Private Tour Thai Burma Death Railway Bridge on the River Kwai Tour from Bangkok This is a great way to visit this important area We had a lovely guide  Tum who was both attentive and knowledgeable It is a 2 hour drive there and back so it is a chance to view outside Bangkok The war cemetery is a somber yet beautiful place We had a great river trip to the bridge and an hour train trip over the bridge and  beyond Followed by a magnificent thai lunch in a local village

title: Amazing public transportation
review: I love the BTS It's incredibly simple and easy to use and it's really cheap They blast the AC in the cars so it's a good way to escape the heat for a bit

title: Good Convenient Transportation Clean & Safe
review: It is so good to go anywhere in Bangkok by BTS since you may get stuck on the road that full of traffic jam if you choose to travel by taxi BTS is cheap convenient cool air con clean & safe

title: Fun journey
review: We had very low expectations of this train after a crazy local Thai train we took recently The trip exceeded out expectations We took the 610pm train and it left right on time getting us into Chiang Mai a little late at 845am The upper bunk was narrow but fine for me my husband slept on the wider lower bunk I actually slept  Dinner was almost inedible so I would recommend bringing snack on and saving yourself the money   The train did get super cold as others mention so definitely bring layers 2nd class cabin was just fine There were two bathroom options one was a hole and one was a western toilet Both gross but I've seen worse Fun way to get to Chiang Mai and get some sleep in the process

title: Great transportation!
review: Not sure if I would call this an attraction  More of a way to get around the BTS skytrain is very handy for travel around the city Super clean and fairly comfortable it was one of our favourite modes of transportation Connecting to or near many of the main attractions it's worth stationing yourself near the route

title: So easy
review: The Sky Train is so easy to use I wonder why I had not been using it more often Very cheap and very efficient with a train along every few minutes and they are airconditioned which is great on those hot days Ticket sellers are very helpful and the automated ticket machines are simple to use Don't sit in a traffic jam take the sky train

title: Good easy and inexpensive connection from the airport to town
review: Good easy and inexpensive connection from the airport to town and generally easy connections to other lines check routes before hiring a taxi

title: Not so much "attraction" as much as "transportation"
review: The skytrain will get you everywhere you need to go in Bangkok Well when paired with busses and those are a little bit more complex but someone will point you in the right direction ) The only complain is that the skytrains are INCREDIBLY over airconditioned so if you have a longer ride ahead of you you might want a light sweater in your bag (as counterintuitive as that seems on a 95degree day)  Entrance to the sky train is organized you will need to get into line But when the passengers depart just keep walking and scooching in You'll be amazed how many people can fit onto this train It won't be pretty but if its rushhour there is no point in waiting for the next train because it will be just as packed If you have luggagehave fun  The booth at every station is only for change for larger bills You will need to purchase your fare card from the automated machine This is much easier than it may seem Don't be intimidated its actually easier than trying to explain where you want to go in Thai  It isn't uncommon for you to be stopped to check your bags or be asked to throw away any open drink containers Don't be surprised

title: Good
review: Its a good way to travel  nice people at the stations to help you  day pass options and a lot better than tuktuks

title: Probably the best way to get around Bangkok
review: Whenever I stay in Bangkok I try to find a place near a BTS station as it makes getting around the city so much easier Grab Taxi makes taking a metered taxi a simple thing to do now but you're still stuck in the gridlock that is BKK And motorcycle taxis are ok for short trips but I wouldn't want to hang on for dear life for more than a few kilometers The BTS is so convenient clean and reliable that I couldn't imagine life in BKK without it You can even take the airport link tofrom Suvarnabhumi and save yourself the hassle of the taxi wait lines

title: Cold but easy to navigate
review: Can get quite crowded If you're going far take a cover up as the air con is freezing Otherwise it is very easy to navigate

title: Free tour. Well close anyway
review: Super cool and close to cold Get a one day pass and plan your day The steps to and from the train can be daunting and forget rush hour

title: Efficient
review: The BTS sky train is as efficient as it is fast Makes getting around Bangkok very easy There are two lines and you buy a card which is easy to top up Together with the metro Bangkok is now very easy to navigate

title: Short trip
review: As it was my first time in Bangkok I wanted to experience this as I had heard about it and fancied a change from taxis tuk tuk's and walking so I got a ticket  following a trip and got on board clean and easy to use

title: Clean, fast and always on time.
review: Here in the Netherlands we cannot even manage to make out crappy old trains (on the ground) go on time but in Bangkok they build the train in the sky and it always works I was very impressed

title: A Must! An Excellent Mode of Transportation!
review: The skytrain is great Coming from NYC I was surprised at how clean and efficient it was There is a guard patrolling making sure no one gets to close to the edge everyone lines up when the train arrives and let's the passengers off frist you don't see that in many cities   As far as Bangkok traffic goes it will save you a lot of time the maps are very easy to read and have English versions the announcements are in English as well Also the cost is great You can essentially get anywhere for only a few dollars And it connects to the BTS Highly recommended

title: Good service!
review: Me and my wife stayed at Eastin hotel which connects with Surasak BTS and it was indeed easy to travel around and walk ( you see more of Bangkok) that way than taking tuk tuk

title: Excellent transport service
review: Cheap and very reliable transport Connect to airport rail link from 2 stations Only downside is that the service stops at midnight

title: Great way of transportation
review: Ww gave BTS a try when spending a few nights in Bangkok and it is really a great way of transportation you and your family around

title: Best Way to Go Around
review: There are two lines Sukhumvit and Silom They don't cover all parts of Bangkok (they even don't cover Grand Palace area) but are the best way to go around without any traffic  The trains were short only contained 4 cars but never got too crowded I think the waiting time was not long so the train was not too crowded The passangers got down and up very neatly They waited for people to get down first then they got on the train afterwards  The fare depended on how many stations were passed The fare was quite more expensive then the city bus' but it worths the price The AC was cool the train was not too crowded easy access to station and easy transfer between lines  Ticket was sold by using vending machine they use 1 5 and 10 B coins But some big station like Siam and National Stadium had a vending machine for paper money You can get change on the machine You can exchange your paper money with coin on the counter I had trouble at the coin vending machine for some times I inserted coins of 1 or 5 but they came out again on the change box  Unfortunately it doesn't cover the most important tourism object in Thailand Grand Palace (

title: Very convenient and timely run
review: As bangkok is heavily trafficked sky train is a very cheap and convenient option especially to visit mallas and chuchuk weekend market

title: Best way to get from Pratinum to the airport.
review: The first time we used this train was when it first opened and was still in a trial period so cost us nothing to use It was fast and efficient then and I am pleased to say that after 5 years nothing has changed other than we now have to pay to use it It's very inexpensive to use though and is a much more enjoyable trip than sitting in a taxi in the traffic

title: Great way to get around.
review: Maps of the BTS system are readily available at the stations It is a great way to get around One day we bought an all day pass for about $480 AUD and this was super economical Other times we paid about a dollar per trip (for about 4 stops) Easy to understand how to pay at the ticket machines too

title: Fantastic
review: A cheap & fast way to move around the city I never use the mafia tuktuk they are more expensive than taxi & you sit in a hot box breathing in exhaust fumes

title: cheap, efficiant and well organised
review: the skytrain is a great way to get around the city trains come along every 3 to 4 minutes beware the doors do not stay open for long as we found out when I got whisked away before the rest of my family could board

title: Safe and efficient
review: You need to line up and be patient to get your token for travel The MRT machines do accept notes There are a lot of steps and not many elevators so if you have heavy bags it is a work out The trains are cool and clean

title: Great tour to the railway market
review: Nice experience The trip was very comfortable (AC Van) and also included a nice train ride to the market

title: Easy and fast
review: Easy and fast way to travel through Bangkok andor to the International AirPort The traffic can be horrible so when we have the chance we chose to go with the AirPort link Affordable but not sure to give everyone a seat to sit The end station is phaya thai where You can change to skytrain (BTS) or taxi

title: Clean and efficient
review: BTS is Excellent Clean Reliable and Safe Its a pity you cannot reach all areas of Bangkok just yet but surely will keep developing

title: Nice choice to get into the city center without traffic jam
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good option (esp in the rush hour) to get into the city 35 Baht (1 Euro 08 US$)each and app 30 min does it take

title: Easy if you're travelling light or if you don't have to change train lines more than once
review: I've used the link several times to get to the airport to meet friends It's quick and convenient and you avoid all those nasty traffic jams Bangkok is renowned for  I wouldn't recommend it if you have to change train lines at peak time with a big suitcase because the interchange stations are frantically busy   Also if you are travelling in pairs or more it may be just as cheap to get a cab from the airport depending on your destination  On Sundays and public holidays the streets are fairly quiet and getting a cab makes sense Also if you're travelling late at night or very early in the morning the roads will be ok However if you arrive at peak times the rail link will be much less stressful the going by cab but you may need to get off at the other end and hop in a cab anyway to reach your final destination

title: Awesome Transportation
review: We used the Skytrain to quickly go from the airport to ‚Äúdowntown‚Äù We were able to leave our bags at the airport and quickly access tourist destinations It was awesome and very inexpensive

title: Bts station was across from the Hotel
review: Used the BTS from Surasak Station everyday was very easy to navigate and some staff spoke English was very cheap

title: Convenient
review: We stayed close to BTS National Stadium so used the Sky Train to get to Chatuchak Market There are two separate lines so make sure you change to the correct line at BTS Siam There were many groups like us who didnt realise you needed to change trains The BTS stop for Chatuchak is Mo Chit If laden with trolleys strollers or the elderly there is a lift at BTS Mo Chit Walk through the park and try one of the alternative entry points to avoid some of the crowd funnelling though the small opening

title: Fastest and cheapest way to zip zap across the Bangkok city
review: BTS skytrain is a fastest way to zip across the busy Bangkok city As a traveller tip ensure that your hotel is closer to  any of the BTS stations a lot of your city travel woes could be minimized  Like most Metro trains across the world BTS ticketing and train route maps are easy to follow for tourists as well The best part is that BTS has stops right Siam Ocean World Mall and MBK Mall two of the largest and best malls in the city

title: A convenient and affordable way to travel
review: This was our first visit to Bangkok so we were a bit wary of public transport  The Skytrain though met our needs for getting around the city in a convenient and affordable way Buying tickets and finding our way around proved to be very easy  Ticket machines only accepted coims but the ticket office was happy to change notes into coins or to issue tickets directly Prices were c3050 baht for mid distance journeys across both lines  Trains seemed to be running every five minutes during the day  For us it connected easily between Saphan Taksin on the river and the Eastern Bus station at Ekkamai but there are also easy connections with the city's underground and the airport link train

title: The Best City Rail.
review: Loved the fuss free efficient service Thais really do deliver service with a smile Western service provider businesses should spend a couple of days in Bangkok to see how it should be done

title: Really convenient if you travel light
review: I've used the Airport Rail Link on every occasion when I've not been towing lots of bags It is so easy to you inexpensive clean and convenient   Don't be afraid to give it a try

title: Songkram 2016
review: Songkram festival is excellent A lot of fun nice people good food and safe city like always AMAZING THAILAND

title: Bad ending!
review: we traveled on a second class sleeper train and the journey itself was actually a great experience and really enjoyable however in the morning when the lady came to collect money for the food we had ordered she had no bill or anything and simply seemed to pluck a number out of thin air and charge all four people in our seeting arrangement the same (far too much) she said it was for comission however although I often tip in Thailand if the service is good we thought around 150 baht in 'comission' each was steep and very sneeky When we called her out on it and asked to see the menu again she quickly opened her purse and handed us all back some of our money as she clearly knew she had been sneaky It defiantly tainted the journey for us slightly however most of the staff were very friendly and helpful don't drink the orange juice it is hardly orange juice more an orange flavored syrupy horrible drink the food was yummy however has made me extremely sick today am defiantly glad we had the experience and think it's a one off thing you have to do

title: So easy to get around!
review: The MRT is a wonderful way to travel from A to B This underground train can only take you two ways so it is easy to find your way Having bought our tickets at the ticket office we descended the escalator to the platform There was only a short wait for the train which took us into the centre of Bangkok This service links with the BTS The station and the train were very clean and when we travelled at midday it was very quiet  Just another part of the excellent public transport system in Bangkok

title: Best mode of travel from the airport to Bangkok city.
review: The airport rail link is very easy to use Buy your ticket apon arrival and travel into Bangkok City can not be easier Much quicker and cheaper than a taxi

title: Easy to use and good fun
review: The staff in the ticket booth would only give you change to buy a ticket from the ticket machine () but other than that the skytrain is a great way to travel and is air conditioned with tinted windows  fantastic for the hot days Fast reliable and cheap

title: Good Public Transportation Option But Beware Of Dishonest Cashiers
review: I rely heavily on public transportation everywhere I go including back home because I do not drive Bangkok's BTS is a good train system although the coverage is not as wide as I'd like it to be   If you want to beat the horrendous BKK traffic while saving some money you should definitely consider BTS The service is frequent fast and reliable while the trains are spacious clean and appropriately air conditioned BTS is perfect for travels within central BKK and inner city only Generally speaking almost all stations have sky bridges connecting each station with the nearby shopping and business area   Most stations use coinsonly ticket machines so you will need to get some coins from the cashiers Word of advice only change with THB20 or THB50 notes Preferably one THB note at a time If you come in a group get a few to queue to change in those recommended denominations This is simply to avoid being shortchanged by the dishonest cashiers It happens a lot to tourists and it happened to my friend and myself personally Besides changing with small THB notes you can always keep the coins when you get some from your shopping etc  The cashier who shortchanged me was really rude when I tried to tell her that I didn't get the correct amount of coins from the exchange Before I could finish saying what I was saying the cashier was already yelling into the microphone telling me to go to the ticket machine I explained to her that I know I was to purchase my ticket from the machine and that she gave me the wrong amount of coins Thereafter she actually told me to hold on for a moment and had me stand in the corner for quite some time and did not even bother to get back to me After waiting for awhile I decided to just cut my losses and leave So beware

title: Riding on the Railway
review: It is a journey I have wanted to do for many years since I first visited the area 8 years ago with my pregnant wife she did not want to ride the railway as she was afraid it would induce labour She was born and grew up in the area as was my daughter  who lived hear for two years until we moved to Phuket Her local family and most Thai‚Äôs have no idea what happened locally during WW2 it is a history that just not taught at the local schools  The section of railway that runs from Kanchanaburi to Nam Tok is the most northern section of the railway that still exists in Thailand the rest is now under the water of a couple of hydro electric schemes that have been built in this region  The train departs from Kanchanaburi at 0607 1030 and 1626 and from Nam Tok at 0719 1448 and 1741 As the journey takes around 2 hours if you want to make it in a day the 1030 train is best As an expat you are charged 100 baht each way a Thai pays 17 baht But this allows you to sit in a more newer carriage with bookable seats my Thai daughter (7) and her cousin (9) had to pay 100 baht to sit with me  The journey is spectacular initially over the River Kwai Bridge and then through very rich arable land mountains and the river it‚Äôs self which winds in and out on the southern side of the track You have to keep reminding yourself that this was all done with hand tools particularly through the rock cuttings  Due to delays we reached Nam Tok at just before 1500 hrs and while the engine was moved to the other end of the train we had to decide to return immediately or wait for the 1741 train We decided to return although there were plenty of local places to eat and a number of tuk tuk drivers offering to take you to the water falls or local caves In fact we returned by carto the falls the next day and all the kids enjoyed splashing around in the water at the Sam Yok waterfalls You can get off at various stops on the way as there are many activities to participate in including zip lining at Sapan Tham Krasae During the journey there are lots of venders who come through the carriages selling cold drinks and local snacks at reasonable prices  A number of day tours get on and off the train at various stops there are 8 and the train was pretty full on the way but pretty empty on the way back  Definitely an easy and inexpensive way of seeing the actual railway working and thinking about all those that died building it but I suggest you do some reading beforehand

title: Better transportation system.
review: There are two main transportation systems in Bangkok other than taxis and busses  The BTS Skytrain like the name implies above ground and the MRT which is the subway  The MRT is by far hands down the more efficient and better managed company of the two  Unfortunately for tourists the BTS takes you thru the center of the city  The MRT circles around from Hua Lampong train station to Chatujack weekend market   MRT offers monthly passes senior and student tickets  No senior tickets at BTS  The MRT has escalators from train platform to ticket counter to street  The BTS was just forced to put in elevators and some stations do not have them at all  The MRT will be your best option if it takes you close to where you need to be ex work or school  It also brings you close to Thailand Cultural Center and right to the door of the Queen Sirikit Convention Center  Plan on very cold air conditioned trains
