review: Travelled on the Skytrain from the International Airport to within 100metres of the Baiyoke Sky Hotel in 20minutes max At rush hour by taxi it would have taken more than an hour in the commuter mayhem

title: Rabbit Cards
review: We are currently in Bangkok and had decided to use the Rabbit Cards Initially you would have to pay 200baht for a card which has a stored value of a 100baht and you will get back 50baht should you decide to return the card at the end of your stay The card will only expiry after 5 years though therefore you might want to keep it with you if you do travel to Bangkok frequently The card can be top up anytime at the train station

title: Quick, convient transport
review: Cheap travel across the city  very frequent service  I never waited more than 5mins for a train Gets very busy during rush hour and evenings

title: Fast & Convenient
review: If you do not wish to spend around 250  300 baht to cab from the airpot to the city area the airpot rail link is the best alternative It cost only 35 baht pax to reach Ratchaprarop Station and just a 5  7 mins to Baiyoke

title: Quick travel to BKK
review: Travelled on the ARL last Saturday from Ratchaprarop station The service started at 0545 and runs about every 1015 minutesit took 22 minutes to get to the airport

title: smooth journey
review: smooth journey but way to many people try to squeeze in even the skytrain is full beware of pickpockets

title: A thing to do? No.  An attraction?  Not really.  A facility to use? Maybe
review: If you are looking for an attractive train station there are much better ones  Hua Hin and Doi Khun Tan come to mind  Or for upcountry busy stations Phitsanulok Nakhon Ratchasima and Ayutthaya come to mind  For attractive surroundings Nakhon Pathom (but not Don Muang) could be added to the list  Compared to other northern suburban train stations (eg Samsen Laksi or Rangsit) this seems just a variation on the theme  but for its proximity to Don Muang (DMK) airport  This station is useful if you are travelling tofrom the north or northeast and are using Don Muang airport or otherwise headed to this area  But I doubt that this would be a "destination" or "thing to do" for many people

title: Fast and easy
review: Fast easy and cheap way of travelling thru Bangkok  Stops are at all the main areas  Climatisation and frequency very good

title: Let the train take the strain
review: Used this both ways this time from the Airport in central Bangkok  30 minute train ride to avoid the traffic jams then a very quick taxi ride to the hotel  Would use the train again

title: Best mode of transportation
review: The Bangkok BTS is a wonderful way to get around Bangkok Do your homework ahead of time to see which station to use It does get crowded during rush hoursallowing for standing room only But Thais are extremely polite people and you will not be brushed up against even in the busiest of times

title: Why get ripped off by the Airport taxes, take the Airport Rail Link
review: On our second arrival at the airport (this time after our beach destination) we decided to try the Airport Rail Link into the city We only had one bag between the two of us so taking the rail link was easy to maneuver  Tickets can be purchased from vending machines before entering the station and the language can be switched to English   Our trip into the city cost only 35THBperson (Makkasan) The end of the line to Phyathia cost 45THB Since we boarded at the airport there was no problem getting a seat One item of note after the arriving train empties you will likely hear the security staff blowing their whistles advising people not to board as a securitytrash sweep is made of the train before anyone is allowed to board then the ‚Äòall clear‚Äô is given to board It‚Äôs a hasslefree transport into the city Also take into consideration if you need to transfer to BTSMRT andor where your hotel is located  {**Don‚Äôt get ripped off‚Ä¶‚Ä¶If you are traveling with lots of luggage or have more than a few people in your party then the taxi is likely your best option and if so demand a meter rate (as the dashboard meter is likely covered with a towel) This is what we experienced on our first trip from the airport as I tried to advise my friend of this scam but he did not listen and this was the incident that transpired for us The driver may give you a laminated card with price quotes and these are ‚Äòsuggested‚Äô nonmetered rates ( ie450 charge+75 tolls+50 airport fee) but don‚Äôt settle for this either You have likely already loaded your luggage into the taxi after waiting in the taxi line and now proceeding on your way out of the airport If the driver still states no meter then simply mention anything about contacting the Airport taxi police and ‚ÄòWalla‚Äô the meter shows up and he will ask you to pay the toll fees and the airport service fee which is correct Our actual taxi fare to our hotel from the airport was 230+75+50THB Yes this may not seem like a big deal but the savings basically paid for a one hour massage}

title: Beat the Traffic
review: Its fast easy very inexpensive mode of transport to get from the airport to the city Normally it would take you a minimum of an hour or maybe more depending in what time of the day you travel Gets into the city (Phaya Thai is the last station and you can get the BTS from there) in 30 mins has 6 stops along the way

title: Great mode of transportation
review: Great way to get around the city out of traffic and into air conditioning If you have trouble climbing stairs this will not be a good choice for you

title: Efficient and cool transport
review: If you are close to the Skytrain use it It is a very fast way to cross Bangkok quickly Maps are in all of the trains and they call all stops in English

title: Ekami to Nana by BTS
review: I travelled through BTS from Ekami BTS to Nana BTS The overeall experience was average to poor In India we have much better sky train that is Delhi Metro

title: Beat the traffic and get to town for a fraction of a cab fare
review: First time I arrived in BKK I took a cab to town When I arrived believe it or not the cabbie himself advised me to take the train on my way back to the airport and the next time I come to Bangkok I did  It can take more than an hour with average traffic with the taxi meter running That‚Äôs if you were lucky Expect a 1520 usd bill  It‚Äôs 20 minutes by train for under 3 usd Hands down the best option

title: Convenient and Cheap
review: the train is really convenient and you will save a lot if you take the transit vs the express train

title: Like our Tube but BETTER!
review: So easy clean fast and trouble free At commuting times its busy but that's to be expected Along with the BTS it's a great way to avoid the bangkok traffic

title: A cheap way of getting closer to the city.
review: I hadn't used this on my previous visits preferring to get a cab to my hotel from the airport My flight arrived early and I had a short wait until the first train left 15 minutes after leaving I was getting off at Makkasan Station saving considerable time and money  The Airport Link is actually two services sharing the same tracks and stations The Express train (red and white) only runs between Makkasan and Suvarnbhumi Airport without stopping The local line (blue and white) runs between Playa Thai (interchange with BTS) and Suvarnbhumi and stops at all stations in between Arriving passengers are encouraged to use the former  In operation it's a cross between BTS an MRT with the stations above ground on more than one level but with payment by one trip tokens bought from a machine with instructions in Thai and English Access is by escalator and lift but the platforms are open so are not air con  Criticisms A few while the Express trains are fast they're not frequent one every 45 minutes is usual The hub station at Makkasan while being modern and spacious (lots of walking) is nowhere near the middle of town There is an MRT station nearby but I took a taxi and had to wait while one was called Also no one uses it I can't remember the last time I took a train that had so few people on it When I left I had to use a local line train (which was reasonably busy) because if I'd waited for an Express I would have missed my flight

title: Highly recommend!
review: Highly recommend This tour is a must Everything went according to plan with no problems Tim the tour guide was full of knowledge and super helpful

title: Clean and cheap
review: Great for travelling inside Bangkok The only issue are the security guards in every station and the somewhat strange paying method and ticket At least the cars are insanely cheap and pretty fast

title: fast and cheap
review: it will save you from dying in some horrific tuktuk car crash security controls are a bit annoying but definitely better safe than sorry remember to keep your ticket handy you will have to rescan it at the exit

title: Great way to get around.
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Get to the airport and back MBK and other shops different districts If you dont want or cant find a Tuktuk then jump on the Skytrain

title: BTS - Best Train Service
review: On a recent trip to Bangkok I am very impressed with the service from BTS A very convenient service to travel around Bangkok and visit it's wonderful places Carriages are clean and the employees are courteous

title: Skytrain
review: The BTS Skytrain is clean and easy to understand But if you are not sure of something just ask at ticket window or their security and they wi  help It is also 3 minute walk from VIE hotel

title: SO convenient! Super cheap & on time!
review: The Airport Rail Link is a fairly new addition to Bangkok It is clean perfectly airconditioned (yaaaay) prompt & super cheap The Link joins the other railway networks to make navigating around Bangkok very cheap & easy

title: Better than travelling on the road during peak hours
review: The BTS is clean and simple to figure out I used it to travel around 4 stations and it costs me 30 baht each way It is especially useful when travelling during peak hours in downtown area as there's usually traffic jam on the roads

title: Struggle with luggage
review: This is a great service if you have no luggage  This time I had a lot of luggage and it was a challenge  On my return trip I asked the taxi driver to take me to Makkasan station and he offered to take me to the airport for 300 THB which I was only too happy to accept

title: Great way to get around city
review: Cheapest form of transport and easy to use  Highly recommend recommended Trains are air conditioned giving a break from the heat  Change available from the manned ticket booths which allow purchase from automatic machines   Closes around midnight

title: A must in this heat!!!
review: Bought the day pass and not only was it convenient but it saved us money Must take advantage in this heat as it is air conditioned Very impressed with how clean and organized this system is People are very kind and they don't push each other or cut in line (unlike the US) Try to book a hotel that is connected to the BTS

title: Lovely and cool
review: Use it Use it you wont be disappointed its lovely and cool on the train its cheap and its in the right place

title: Don‚Äôt book unless you get first class
review: We booked via 12Go and despite booking 4 months in advance they were unable to secure us first class and we got second class sleeper Experience was pretty terrible I would recommend flying if you cannot get first class No privacy very hectic doesn‚Äôt feel clean bathrooms are horrendous (literally a hole onto the tracks  though I assume same for first class) and very noisy all night Also the lights stay on in the cabin the entire time

title: Super cold AC on board. Fast and easy.
review: Bangkok traffic is well known Even my local friends take the BTS to aviod sitting in car for hours to travel a few kms  Clean and fast

title: good way
review: fast secure way to go downtown and air conditioned  you can find machines to buy tickets or a desk to sell it

title: Fascinating journey.
review: We took the weekend special from Bangkok Hualamphong station to Nam Tok returning to Kanchanaburi on the regular train for an overnight stop Although the special started off an hour before the regular service from Thonburi station it is a sightseeing train and made a couple of lengthy stops on the way It was also late so there was no advantage to getting up early for this train While the bridge over the River Kwai was a high spot we found it better to visit the following morning when there weren‚Äôt so many tourists The Wampo Viaduct just before Nam Tok was a high spot Great views from both sides of the train as it curves around the edge of the river For detailed information about the railway check out the seat61 website

title: Too rushed and touristy
review: Was too rushed Was cool that we got to see the railway market from the train but then we had to quickly walk back to the bus to get to the next market Also was expecting more from the floating market It was very touristy and quiet

title: best way to get about Bangkok
review: clean cool quick way way to get your own way around bangkok  Use in conjunction with river taxis and tuktuk for a truely thai travel experience  Dont book taxis accross bangkok you can do the trip in less than half the time by Sky Train

title: Avoid in the evening
review: Its very helpful to save the time but in the morning and evening time too much rush is there you can't even stand properlyEven many of the train staff they can not speak english very wellBut buying a ticket from ticketing machine is quite easy and fast i like that

title: Must use.
review: Very convenient way to get around Bangkok All day pass was (140 Baht) Easy way to miss Bangkok traffic Goes by all major shopping malls

title: Easy way to get around BKK
review: The BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok  And it helps that most attractions and malls are very near some stations You can even take the Airport Rail Link to Phaya Thai BTS to go downtown Bangkok like Sukhumvit which runs from Nana Asok Phrom Phong Thong Lo Ekamai Phra Khanong On Nut Udom Suk Bang Na to Bearing   You need to buy tickets at the machines but if in doubt you can seek help at the station counter  Beware though  some of the staff at the counter can be rude

title: The answer o Bangkok's traffic jams
review: The Skytrain is easy to use the plans are easy to understand exits and platforms are clearly marked The trains seem to run every 5 minutes (at least along Sukhumvit Road) the fares are cheap You get change at a counter you type in the number of your destination station (displayed on a map next to the ticket machine) and you are off and running At big stations there are signs which exit to take for specific hotels or shopping centres It is fast efficient and clean (no eating or drinking allowed) and it will take you to most places Changing trains is not a problem either everything is well signed

title: Great mode of transport
review: Easy to get around using the BTS Recommended to buy the Rabbit Card B$200 each with B$100 value Just tap in and out can be even used to pay for food at Siam Paragon Food Court

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: Great way to travel it's easy to find your way around and it is inexpensive  A number of the attractions are on the line or in walking distance of the Sky train

title: Great ride with kids
review: I took ny family for full ride of BTS got one day ticket Well the only draw back is that it is very rushy First come get the seat The station siam is very crowded because of shopping center

title: Very convenient
review: Very convenient and efficient way to get around in the city When possible it is absolutely the quickest way to travel However only two lines so very limited

title: Good experience
review: Found system really good Easy to get from a to b  Needed coins to buy tickets from machines so make sure you have some as we didn't but was helped at a counter Not many seats on the trains but plenty of announcements asking passengers to give up seats to people more in need as in elderly or pregnant Train system worked well the day we used it so no complaints

title: Forget it. Take a taxi at the taxi counter, you will be 100 times better off
review: If you are a frequent traveler like me you have probably learned that airport rail links are often if not almost always the best safest and fasted way to connect downtown and the airport Well forget this it doesn't apply in Bangkok The downtown stations of the airport rail link are very inconvenient not located near major hotel or business areas and worse of all not user friendly at all for passengers with luggage Yes strange as it may seem they seem to have forgotten that passengers travelling to and from the airport are quite likely to have luggage even sometimes big luggage Try to interchange between the airport link and the BTS and you will need a good deal of strong muscles on your arms to carry your luggage up and down endless stairs as there are no escalators or elevators All this for a price that is not worth it Take a taxi at the public taxi counters outside the arrival hall Price is by meter (guaranteed) with an airport surcharge of THB 50 and the expressway toll to pay In other words for 400 Baht all inclusive you can basically go to any hotel in town in the comfort of your taxi door to door without having to carry anything and without sweat

title: Easy access
review: Widely spread  Getting a day pass is a must  It is so convenient to travel around with BTS  Worry free for hop on hop off travellers

title: Over-capacity, slow
review: Used to use this a lot when my office was nearby Huge shame that they stopped the actual airport express Generally very crowded (at all times of the day after 8 am) Often pretty long waits for a train too Trains are often delayed in my experience At rush hour it will get you to the airport a bit faster if you're lucky enough to be near a skytrain station Otherwise a taxi is much more comfortable if you can afford a couple of hundred baht more

title: Routine travel
review: Air conditioned and splendid Mainly females travelling as males seem addicted to traffic jams below Needs Bangkok wide travel card

title: excellent ride sky train in bangkok
review: Excellent ride with fully air corn blast and reasonable price also very fast to travel than the taxi I love to travel by sky train in a Bangkok than the taxi so convenient

title: Fast and easy
review: The staff were very helpful and we got to our hotel very easily The rail link was easy to find and easy to use

title: Quick and Simple
review: This turned out to be a great way to get into downtown during rush hour Can be a little confusing and the walk to the train with luggage maybe slight a pain Also if you are going to go from rail to sky train make sure you have the right shoes on

title: Fast & efficient
review: By far the best transit system I have ever used it is clean and like most services in Thailand really not expensive

title: fast, convenient, safe
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok Beats the traffic jams Clean well organised and safe The system is easy to handle even for foreigners and there are passes available It can help you reach most of the Bangkok attractions The frequency is good We used it many times during this trip

title: Just like the train in Malaysia
review: It was just like the trainlrt in Malaysia so I have no problems dealing with it The routes was easy to be understood The location of every station was strategically located to attractions in Bangkok Peoples were queuing before enter the train

title: Worst train
review: very poor and very limited and gets very packed at the peak time from 4 to 7 pm no place to stand

title: Easy
review: Access to sky train very easy covers a large area day tickets are worth it should be extended further towards river from the stadium

title: Love the BTS
review: So easy to get around most parts of Bangkok Creates easy access to most attractions and shopping or certainly gets you close enough to take a Tuk Tuk or Boat to your final destination

title: Nice experience but needs to cover more areas!!!
review: Nice experiencespecially if you live in the heart of Bangkok busy city  but it didn't covers all the attractions in Bangkok Very cheap comparing with other international cities

title: Very easy to use and beats the traffic
review: Easy access to the centre of Bangkok from BKK airport in under 30 minutes   The taxis must hate this service

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Very easy to use clean and punctual Transportation is cheap in Thailand but BTS is very convenient when you want to avoid traffic

title: Quick, clean
review: The easiest way to get from airport to town Quick clean it can get quite busy however I hugely rate Bangkok's public transport namely the trains It's new fresh well maintained easy to use well policed Plus the people who use it are polite and quiet

title: Fast,Clean And Easy To Use
review: I have used the BTS many times and did once again during my 2016 trip Cheap and clean to use and once again I had no problems using the service I like the fact that the staff clean all the signs and fittings on each station you dont get that on the Underground back in London  and its so much cleaner than the underground

title: Not an attraction !!
review: This is a  metro Overground  Cheap and easy to navigate and well air conditioned  gets crowded so be mindful of pick pockets  Machines only take coins but we bought a day ticket for just under 3 quid which is around 4 journeys to break even

title: Fast Efficient and Inexpensive
review: A great alternative to shady taxidrivers and noisy tuktuks the Skytrain runs efficiently and fast around the (limited) part of town that it covers It will get you to most shopping destinations and interesting restaurant areas If the skytrain does not get you there try the Metro (equally efficient) or Chao Phraya Express river boat (an experience not to be missed)

title: excellent to get to the city
review: clean safe affordable service what else to ask for Euroe please learn from them and take care your system much better and try to make it as good as they do in Thailand

title: Great way to get around the city.
review: Easy to use you can get coins from the booth then look for the stop you want and read off the amount press the corresponding amount and put in the coins (change given) then off you go Busy but great views Quick clean and safe

title: Fast and Efficient
review: Like its sister the BTS Skytrain this is a brilliant way to get around the city  There is only one line but they are building more all the time  Don't suffer the horrible traffic use the MRT Underground

title: easy way to/from airport
review: not much to say apart from its a great alternative to a taxi I(though these are relatively cheap in Bangkok) and good links to the traintube network in Bangkok

title: Quick and easy.
review: Whenever I'm in Bangkok I prefer to use sky trains They quick and easy to travel Costs are affordable and they are very well connected to different parts of Bangkok If u have less time use Sky Trains They are very well connected They are also connected to BKK airport Having less or no luggage then definitely recommended to take sky trains but if u r having a lot of luggage then it would be smart to take taxi for airports

title: Easy and Very Convenient
review: I have taken Airport link couple of times and wish we could have something similar in other Asian countries

title: Short, Direct trip to the City
review: Was a simple direct and cheap transportation to the city  I only wished that the line operated later than Midnight

title: cool
review: the sky train is great for getting around bangkok also you can change at phaya thai station for airportits got aircon its quick clean and its a cheap way to travel well worth the money

title: Not very crowded, easy to follow the routes
review: I belong to India but still prefer to travel by BTS skytrains Its quick not very crowded Routes are easy to follow (map are behind the tickets) and clean

title: Clean, Quiet, Easy to Use, Avoid Traffic!!!
review: It's really easy to find your way on the MRT the trains are so clean the people on board are quiet  there are signs in English and Thai and a voice over that announces the stopsattendants were helpful as well and it was easy to get a tickethighly recommend just sit back and observe for a minute or so then just pay attention to the signs the maps and the voice overit saved us so much time that we would have spent in trafficand so so clean

title: Great option--just need more connections and elevators
review: Great way to get into town Inexpensively Just be sure you can manage your suitcases using escalators as elevators are not readily available

title: Please try to avoid during a rush hour
review: I often travelled by Skytrain while staying in BKK My hotel is next to Ploenchit station which is 2 stations from Siam Square (one of the main stations and interchange station) One morning I tried to catch a train at 730 am I had to wait till the third train as the first 2 trains were fully packed since previous stations I would highly recommend any tourists to avoid during rush hours After 9am was ok However if u can't avoid you might have to travel back to the opposite direction then changed the train My case if you are at Ploenchit or Nana station Asoke would be an idea as Asoke is an interchange station with subway many people got on and off there Thank you)

title: Clean, frequent..
review: Be a are that a three day pass does not give you use of Purple line 230 THB  Still somewhat cheaper and less crowded than BTS

title: Overcrowded
review: The bts is a good way to get around certain parts of Bangkok but you are like a sardine most of the time   The traffic in Bangkok has gotten significantly worse since when I was last here  so whatever form or transport you take it all has some issues

title: Great way to see the city
review: The Skytrain is fantastic It's super easy to use and trains come at regular intervals not usually more than 5mins apart At one point we got separated some could fit others couldn't but they jumped on the next train and arrived a few minutes after us  The train does get really packed at peak times and its amazing to see how many people can fit in but generally its not too bad This was our first trip to Bangkok and once we discovered the Skytrain we were able to explore the city easily We paid per trip but locals used cards which I think would be a better idea We judt didn't know how to get one but you could ask at tge station

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok It is easy to use and very reasonably priced Easy link to the Airport Rail Link too which makes travel to and from the airport really simple

title: Only way to travel
review: Fast easy accessible and clean  You can buy an all day ticket or single ticket  Very similar to all other train systems across world   Get a train map and off you go  Train map written in English as well as Thai and easy to follow  Chatachuk markets is at Mo Chit station and 3 minute walk   Major shopping centre at Siam station and walk straight in Sampoong cooking school at Chong Nonsi station and they pick you up there  So much easier than taxis in the mad traffic  You can even easily catch a train to or from the airport   Change at Phaya Thai station for airport line  Much cheaper too

title: Good tour
review: Good tour and an excellent experience We started at the Railway market and then continued to the floating market In the railwayu market the time was not enough to buy many souvenirs

title: Dear Tourists..
review: We love touristsbut please please please avoid taking the city line during rush hour ( mf 7am9am and 5pm8pm)if you dont want to suffocatethe express train costs a little more but it is MUCH MUCH more convenientohand when you arrive at phayathai station with bigmultiple luggages please use the elevator at the far right of the platformi dont like to hear people cussingcomplaining about it nor to see someone falls dowm those stairs

title: Amazing!
review: So much intersections and connections  I didnt have to walk too much after getting off a station because there were somany station that catered to so many places

title: Rabbit card
review: Get a rabbit card if you plan to stay for a more than a day  Using the rabbit card avoids having to queue up and buy tickets  Trains come often always spotless people using it are largely well mannered and civil  They queue up one behind the other ready to board the train  Adverts are intrusive at times loud in the train  Not enough signs along the platform to see what station you are at  Not enough maps of the system on the stations  Feels secure with plenty of staff about on platform and in the stations   Very convenient to use to pop from one place to the other

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Frequent trains and very effective ac Beats the traffic in BKK Easy to understand ticket purchasing system and convenient escalators to get you to the platform level Direct walkways to select buildings makes it very convenient to use and avoid crowded sidewalks

title: Beats going by taxi!
review: Fun fast with great views and no traffic jams to sit in Links into the river ferry service to give great coverage

title: Link
review: I love airport rail link  that so help for new tourist who dont know where to go and afraid to get lost coz dont understand the langguage

title: Fastest way to and from Bangkok
review: Very fast getting from the airport to center of Bangkok Price is 30 Baht and a taxi would cost at least 500 Baht

title: quicker option
review: the nonstop is quicker but if you want a cheaper and laid back travel choose the city line The Airport link express takes directly to the departure area If you are go green freak and backpacker go for it

title: Most economical way to reach downtown from Airport
review: Strongly recommended for young tourists to Bangkok Easy and cheap to use Clean and convenient as well

title: Very good
review: Very good reliable transport only downside is that it doesn't go near the tourist attractions would definitely recommend very easy to use and better than bargaining for a tuk tuk

title: Good link between airport and city
review: The airport rail is a cheaper way to go from the airport to the city It connects to the MRT and BTS line making is a very convenient way of travelling

title: Convenient but overcrowded
review: Used the Airport Rail on my departure from Bangkok  The experience was inexpensive  It took just over an hour from the hotel at which we stayed to get to the airport as we had to change lines twice  However the Rail was generally overcrowded  Not certain if I might select this method of transport again

title: Easy to navigate
review: Cheap and easy to figure out the BTS Skytrain Although it can be cramped at times it's a great method to get from one location to another quickly

title: easy to go with
review: Airport Rail Link was easy to travel with after a few minutes of reading how to do to get a ticket so we were on the train to Bangkok

title: Nice way to get to airport without the traffic
review: Wow great service inexpensive and avoid Bangkok traffic  It is deep in BKK airport but keep following the signs to find it

title: Always the first stop in Kanchanaburi
review: So much history happened hereand it's always a great first stop in Kanchanaburi Take a ride on the train if you have time but you'll need all day

title: Reasonable price
review: I would highly recommend this for every backpacker on a budget Easy to find on airport cheap tickets and clean

title: Mixed bag
review: We booked a first class cabin through 12go Asia which was easy and meant that we just needed to pick up the tickets from the office at the train station an hour before departure The train was already on the platform so you could settle straight in Each cabin had a sink and there is a western style toilet in the carriage outside It's a comfortable way of travelling during the day (except for the constant sales visits to the cabin lock the door or they'll just walk in) though not for light sleepers at night The train is noisy and lurches a lot My wife also still felt like she was moving for hours afterwards and was quite queasy We arrived in Chiang Mai an hour early (be prepared you're not woken up so this was quite a surprise as our alarm had only just gone off) Skip the meals and bring your own food and water The air con is strong but can be turned off so don't suffer

title: A good and fast way
review: to get into town but connections with other forms of transport like metro or even taxi's etc leaves to be desired even at the main stations Disconnected services Trains are comfortable and move fast otherwise

title: Extremely modern
review: Taking BTS skytrain is such a pleasure Take a full day ticket B145 Even from airport it is great I lost my day ticket and I am sure the lady trusted me and endorsed the day before What charm By the way the canal Boat is also good to take And meets up with some stations but not advertised

title: Overcrowded
review: You build a massive hub for airport express train checkin but don‚Äôt use it and don‚Äôt have espresso service you fans on the platforms but don‚Äôt turn them on letting your paying customers stand in the heat Yes your service sucks

title: Super efficient
review: Can get to most places in central bangkok Theres further plans to expand Use it very often Links to underground bringing the main train station into play Quicker than taxi to most places Not suitable for wheelchairs

title: Easy to use, clean, aircon
review: One of the better transit systems I've been on English and Thai both written and spoken at each stop Only two lines makes this easy to understand   The way the map is drawn you'd think the two lines are parallel but they're mostly perpendicular Getting a rabbit card makes it much faster as you don't have to stand in long lines every time you want to get on the train

title: Easy and cheap
review: such an easy affordable quick way to travel  Maps easy to follow destinations clearly signposted and air conditioning to die for Bag search with a torch prior to entry was unexpected but obviously OK We bought day passes for 150 baht and easily got our money's worth

title: perfect way to get around BKK
review: Thai & english on maps easy to work out connecting stations to other 2 train systems cheap fast very frequent trains

title: old train
review: takes half an hour from Payathai to the Suvannabhumi airport the train is very old and loud when stopping

title: fast access to the city at a reasonable cost
review: Sky train is an effective and clean way of getting about the city relatively quickly I like the fact signs are English and pretty straightforward to use

title: Very cool, airco, transport within Bangkok!
review: The Bangkok MRT  metro system is a very nice way to go around in Bangkok Fare depends on the distance and we paid Baht 40 from the MBK to the station near the river to take a river boat to the major attractions to avoid  the traffic jams with a taxi

title: Easiest and fastest way to get into Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi airport
review: If you are flying alone or with a partner into Bangkok through Suvarnabhumi International Airport and have carryon only or a small luggage this is the way to get into Bangkok Get off at Makassan station to connect to the MRT line or Phaya Thai station to connect to the BTS line The journey time to Phaya Thai station is about 26 minutes and the cost is 45 Thai Baht

title: who is in charge?
review: try to use mrt around 1720 at ask station nightmare the queues are horrendous trains are not frequent and too short although the platforms are very long trains are ful not even enough aircondition at the stations but the management know that you have no choice so they don't do anything about that unless you dont mind to stand in the traffic jam

title: It's more fun in the BTS Skytrain!
review: On my last day in Bangkok I decided to try its other transport systems  Bus 53 BTS Skytrain and MRT or underground train I took Bus 53 near Khao San Road which took me to the Hua Lampong Train Station where I bought a day ticket for 120 bahts for MRT See my related review of MRT  At the Chatuchak Station where both BTS and MRT can be accessed I bought day ticket from BTS for 140 bahts I was in the train from Mo Chit Station to Bearing Station then Siam Station to Bang Wa The train is fully airconditioned and I immensely enjoyed my ride watching the different neighborhoods we passed by Note that I got off at the Siam Station to try the Food Court of Siam Paragon  Between MRT and BTS the latter is a better option for sightseeing from Point A to Point B or simply riding it like I did   Bus 53 is a local bus not airconditioned Cost is only 650 bahts It goes to Hua Lamphong Station China town Grand Palace areas Themet neighborhood

title: Great and cheap way to get around
review: If you are spending time in bangkok get a rabbit card and miss the long lines to buy single tickets  The bts is a cheap and quick way to get around BKK without the fuss  Trains are air conditioned and very clean and will allow you to get around BKK

title: Good transport , air conditioned
review: Sometimes confusing to use need to understand the stations Also need coins to get tickets and need to know your band Had to queue to change notes into coins and then queue to use coins to get tickets (one step too many) Once you are familiar with the process and the stops then much quicker than a cab with Thai traffic

title: Fast abd easy
review: The easiest way of transport from the airport to Bangkok Don't have to look for anything else Easy to find

title: Always clean and efficient
review: The skytrain network is very well operated with frequent trains all of which are sparkling clean Why get stuck in traffic when you have the train network sailing above it

title: Efficient, fast and reasonable
review: This form of transportation to and from the new Suvarnabhumi airport is a great option one has for both residents and tourists One can transfer from the airport train to the other mass transit offerings operating in Bangkok Fares range from a minimum 15 baht to 56 baht depending on where one is getting off One caveat though if you have more than one bag to carry or push around (if bulky or heavy) it maybe a hassle as the lifts don't operate all the time andor not conveniently located There are exit escalators but usually towards the ends of the stations  Operates from 6 am to midnight Very convenient

title: Cheap and simple to get around
review: The best way to get tofrom the airport as it's so cheap and simple and a lot quicker Aircon and modern trains Not disabled friendly

title: So easy!
review: It is pretty intimidating to start with but once you get the hang of it its your best option especially with Bangkok traffic So reliable comes through every 5 minutes and there is always someone to ask if you are not sure

title: Clean, cheap and reliable
review: Good system can be very busy at peak times obviously Works well and user friendly Clean cool air conditioning always

title: Expensive
review: Would suggest uber instead as same price The sky train in bkk is relatively expensive if you are travelling with friends take the uber instead sometimes it's even cheaper

title: Best to avoid traffic jams
review: This is the most practical way to move around in Bangkok even for business travelers It is cheap and of course the driver knows where he is going (usually not the case with taxis) and you beat the permanent traffic jams Too bad the network is not denser

title: Fun and efficient
review: What more can I say  The price is right and you have an hour and a half in which to use your ticket so you can ride the train around town during that time and sightsee from above ground  much less traffic and crowding

title: Brilliant MTS
review: Awesome MTS  cheap quick clean and so easy to use Brilliant for getting around Bangkok and avoiding expensive tuktuks and taxis

title: Ride from Hua Lom Phong to Sukhumvit
review: Had went to Yaowarat via Grab but thinking if its possible to take MRT from there back to our hotel since feeling abit adventurous Having staying in Phrom Phong we took from Hua Lompong to Sukhumvit at 1030PM it was very crowded and the stations wasn't very well maintained overall this is a scary ride haha

title: Great experience!
review: We booked adjoining first class cabins on train #14  we are a family of 4 (kids ages 10 & 12) and had a great experience After reading some reviews we were a bit concerned it would be more awful than awesome since it‚Äôs an older train and the #10 was sold out but I am so glad we chose to travel by overnight train instead of flying Yes the train is a bit older the bathrooms are kinda gross and you will freeze overnight if you don‚Äôt bring extra clothes  blankets (thank you previous reviews) but the beds are pretty comfy pillows are good and the rocking motion of the train helped all of us get some sleep  Bring a deck of cards or a game and sit in the restaurant cart to play and pass some time while also taking in some amazing sights and before you know it it‚Äôs time to prepare for bed Kids had a great time and what an experience Would do it again no doubt Quick side note  for any vegetarianvegans out there there are no food option for you except Pringles chips

title: Best way to move from and to the airport
review: Best way to go to and from the airport it s  linked with bts line so we couuld reach our hotel also it s cheaper than taxis

title: perfect
review: choose your times correctly use the bts maps so you know were to get offtrains can be jam packed at peak timesclean and always on time

title: Excellent service
review: Excellent service very knowledgeable and pleasant guide in English thank you Dill  Amazing trip to the railway market

title: Comfortable
review: We take train üöÇ from Phayathai station  every 15 minuets take off  very clean seat and much comfortable and lots saved money üí∞

title: BTS
review: Great way to see Bangkok Easy safe and very affordable Make sure you get a window so you can see all that Bangkok has to offer I'd use BTS again

title: very easy to navigate
review: Bangkok traffic can be horrible so it was nice to be able to hop on the skytrain and navigate the city  Signs are in English too so no problems

title: Best way to reach the airport and avoid Bangkok traffic
review: Cheap and traffic free way to reach the airport Starts from Phaya Thai BTS station on the Sukhumvit Line

title: BTS - A cntral and reasonable transportation
review: Very convenient Airconditioned coaches Friendly staff when assistance needed Combined with MRT (Subway) it is an effective way to get around the city center

title: Great
review: Fast reliable cheap easy to understand route and easy when buying tickets just press button number of your stop Gets you to most places in Bangkok and some stations share with the metro

title: What's not to love?
review: Clean efficient low cost fast transportation to many points in the city Generally runs ns vs ew on the BTS Underground so the view isn't s good as BTS but  little cheaper Some great service and transportation   Easy switch over between MRT nd BTW at asoke

title: Fantastic experience
review: We travelled to Railway & Floating market Tour was structured quite well with enough breaks and free time Huge shout out to Sara our tour guide She made the day even better Would happily recommend this to anyone looking at doing similar itinerary

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Very easy to navigate once you figure out where you would like to go It is very inexpensive and oneway tokens can be purchased at token dispensing machines During rush hour you will save time using the train compared to sitting in a cab stuck in traffic

title: Cheap affordable form of transport
review: This was our major means of transport whilst at Sukhumvit (asok line) We would catch the sky train to the nearest station and get a metre taxi from there Rajamadern thai fights was Victory monument and the chatuchak markets was mo chit Saved alot of mpney and they run very regularly

title: Cheap and Quick Way to Reach Your Hotel from Airport
review: I took the Airport Rail Line from my hotel besides BTS Siam to the Airport It was my first time trying this method of travel I usually take the meter taxis to and fro the airport  The transfer station is BTS Phaya Thai From BTS Phaya Thai to the airport it only cost THB45 and 30 minutes of journey time This is in contrast to about THB350 (based on meter fare and highway toll charges) if you take the taxi from the airport to the hotel and more than 60 minutes of journey time with traffic jams  PLEASE DO NOT TAKE TAXIS WHOSE DRIVERS DO NOT TURN ON THEIR METERS AND CHARGE YOU A FLAT RATE OF THB500  The Airport Rail Line is certainly the best mode of transport from airport to your hotel as it is so cheap fast and without jams

title: so easy
review: this is one of the most easiest public transport systems i've experienced  each time i had to buy a ticket the ticket dispenser was easy to use (can change the instructions to english) and directions to platforms easy to followif you are going to MBK or to the river use this  easy peasy

title: Good value
review: We traveled with train 85 without delay even though it was a bumpy ride  The staff are lovely and accommodating but be careful of a middleaged tanskinned guide at Surat Thani Train station  He was so rude after I told him we had our car booked He asked why I didn't tell him even though I was not obliged

title: A breeze
review: If you can handle the NYC city subway system this is a breeze  The map located on the back of their city guide is easy to navigate  Even the automated machine to purchase a ticket is easy  Just locate your destination and the number that correlates  Enter the number and the machine will tell you the exact amount to input  If you don't have change see a teller  You need your ticket to enter and leave the station  Clean fast and an inexpensive way to see Bangkok

title: Very convenient and easy
review: Very easy to use didn't have any problems  Stations were clean and people were courteous and polite  This was our main source of transport and would recommend

title: Ease and inexpensive! Be adventurous!
review: For 45TB to the end of the Rail Link (Phaya Thai) then a transfer to BTS and a 7 stop ride to Phrom Phong (47TB) to land 400 feet from our Hilton Sukumvit Hotel this was so much better than sitting in the heavy traffic and heat in a taxi for 400500 TB for the same trip The train is clean and airconditioned and since you get on the first stop you will most likely be seated for your trip Coming back I recommend catching one of the first 2 maybe 3 stations or you will stand for your ride but it is only 20 minutes from Makkasan (the 3rd stop heading back) so not horrible

title: Quick and convenient way to and from airport
review: Best way to connect to downtown Bangkok avoiding the city's many traffic jam clean quick frequent and cheap

title: Must do while visiting Bangkok.
review: Sara is the best guide She knew in and out of the railway market We had a great time Highly recommend this She gave good perspective on the history of the market Floating market was great as well

title: Highly recommended to all travellers
review: If you want a hassle free and quick access to airport just take the airport rail link It has 8 stopsstations which is i guess located at the most strategic locations For us we were at the last stationPhaya Thai which is advantageous because we‚Äôre the first passengers to enter the train It only costs 45 baht very very cheap compared to taking a cab which will cost you around 500 baht plus the traffic The station has an elevator too so if youre taking bigheavy luggages‚Äîlike meüòÜ not so much of a problem Overall i highly recommend this to all travellers

title: Take this tour!
review: I want to give Sara 10 stars  We learned so much from her and she was very funny   Both markets were interesting in different ways

title: Get on it!
review: A fantastically efficient way to get around the chaos that is Bangkok  Airconditioned clean as a whistle and cheap as chips all BTS staff members are more than happy to help tourists figure out which trainplatform they need to be on  After you spend a bit of time in Bankok you will see just how incredible the BTS system is given that it's relatively new and underground  Don't be intimidated by it it takes a few moments to work out and orientate and will save you a heap of cash

title: Cheap and easy to use. Avoid rush hours.
review: Approach ticketing staff to change notes for coins to use at ticketing machine If travelling with friendpartner get himher to queue at machine to save time

title: Perfect to go downtown
review: Very easy to use and not expensive Advantage you know exactly how long it will take to go downtown Connected to the skytrain

title: Easy to use
review: The BTS Skytrain and MRT was the most convenient way to move around the key metro areas Tickets can be purchased used coins or notes (preferred would be to carry coins) BKK rail app would be used to assist with fare

title: Great way to get around town
review: The BTS (and the other metro systems in Bangkok for that matter) are all fast cheap ways to get around the city The skytrain is especially nice as you can look down on all the traffic that your passing over The trains were very clean and easy to navigate Definitely recommend

title: Ok train, bad services, bad waiting time.
review: It was the most worry free transportation from airport to BKK At least we don't have to encounter bad taxi  Still bad services and long waiting time totally killed the experience I waited for 20 min to see the first train going to airport but I got on the second one after 40 min of waiting

title: Efficient and easy to understand
review: The BTS is easy to understand to help tourists to get around But it does get crowded in the evening during peak hours

title: On time every time
review: BTS skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok cheap clean and on time Avoid sitting around in busy Bangkok trafficsit back relax and get to your destination on a modern safe public transport system

title: A breeze to ride on the airport rail
review: It was a breeze to ride on the airport city rail  We boarded the airport rail from Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan  We alighted here and walked for about 10mins towards Petchaburi MRT via a skyway  We got off at the next station Sukhumvit  The total fare was 60 Baht and total time taken from airport to our hotel was under 1hr  It was a smooth ride without any traffic jam

title: Much better then the BTS Skytrain
review: Halfprice fare for people over age 60 and claim may be accepted at face value at the toll booth  Use the term "ELDER" because you will get blank stares if you claim "senior" status  Seat possibilities are higher since the BTS always is jammed full and I much rather wait on an air conditioned platform for a train then the heat baked platform waiting on BTS  BTS seems to be a local favorite as it grows further and further out of Bangkok

title: Get a Taxi!
review: Get a taxi unless your staying on the quiet and souless areas that are located next to the Airport Link If you want to stay near the Airport Link you are not staying in a good area

title: fast way to commute
review: With well located stops connections to the other public transportation and near the malls and office spaces the BTS is the way to travel through the city convenient fast and affordable In rush hours the carriages can be full but not really overcrowded as there are lots of trains and the reserved Thai themselves tend rather to wait for the next train rather than cramp up in the present one Affordable and fast transportation

title: 19 years of bad customer experience
review: Like all the Bangkok trains Airport Rail Link started in 2010 is worse than the trains everywhere else you have been Although BTS started in 1999 and the MRT in 2005 there is still no way to use the 3 trains with a single transportation card  you MUST buy a separate card for each company Unbelievable Also unbelievable the turnstiles from 1999 and 2005 remain the same so I've had the same experience for my 18 years of Bangkok travels of super long queues to enter or exit as well as card malfunction at random times 18 years of having to wait at a window to get change in coins to use a coin only machine for the BTS Airport Rail Link had an express train in 2010 but it disappeared in 2014 Lots of random stuff but the bottom line is that these are problems other cities solved decades ago Why can't Bangkok

title: a breeze
review: A very efficient cheap system to move about in city Cost is minimal and if need be a daily multi trip is only 145 baht Maybe cheaper to get ticket on need basis Coin essential but staff on hand to assist Signage is very good and easy to follow

title: CHEAP
review: Fast Trains Cheap efficient  Disliked how they were too busy at peak times

title: clean, fast, cheap, cool, efficient mode of transport
review: travelled quite a few times by the skytrain and found it really easy to navigate and get around Be aware that there are 2 trains that are operated by 2 different companies and therefore you have to buy 2 separate tickets Very cheap and very cool as well air conditioned

title: Good Value and Worthwhile
review: Very informative tour and definitely worthwhile  Our guide ‚ÄòT‚Äô provided a lot of good perspective and took care of us  A little bit of way out of Bangkok with about 2 hours to come home

title: excellent public transportation in a city with a chaotic traffic.
review: it is clean and very easy to use You have to have coins to buy the tickets but there are boots to provide the change you need

title: Pretty fast ,cheap and reliable
review: When you are traveling alone and have less time on hand the best way to move around in Bangkok is the Skytrain  I always travel in this as it is well connected on the main Sukhumvit line and there is no traffic problem The stations have escalators and no lifts In the skytrain announcements are made informing about the next station both in English and ThaiMaps ad links to the MRT line is mentioned clearly  It gets very crowdy at peak office hours but you will find a place to move in

title: Cheapest way of getting to town from the airport
review: A taxi will charge you about 600 Baht The airport rail link costs about 150 baht to get to the heart of Bangkok You would have to change trains at junction(s) but it is really easy and convenient even with large suitcases And safe Runs from 6 am to 11 pm

title: an easy way to see the city
review: just jump on the sky train and do a loop on the way you see many places of interest that you may want to get off a great adventure

title: The Best Form of Travel
review: Taxi drivers would almost always try and rip off a foreigner in Bangkok The skytrain is best form of transport around Bangkok and it's fairly easy to use

title: Easy to use.
review: Easy to use and understand cheap tickets and clean  It does get busy when it's raining and at rush hour though

title: Very good way to get around, Both MRT and BTS
review: Goes very often and takes you to the places you want to see It is so much better than to sit in trafic Choose this way to travel

title: Great value for money
review: Got a weeks pass to travel the system on trains tend to get busy during peak times but very to get around the city on

title: Fast, efficient and clean
review: Skytrain is so easy to use From figuring out how to get your ticket and how much it costs to even getting the necessary change It is great that the ticket even have the train map on it

title: Simple Way To Navigate BKK
review: Am not sure why this needs reviewing I always try to stay in the vicinity of a BTS Station it makes life so much easier in the city Think of investing in a Rabbit card if you are in the city for a few days as it's so convenient to use as opposed to standing in long queues for single tickets

title: Very helpful
review: If you wnat to travel fast and convenient in cnetral Bangkok (although a bit cold due to a full speed AC) take the BTS

title: Great way to connect
review: Probably the best easiest and cheapest airport connection I've experienced in the world so faaaaaar

title: Best Way to get around BKK
review: Very easy to use and stations have customer service booths to assis with questions  This is my primary transport when in BKK

title: One of the best rapid transport systems in Bangkok
review: Travelling around Bangkok by car makes me suffer  Travelling by MRT let you reach out to nice places not covered by the BTS and keep away from traffic jams

title: Excellent transportation in Bangkok
review: Outstanding fast and inexpensive Very good in combination with Skytrain (BTS) Check the map and choose the nearest station buy oneday ticket and go Every station has helpful people Unfortunately you have to buy different tickets for MRT and BTS

title: Easy and air conditioned transportation
review: The BTS skytrain is the best way to move through Bangkok  The trains are even air conditioned  If I can figure out how to use itso can you

title: Quite efficient & time saving.
review: Travelling by BTS in Bangkok city center or anywhere on BTS routes is considered the best choice esp during rush hours & if you travel alone or less than 3 persons  It's quite efficient & time saving  The fares are quite reasonable too  If you want to travel often & don't want to provide exact change for the fares every time you board the BTS it's recommended you buy a BTS cash card which you can use it whenver you travel without having to bother for the change  The fares will be deducted from the card each time you travel & you can refill the amount whenever you want  You can also take the BTS to connect with MRT or Airport Link to some other places not located exactly on BTS routes

title: What would we do without Skytrain
review: Fast yet not inexpensive way to get around and avoid the heroic traffic jams Lots of steep stair walking necessary trains are very cold inside Top notch entry technology Get a day pass (140 Baht) this is much more convenient than paying with coins

title: The trip was amazing!!!
review: Sara is AMAZING She really took care of us When I came back to Thailand I will for sure do another trip with Sara Thank you so much ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Quick and convenient for the major sites.
review: It's the underground overground but the commuters are nicer The stations are well located for sites such as the Jim Thompson House the Siam Centre Lumphini Park etc

title: Fast clean and on time!
review: Coming from melbourne where the trains are continually late and station and toilets not up to standard we thought Bangkoks train system was great Easy to use ticket dispenser once you get the hang of it not a long wait wherever we went clean and air conditioned

title: Go to the End of the Line & Marvel & BKK's Skyline
review: 1985my 1st visit to BKK  Imagine no Skytrain & no subway  You got around by BUSES  Private bus companies that did NOT cooperate wea other and which ran MEANDERiNG routes not straight lines  It was congested crowded sweaty sticky like rice that you did not want to eat  BKK is so modern now  And they're building more of the Skytrain  I went to Yanhee hospital from the farthest Northern subway station  Saw the Skytrain that's being built there

title: Good way to get around
review: The metro system is clean efficient and cheap If you can take it Taxis are generally either slow or trying to top off tourists Tuk tuks are fun too but can only accommodate 3 people comfortably

title: Clean and convenient way of moving around
review: After walking for couple of days the decision to use BTS Skytrain was a smart move The stations are mostly located in or around the places I am visiting Why I didn't thought of using it initially such a convenient way to get around

title: Easy and Efficient
review: Simple to navigate and cheap makes for very easy transit across Bangkok Many stations near popular tourist areas And it's airconditioned  great relief on hot humid days and nights

title: Enjoyed the ride.
review: Went on the railway for half an hour as part of an organised trip including ewanan waterfall and hellfire pass Saw and went over the wooden bridge and really enjoyed the train ride Definitely worth doing

title: Thailand
review: Outstanding train service trains were clean fast smooth riding on time and safe  We used the BTS almost daily and were very pleased  The terminals had lots of stairs needs more escalators and elevators for people who have a difficult time walking  Good current and up to date ticketing and turn styles

title: Affordable, clean and saves time.
review: We got the day pass twice which was cost effective and allowed us to us bts unlimited time till 12pm so if you wake up early you can enjoy 23 attractions by planning GOOD

title: Very easy with train to move in Bangkok
review: Its very easy and cheap to move in Bangkok For me is most important  to move in Bangkok it¬¥s safe and quick

title: Takes a bit of time to figure out but worth it.
review: I took a cab from the airport and I had problems with knowing where to pick this up in Bangkok but the trip from the airport is a breeze Figure this out and take it all the time The exception being is when you have a huge pile of useless luggage that you can not get up the escalators to the train  Next time reduce your luggage (via Rick Steves books) and take the train

title: Really good and cheap
review: Used this in the morning at about 615 Really easy to access and a short walk from the platform to the airport terminal

title: Best way to get into city
review: If you know where you‚Äôre staying and the closest train station then take this train from airport to the city It‚Äôs cheap and fast I highly recommend this Unfortunately it‚Äôs very crowded in the train but worth it

title: Great Way to get Around Bangkok.
review: Price is reasonable If you are 65 show your ID and you will get an elder card which gives you 50% discount

title: Awesome tour!
review: Sara was knowledgeable and shared with us alot during the tour Driver was safe and overall the trip to both markets were great as an experience Highly recommended to book this tour

title: The escalator of the BTS Skytrain
review: People should choose transportation from airport to hotel carefully  Some BTS Skytrain stations do not provided escalator to customers who carry luggage  People may carry the luggage going up or down stairs by foot

title: Best transportation option within Bangkok
review: Cheap and reliable Best option to move around in Bangkok with avoiding the traffic jams

title: Best transfer to Airport
review: This is the best way to go and come from airport Its cheap and easy to use No traffic trouble It takes arround 45 min to go from phaya thai So you can be sure you get your plane

title: Access
review: Easy cheap and quick the staff are helpful and getting tickets from machines is easy enough just make sure you have change if not you can get at station

title: First time user.
review: After taking the taxi every time in bangkok i have discovered the skytrain and the metro  And last year i have decided to also use the brand new airport link as it is also now properly connected with the BTS No need to carry your luggage outside to transfer A good addition to the services provided by the city to the tourists I love it Well maintained and on time Totally recommended if your destination in bangkok is near a metro or skytrain station  If not will still recommend the cheap taxi unless you want pull your heavy luggage in the heat

title: Fast and convenient
review: Our main transport choice in bustling Bangkok Easy on easy off  all around Bangkok clean efficient and convenient

title: The best way to town
review: This is a fantastic rail link that was just opened There are two trains with the express going straight to a Skytrain hookup The other train stops at every station for locals and only goes as far as Makasson Station From there follow the crowd to the subway

title: Easy to use
review: This is easy to use but you need cash It accepts thai baht However the stations are not well connected to the other lines So some walking is needed If you have big bulky luggage it will be annoying During peak traffic hours the train gets packed so becomes difficult to manouver out with even small luggage

title: Very quick & easy way to get around
review: Whilst it is cheap and quick it is crowded beyond belief Still probably a better option than driving

title: Is it just me or what? IT IS TOO F&%$#G SHORT !
review: The Skytrain should be a great way to travel around the city BUT it is an awful journey as you are packed in like sardines whatever time of day Hello Skytrain wake up and double the length of it On the plus side cheap and has aircon

title: Easy to figure out and has AC
review: It's good a affordable option if get the day pass or longer For backpackers you can cater your event starts around the BTS lines too and enjoy ac as travel from place to place Fast and frequent too Also clean Not Japanese level clean but still clean and comfortable

title: Convenient and clean mode of travel
review: Convenient mode of travel around Bangkok This is the main train line around Bangkok The subway line is called MRT Both take different routes BTS took you to more of  tourist locations Both are good and convenient mode of travel

title: Very cheap and easy to use
review: The BTS Skytrain is very handy to get around Bangkok head to the station see where you want to go the buttons have numbers on and that is the cost of your journey the routes are easy to understand and there are plenty of staff to help you the trains sometimes get packed but it is a capital city they tell you to watch your bags but we had no problems it's a great system

title: Fantastic
review: So affordable and convenient I just wish it ran 247 but it doesn‚Äôt Very clean and quick I believe it starts at 6am and ends around midnight If you arrive at airport between 1 & 5 am you‚Äôll have to take a taxi

title: A very convenient method to travel
review: We found this to be a clean cheap and convenient way to get from the airport to our hotel We ended up using this several times throughout our stay to get to and from various parts of the city

title: Very convenient
review: I always used to take a taxi to go to Sukhumvit from the airport which is ok But if you don't have too much luggage my advice is to take the (relatively) new airport rail link which connects you with the BTS in center BKK Nice air con a view of the city very easy access cheap and fast enough to get you where you want

title: clean and fast
review: the traffic jam around 5pm to 6pm skytrain it s perfect to go fast

title: cheap, fast but can be tiring
review: if you are getting on from somewhere in the middle then it can get a bit challenging to get on board usually the trains are packed during rush hour better to avoid at that time overall still fast reliable and most preferred option to travel

title: The best transportation within Bangkok City
review: Well during heavy traffic by car can take up to 45 minutes travel distance from one BTS station to another station If take BTS probably takes only 5 minutes Recommend to purchase the Rabbit card which you can top up few hundred baht and just tap and go Save time queuing

title: Puts NYC to shame
review: Uberclean modern fast Trains every few minutes The longest wait we had was six minutes The line is short but they are expanding it Expect to pay about 20 baht a trip You get your ticket from vending machines which are easy to use They do take notes (no credit cards) but only give change in coins Would be better if the MRT system was linked up to the BTS Sky Train ‚ÄúRabbit Card‚Äù but apparently that‚Äôs also in the works A great subway system Don‚Äôt be afraid to use it

title: Easy to Use
review: I used this service quite a bit Yes the line is quite limited however it is cheap clean and easy to use It can get crowded during peak hours however that is the same the world over It is really very easy to use however ask your hotel for one of the tourist maps and it will make a lot more sense There are plenty of YouTube videos if you want a more detailed explanation of how to use

title: A/C is nice, but a little crowded
review: The trains are often packed and it is sometimes a little tricky getting on and off at first Because of traffic this is still the best way to get across town

title: convenient and clean
review: most of my traveling needs was done through the use of BTS it would be more convenient to get a card for yourself Each station is strategically located just around places of interest might need a bit of walking The train is actually quite wellmaintained it is a nice way to observe how the locals are I have had quite a few experiences with rail trains but the ones in bangkok was quite a pleasant experience If you have experienced being a sardine in a can the ones in Bangkok would eliminate that experience kudos to that

title: Works Well
review: Very efficient and easy way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok Should you be needing to connect to the BTS or MRT then you will have the option of doing this It is very well priced at THB 45 for the maximum distance The journey time is going to take you around 3045 minutes to go all the way to Phaya Thai Service runs between 6am  12am and should I need it during these hours I would always choose this over a taxi

title: Airport Rail link
review: The airport rail link is a very fast way to travel from the airport to the center and vice versa If you travel by taxi for example it may take you very very long as you probably end up in trafic jams

title: Easy for tourist

review: When landing in Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport always remember that in the bottom level of the airport is the Airport Rail Link This is a very inexpensive choice to get into central Bangkok and even connects with the BTS SkyTrain If you do not want to pay the cost of a Taxi or are worried about getting stuck in traffic the Airport Rail Link is  your best choice

title: Easy to use and very clean

title: Clean but crowded at peak times...
review: If you can avoid peak times (office hours) do it because it can be quite messy and long to board a train but otherwise clean and relatively fast service (less MRT than BTS trains)  MRT cards expire after 2 years (contrary to BTS cards  and so far no combined cards as they are all independent transportation services Airport link has also another card Hope they will create a Bangkok transport card someday that works everywhere) Despite that it is worth it to have a card because even if there is no price incentive it enables people to avoid the queues

title: Good service

title: Great way to commute to the city
review: The commute to the city was fast with the airport link there was no need to take taxi and be stuck in the traffic jam Will continue to commute via the airport rail the next time I am here

title: Quick and Easy

title: BTS in Bangkok is convenient and clean
review: Compared to public trains in other countries the BTS is clean well air conditioned and cheap  Best way to get around Bangkok if your destination is close to a station

title: Very efficient mode of transportation
review: We were able to connect to different trains with relative ease It‚Äôs best to get a 24 pass that gives you access without having to pay at each individual train The train got us to our destination very quickly I would recommend this mode of transportation

title: Convenient
review: I recently traveled to Bangkok in end of May 2016 My hotel was located nearby to BTS Phloen Chit Since i was travelling solo and on a tight budget I chose the BTS as a mode of travel  On a very frank note i found the BTS to be very convenient I traveled to the Siam Paragon mall Madame Tussauds Siam Discovery Mall  simple thing is that you get down at Siam Station Also the most convenient if you're planning to visit the Chahtuchat Weekend Market simple get in the BTS and travel to the last BTS station the market is just about 5 mins from the station Another thing which i liked and found easy was that all BTS stations have these 'Bike Taxi's' waiting below and they are very good mode of last mile connectivity  (Note Please note that do not travel by the Bike Taxi if you are scared of travelling on bikes they can be fast sometimes)   For tourists best time to travel is during the nonpeak hours midafternoon or late evening around 6 pm evening  it can be slightly crowded   They have money exchange counters also set up at major BTS stations which offer good exchange rates

title: Very packed on Monday morning
review: I have taken the train 2 times on Monday morning recently Need to walk to far right side of the departure hall (back to custom) then take lift or escalator to B1 My Thai colleagues recommend me to do this instead of catching a taxi The traffic jam of Bangkok on highways and tollways and within the city is really unbearable  For me I have a small cabin luggage the train has bit of space near the door for luggage But if you have large luggage and need to use this during morning peak hours you may need to be patient to wait till you're in front of the queue The train was full with many standing when leaving the first stop the Airport station Then it was jam packed from the 2nd stop onwards

title: Helpful
review: Bts taking you out of bangkok traffic clean and fast Love it  Just to much busy in the morning and evenings after work

title: I love this place!!
review: This place is old the trains are older and I LOVE every bit of it  It's part of the experience of Bangkok  The sleeper train to Chiang Mai is well worth it   However my last visit to Bangkok (122018) the sleeper car was sold out so i opted for the adventurous standard seating  NEVER AGAIN   The trip was still fun and adventurous but after 12 hours of just sitting in a seat and not being able to LAY DOWN it gets old quick   Then you are burned out when you get to your destination   I highly recommend this station and the trains for the experience  But for a long haul trip PLEASE get a sleeper car

title: Fast, convenient and cheap
review: I encountered this during my first trip to Thailand This one is located at the basement of the Airport My friend and I took this one to get to my hotel The trip was fast hassle free and the train itself was well maintained It saved us a lot of time to get to our destination and we evaded those overpriced taxis at the airport  The Airport Rail Link offers a good view of the surroundings and since it was night time when we used it we were treated to a nice view of the city lights It was a nice prelude to my trip

title: Fast, convenient, reliable and Aircon!!
review: BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok Add a little walking  uber  tuk tuk and you can get anywhere in the city and a very affordable rate   Would recommend using a Rabbit card for faster transitions   And there's Air con

title: A  definite plus for every visitor to this lovely city
review: There are 3 different types of airport train to the city Express train to makasan depart every 40 min which is the most expensive and the least of my favourite as getting a cab from the station is difficult The 2nd express train to phaya Thai is a nonstop route  If you need to go that part of the city a definite plus I think they depart every 30 min The last and also my favourite is their city line the most economical and connect to their MTR in some stops They departs every 15 min and the whole route  is about 30min 45 min depending on time of day This train is not only for tourists their local also take this as one of their option They run from 6am to 12 midnight I think the same as their BTS Bangkok's traffic is a nightmare no matter what time of day If you are coming from the international airport definitely take their airport train then BTS or MRT then perhaps a little taxi ride to your final destination Highly recommended

title: Key transport around Bangkok
review: I use the BTS sytem very regularly to travel around Bangkok It's really the best way to travel Clean cheap with very good service You can use it to travel to either main airport For Don Mueang though you travel to Mo Chit and get a taxi the rest of the way No eating or drinking is allowed on the BTS service but that's to the benefit of having clean transport In busy times carry more than one suitcase will be difficult but not impossible

title: Best way to travel in bangkok
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok Clean and easy to navigate with great views of the city although it only takes you to some places

title: Efficient
review: So neat and efficient and the best way to bypass heavy traffic  and congested roads of Bangkok although it's so packed in rush hours of afternoon_evening  as it's  the same by car or taxi but again the better choice  is sky train  Please note that in some stations like Siam you should  change your banknote to coin in official stalls which  are located in the station because of old ticket machine but it's not the same in all stations You can find out the fee through the fare table next to ticket machine  The fare is written in a circle in your destination station

title: Cheap and reliable way to beat the crazy traffic
