title: East to use and cheap transport
review: Cheap way of getting around and quicker than a taxi when the roads are busy

title: Easy to use, quick
review: The sky train is quite world lass It is easy to use with good maps and signage You load up your card and you swipe in when you start and swipe out when you leave the terminal and it only charges you for the segments that you travel It allows you to easily stay at hotels that are less expensive but a bit further away but your travel time will be significantly less Hooks up with the river taxis at its terminus which makes it even more convenient

title: Very cool transportation system
review: It is effective fast convenient with easy access to tourist attraction and shopping centres The price is reasonable Instructions at station is wellpresented

title: Quick and easy route from Airport to town!
review: We always used to get a taxi from airport to town but sometimes you really risk "life and limb" with the ways these guys drive So we decided to take the airport link which is a regular train service from the airport to points North and West of Bangkok Central For those traveling to the Sukhumvit area catch the train to Makkasan and then walk over the bridge (around 100m) to Phetchaburi MTR Then it's only one station to SukhumvitAsok Fare from Airport to Makkasan is Bht 35 per person One stop on the MTR is Bht 26

title: Getting above the traffic
review: The BTS or Skytrain is a cheap efficient way of navigating around Bangkok without the fumes and traffic jams We were there for a week and used a pass we purchased in 2011 which we topped up with credit at the start of the holiday It is easy with the pass as you just scan it on ent entering then again at your destination A readout comes up with the balance very efficient The carriages are clean and air conditioned Maps on the newer trains show exactly where you are and the next stopeast to understand We used it to travel to  many different places without any fuss

title: Vacation

title: Highly recommended

title: Best way to get around the city!

title: Skip the taxis and Go Rail
review: Arrived at the BKK International Airport at about noon on Wednesday as a solo traveler I decided to start my SE Asia adventure by skipping the taxis and instead use public transportation  Took the Airport Rail Link to the Phaya Thai station where I transferred to the BTS SkyTrain to the Siam station then a second BTS SkyTrain to the Sala Daeng station which was only 500 meters to my hotel  I was pleasantly surprised on how easy it was  The ticket and information agents and even the security people were very helpful in guiding me to the proper platforms & stations needed and ticket purchases  The trains were clean not crowded quick and very affordable  Being elevated you get a great view of the city  It was a good decision to avoid the taxis and go training  But I do need to try a Tuk Tuk sometime during my stay

title: Fantastic, convenient and inexpensive way to get around the city!!!

title: Cleanest Trains I have ever been on.
review: I regularly use the BTS Skytrain when I am in Bangkok This used to be a cheap means of travel but as the price has risen over the years & the trains get more crowded it becomes less appealing at certain times of the day One of the biggest drawbacks is the amount of stairs to climb 3 X 16 stairs to get to the ticket level & the same again to get to the platforms & the same number when exiting There is usually a lift for the disabled & one escalator per track ‚Äì Not handy if you‚Äôve been shopping & laden with bags

title: " so easy to navigate "
review: This BTS skytrain is a very simple and very cost effective mode of transport to see various parts of Bangkok and it's " so easy to navigate" A number of coin ticket vending machines on each station stop and a few do have note machines but no panic each stop has a kiosk that is manned by staff too sell you a valid ticket And don't worry about language problems many staff speak reasonable English as for other languages those nationals that I have seen asking for destination and what platform  etc etc etc also don't appear too have much problems getting to where they want too go  Two main lines and if you want too get anywhere and you need too change lines SIAM STATION is change over platform Newer trains have electronic station guides on the inside of carriages  older carriages have the fixed signage But all have an tannoy system where a voice tells you which station is next so you can't miss where you're getting off at The skytrain system is spotlessly clean as no food drink or smoking is allowed on the platform areas or trains And the queuing too getting on off is very civilised due too markers to stand at for boarding that allows passengers already on the trains easy access to alight the carriages then you get on Put very simply the Bangkok skytrain system is a credit too the city of Bangkok  Tourists daily commuters alike everyone uses this too get around most areas of Bangkok without any fuss I say most areas because not all parts of the city are covered by the system Work appears to be still in progress  But all major tourist areas shopping malls the huge chatuchak market are easily accessible using this skytrain system Didn't see much options for disabled access Not too say it's not there but in my time of many years visiting this metropolis of a city and using this system to get around it I have never actually seen wheelchair users using it to get from AB

title: good alternative

title: Efficient jam free travel to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: This is a bargain 45 Baht all the air conditioned way into Bangkok and transfer to BTS at Phaya Thai This has transformed the journey from Bangkoks' new airport I see that another Airport Rail Link is being built to Don Mueang International Airport as well The Thais do not shy from creating excellent infrastructure (unlike Vancouver BC)

title: Almost an authentic third world experience!
review: Since I usually stay within walking distance of the main train station in Bangkok (which is also by a BTS station) taking the train into town and back to the airport makes the most sense Its just that you might have to wait awhile for a train and when it comes there's no AC as the windows are open and you might NOT want to sit near the toilets in case the door to them swings or stays open so that you can smell them I also took the train back to the airport making sure that I left early enough because it beats an expensive cab or even a bus that would also get stuck in Bangkok's traffic mess   Again and whether taking the train or the bus into town and back to the airport makes sense will depend upon where you are staying and whether you mind being in a potentially crowded train that could get hot when its not moving or waiting for another train to pass I also felt perfectly safe as there were a mix of Thais and even other foreign travelers around

review: Amazing value for money  We got a stop in as a bonus The tour guide Sara spoke amazing English and was amazing in her knowledge She made us feel right at home picking us up exactly at 8am from the hotel including a stop along the way   We got to experience the train ride as well as the market experience of the train literally passing us while we drank coconut water   The floating market was beautiful with us literally bargaining for wooden carved bowls   All in all we got back to the hotel around 330 and our experience all day was incredible Huge thanks to our amazing tour guide for her energy even when we were sleepy

title: The Skytrain Rating is Insane!!!
review: I do understand that Trip Advisor needs to use some kind of automated logarithm to rank attractions but for the Bangkok Skytrain to be ranked as the #2 attraction in Town is absolutely insane  The #1 attraction is currently a Muay Thai boxing attraction which means the Skytrain as an attraction ranks above every Buddhist Wat including the temples of the Emerald Buddha and the Golden Buddha ranks above every museum including the National Museum and even ranks above the Royal Palace    The Skytrain is very good value for the money  It is fast and nice It is not at all interesting  It's really not very good as a sight or for sights I rank it 4 for value 2 for interesting and 2 for sights and I rather generously give it a 3 overall  But really if I did a fair applestoapples comparison with the Paris Metro the London Underground or the New York City subway system they all put the Skytrain to shame because folks all four are TRANSPORTATION networks and only the first three are good ones  I can tell you the Metro tube or subway station to go to if you want to get to the Louvre British Museum or Met  I can't tell you the Skytrain Station that gets you to the National Museum in Bangkok because there is no such station  Skytrain won't take you to the Palace Wat Arun Wat Pho or any of a number of actual top 20 attractions  TA could solve a lot of issues if it added a totally separate category that was neither an attraction a hotel or a restaurant  They could call it Services and one type of service is of course transportation    Now a few public transportation systems are in fact bona fide attractions  (But not many no one's every going to tell you "Going to Washington To heck with the White House and the Smithsonian  If you only have time to see one thing make sure it's a ride on the Metro")  And oddly enough most of these aren't necessarily the fastest way to get where you're going  The iconic cable cars of San Francisco come immediately to mind but while they're great fun and the symbol of the city they're appropriately ranked 23rd among attractions even the Cable Car Museum is ranked higher  Closer to home there is one public transportation system in Bangkok that really is an attraction in its own right and no it isn't the Airport Rail Link ranked #13 by TA  It's the Chao Phraya Express Boat ranked #39  Try this experiment take a notepad and hop on the Skytrain then the Airport Link then the Chao Phraya express boat On each one make a quick count of the total passengers and a second count of how many of them are taking photos  What percentages do you get  For the first two the answer will almost always be zero percent nada zilch  For the boats outside of commuter rush hours quite often it's 50% or more Some people take the boat just for the pure pleasure of taking it  I've never known anyone to take the Skytrain unless they were going somewhere  Don't get me wrong I love the Skytrain if I am going from point A to point B and both points are within a halfmile of a Skytrain station I'll happily take Skytrain  I have been known to take a taxi to or from a Skytrain station and use Skytrain to reduce my total cost and travel time  I wish it went more places but I expect that over the years the Skytrain system will spread further and further including hopefully to Don Meuang  After all Rome wasn't built in a day  Oh speaking of Rome you might be interested to know that as of right now TA ranks the TOP FOUR attractions in Rome as RomeInLimo Rome Cabs Private Tours Tiber Limo and Transfers Rome Day Tours  Similar services also are now the #6 #7 #10 and #12 attractions  The Pantheon has dropped to #22 and the Colosseum is #23 So if Rome's in your travel plans I recommend you follow TA's advice don't waste your time on stuff like the Trevi Fountain and the Sistine Chapel just spend your entire holiday being transported around

title: Viator unprofessional and unreliable
review: We booked a tour through this company yesterday ( Saturday) We paid and received a confirmation and  e voucher The tour included pick up from our hotel which was to have been at 710 am The tour information suggested that we be ready 30 60 minutes before then We were ready at 6 am and waited at the hotel front  door and gave our details to the concierge for the pick up Nothing happened and we began to become concerned From about 720 am we tried to telephone Viator but could only get a recorded message several times Eventually at about 740 am a woman answered and said that the tour had already left and blamed us for not telephoning them to receive pick up details (even though they already had our hotel) She said there was some small print which said that if they didn't contact us "the evening before" we should phone them to receive exact pickup details She the said that there was no one in their office after 12 noon Saturday and that was why our details did not get through to the tour guide She then changed that it was 7 pm and that the  12 noon time referred to a different section of their office Either way there was no definition of "evening" being the deadline for us to telephone them She refused to do anything for us such as arranging a private tour or emergency transport even though it was still only about 30 minutes after the departure time when we phoned She gave us emergency numbers which were all international numbers not in Thailand  This is the greatest debacle we have ever encountered in traveling We paid our money received confirmation and gave them all the details they required including our phone number and email We got up at a ridiculously early hour only to be left sitting around without any contact  Our advice is DONT USE VIATOR as they are completely UNPROFESSIONAL and UNRELIABLE

title: Best transportation system in Bangkok

title: Great way to get into Bangkok, beat the traffic

review: Very good service to and from the airport However we stayed near macasan station and it was cheaper for 4 of use to catch a taxi to the airport instead of the rail link The taxi also picked us up from the hotel so we had no need to walk to the station which was a 15 min walk in heat

title: Efficient
review: Frequent train service clean air conditioned People are also polite bar the occasional tourist and wait for people to alight before entering

title: clean and comfortable
review: very convenient for travelling around Bangkok if a little busy ALL the time but clean comfortable and reasonably priced Oh and when you buy tiskets try using the touch screen machines as they have an English option

title: Express train currently not working
review: The train is quick and simple to use but currently the express train is not working meaning the service is slower than advertised  Having said that it can be convenient (depending upon where you are travelling in BKK)

title: A fantastic day out and if you get Sara your in for a laugh...
review: The trip was fantastic from start to finish our guide Sara was a ball of fun with funny pronounced names and local Thai talesThe train market was an eye opener but fun and the floating markets getting back to normal after the pandemic  1010

title: Save time for your joyful Bangkok trip
review: Heavily traffic jam of Bangkok can kill your valuable time to enjoy the city and shoping With BTS Skytrain your shopping and dining more easier This can connected you to the main shopping center of Bangkok too

title: Best way to get to the city
review: I'm always lazy and wanna take the cab but considering the traffic this is the easiest way to get into the city

title: Airport train link
review: A really fantastic way to travel very convenient providing of course it is passing through the area you wish to go to

title: Great service, if you are Asian
review: The BTS has been a godsend for commuters in Bangkok A little pricey but fast travel over congested city streets A draw back for older foreign residents is the lack of a seniors ticket for nonAsians If one is a resident but not Asian one cannot get a seniors card If one is Asian and notThai one can easily get a seniors card I am a legal resident of 29 years and I have been denied a seniors card for discounted offpeak travel yet a neighbor Chinese illegal has been allowed a seniors card Shame on BTS management The MRT allows discounts for seniors of any race

title: Very easy to navigate
review: Love the sky train It makes travelling around Bangkok easy and fun The prices range from 25 baht upwards and it's easier to ask one of the people behind the counter how much you need to pay before using the pay machines

title: Good near hotel
review: Nearly hotel very and can go to another place bts very faster recommend when you stay in Bangkok and thailand

title: Much better than taxi
review: Bangkok BTS is the easiest way to travel around Fairly prices and super fast because it can take forever to cover just a small distance in taxi or other transport on road Very well connected skyways to all big malls and buildings

title: the best way to get around in bangkok
review: Beat the traffic and take the MRT My advice would be to bring some coins up to 45 baht per person to buy your tickets as the lines to get coins for the ticket machines can be quite long

title: Easy and cool!
review: really easy to travel until midnight ) and train is so cool when u choice your hotel have to consider bts station

title: quick and with blazing airco
review: quickest mode of transport in bangkok Clean safe and nicely air coned cheap too Will safe you from standing in traffic or haggling on prices

title: The Best Way to get Around!
review: No two ways about it the BTS Skytrain (rot fai faa) is the cheapest cleanest and safest way to get around BKK If you are in the city for a while consider getting a Rabbit card if you know you are going to be off and on all day get a neung wan (one day) pass which will let you ride unlimited 1 Day is 140 BHT There is no eatingdrinkingsmoking on the BTS stations are patrolled by security officers who will let you know with a sharp whistle if you are transgressing There are several lines in BKK and sometimes you have to go one way before you can go the other but you get to know the cross over stations quickly You can also transfer only a train straight to the main airport so if you want to save the Taxi fare (about 400500 bht) to and from BKK

title: super easy!
review: Super easy to understand all announcements in English and Thai Much easier than sitting in traffic to get to the airport Quick and easy

title: Very helpful for tourist
review: For tourist we're feel so grateful with BTS Skytrain because we can go everywhere without afraid of lost The direction was good

title: Very easy to use
review: We found the BTS Sky Train very easy to use while we were in Bangkok It was easy to navigate and very affordable They run very frequently Being Australian we grabbed an English map and away we went If your not sure always ask at your hotel The staff at our Hotel were very helpful

title: Easy to use
review: We used BTS on our first morning in Bangkok and found it clean and so simple to usePurchessed a day ticket so you can use all day so if you do get off at wrong station no problem just hope on next train and away you gowould highly recommend as an easy way to get around

title: Great trip :)
review: We had a very interesting and pleasant trip to railway and floating markets We would have never imagine such original places until we saw it  Special thanks to our guide  Sara  she gave us all useful information regarding to the markets told historical facts tips and her kindness made our day

title: good value for money forget the taxi service
review: Don't bother with a taxi traffic is far too heavy and you could sit in it for hours they are expensive at the airport  The Skytrain is in the airport terminal and easy to get in to Bangkok

title: Great except for one thing...
review: The BTS Skytrain was clean easy to use and came regularly  The only reason it didn't receive 5 stars is because the stop at Chatuchak had huge lines at the ticket counter because the ticket machines only excepted coins  You had to wait in line for change then wait in line for the ticket machine

title: Average trip
review: Water market is not vegetable market They just sale turistic items Not nice They drive you up and down and show only shops

title: expensive, slow
review: Like all Bangkok public transit If you have a group it's often faster and cheaper to take a taxi or Uber or Grab

title: Service!!
review: I always wonder how Bangkok can have such an efficient transportation and Toronto can't  This service was on time fast clean and Beyond expectation in the heart of Bangkok

title: Keep visiting in a safe, clean, cheap, kids friendly and air-conditioned place
review: Good sightseeing tour for tourists which allows to avoid traffic Kids get usually a place without asking

title: Reliable, quick, easy and clean
review: We would normally walk whilst we're on holiday but it was so warm that we used the air conditioned BTS Skytrain to access the different areas that we wanted to visit in Bangkok  A great way to avoid the traffic and visit certain areas within Bangkok but do avoid the commuting crowds  D lef

title: Easy and convenient
review: We found it very easy to use the Airport Rail Link  When we had questions personnel were quite helpful

title: Enjoyable at a price to pay
review: We enjoyed the ride between Thamkarsae station to River Kwai But as we travelled on the Death Railway everyone was exciting trying to capture the best shot of the wooden rail section But behind this enjoyment is the lost of life The suffering tortured illtreatment of those who built the Railway The former generation built younger enjoyed Let us not forget the purpose this railway was built those who built it

title: You get there but take the time
review: The Airport Link (stop train) works ok but because the City Express (non stop) is out of service the train is full all the time and not handy if one has baggage One has to change over at Phaya Thai station to get on to the Sukhumvit and later Silom line at Siam if one is heading that way Take the time using this service not recommendable with the Express Service in the sick booth

title: Going around Bangkok with Skytrain
review: Taking the Skytrain is the best way to travel around BangkokI take the Skytrain and the subway whenever I have to go to the Plant Market in Chatuchak on Wednesdays No need to walk so far under the heat of the sun The BTS is maintained well and it is very clean

title: Very efficient
review: BTS is a very efficient train system in Bangkok Trains run frequently and are very clean reasonable prices to travel

title: Save money to get to city centre
review: Used the Skytrain to get to and from the airport It costs like ¬£1 to get to Phaya Thai which takes 30mins then it's only 90 baht to Khao San Road from there in a taxi

title: Easy, cheap and worth a try
review: For 45 Baht or about $2 AUD you travel at speed into the heart of Bangkok Connecting to BTS at Phya Thai you can easily get to hotels or at least to a more convenient taxi or tuk tuk to get you the rest of the way Highly recommended if not travelling with much luggage and certainly a good option from the main airport as it avoids traffic snarls which can mean a long taxi trip stuck in very slow moving traffic

title: It's beautiful and a nice day trip.
review: I had fun but we were certainly on a time limit so we had to take the next train back  If you go splurge for a 2nd class car as the benches in 3rd will make your bum hurt after about an hour (halfway)  I really liked it and you get off wherever you'd like along the way  I suggest stopping at the resort about 34 of the way to the National Park  It's just before the old bridge  I have no idea how these men carved this railway (I do of course but it's insane)

title: Rude staff
review: The staff at the ticketing counter are rude when we made enquiries and tried to renew our old train cards  With a party of three cheaper to take tutuk as the train is very crowded  The train network is still very limited given the size of the city

title: You have to see it to believe it ‚Ä¶
review: Excellent trip you have to do it it‚Äôs beyond explanation a live Market on  a train  track  Everything is removed in seconds and put back as train passes inches from everyone ‚Ä¶

title: Every day transportation
review: Low prices and very easy to use as a foreigner Used the sky train everyday for over 2 weeks Makes getting around Bangkok very easy while avoiding untrustworthy taxi drivers

title: easy commute from airport to city
review: a very easy way to commute from airport to city and only cost THB 45 Not only it's fast with air condition but also avoid the busy traffic on the road

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Very nice rail service for avoiding traffic Full AC train with cleanness and nice sitting arrangement Good experience in trail

title: Avoid the traffic
review: A great way to get to the lowcost airline airport  The station is located across the road from the main terminal but connected by an overhead pedestrian bridge

title: Cheap and worry-free but can be improved
review: Very convenient and quick way to get to the heart of Bangkok from the airport Goodbye to getting stuck in traffic jams or quarrels with taxi drivers that want to scam you  Problem is 1) The frequency of train services can be quite low especially if you are not dropping off at Phaya Thai 2) The train is ridiculously packed during peak hour barely any space to breathe 3) Somehow the stations have very few escalators and accessible elevators shouldn't they be expecting people with large suitcases taking this line

title: Great transport network
review: This coupled with the BTS are great alternatives to Bangkok traffic I prefer travelling by MRT and BTS wherever possible Very easy to use and you can get to most places on it

title: The only way to travel
review: If you enjoy the hustle and bustle of being part of the crowd and the time to enjoy this is the way to go in BKK  Lunch and rush hours can be packed especially around Siam and Asok but in general it's the best way to goand cheap Aircon is usually fierce and the ads on the tele are often worth the trip

title: Efficient BTS
review: It is so easy and hassle free and you need not worry about toll charges and the exorbitant taxi fare that is around 400Bahts some r 450Bahts The lack o communication make you worry about your ride even before you can enjoy the trip  Don't miss your hassle free ride into the city O no traffic jam

title: Good service from security team
review: I always travel by Airport  train everyday  I sometime need help from your team so I have to say thank you to security team (Ladkrabang Station) sorry I could not remember their name  Since I need help to top up ticket   Thank you so much

title: fast and efficient!
review: easy and fast Easy to find from airport and by far the cheapest option Easy to find accomodation close to one of the links

title: Top Class
review: Easy Cheap and Negative Traffic   I'd 100% use this again so so easy to get your head around and quick quick quick

title: Not a tourist attraction
review: BTS is one of the Bangkok public transport systems It is also called "skytrain" as it travels above ground Travel is inexpensive and fast On weekdays  trains are  jam packed Travelling with suitcases and baby strollers is not a great idea but a nuisance for fellow travellers = commuters I wish people would take their backpacks down when using the trains Most Thais are not as tall as caucasians and a backpack on the back of a tall  person hits the shorter guy in the head or in the face

title: The easiest transit system ever!!
review: It is also a great way to get a feel of Bangkok and surrounding areas Fun vantage points Mob scene on Fridays around 6 where we just so happened to be Beats taxis where you will sit in traffic for hours

title: Great way to get around
review: The Skytrain is an awesome way to explore Bangkok  Don't even think about renting  Once you have experienced being stuck in traffic in a taxi you will realize that during rush hours this is the only way

title: Easy way and inexpensive way to get around Bangkok
review: I use the Skytrain every time I am in Bangkok It is hassle free easy to use and goes to most places or close to

title: What an experience!!
review: The railway & floating markets were an amazing experience Just ‚Äòwow‚Äô The day was a little longer than half day but we didn‚Äôt mind Highly recommend this tour when in Thailand

title: The best way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport if you're travelling light
review: I live in Bangkok and whenever I'm going to Suvarnabhumi Airport with one checked bag or less I take the airport rail link you can connect to it from the MRT (subway) at Petchaburi station on the Blue Line It's a bit of a walk up a slight incline on an elevated walkway to the Makkasan airport rail link station You can also connect from Phaya Thai BTS (elevated train) station on the Sukhumvit line It's inexpensive and eliminates the uncertainty of surface street travel time which can vary widely The only minor annoyance is that they are all separate systems  airport rail link MRT & BTS  so you need separate tickets tokens or passes All three systems are airconditioned

title: Caught several trains from Asok Station.
review: Caught several trains from Asok Station I found the ticketing easy and the train was in good condition Signs and ticket machines  for English speakers were good  Prices are cheap

title: Great first time ride
review: The signage and guidance was excellent for an English speaking rider The price for 1 way 3 going 8 stops was comparable to a taxi ride for 3

title: Fastest and Cheapest way to go to Bangkok Main from the Airport
review: I'm sure you will love this this train service like we did This train will bring you to main locations in Bangkok and links to BTS train stations Most of the travelers from Airport use this train to get to Bangkok main if you did book for hotel pick up Airport Link is located at the first floor of the airport there are signs also you can always ask any airport staff where is the entrance There is a vending machine where you can get your chiptickets You just have to press the station where you want to go the number of travelers and insert THB money (you have to have THB currency or coins ready  many money changers are available at the airport) It will also give you back your change You should do your own research which station is nearest to your destination so you will not miss your stop It is fast cheap and convenient Going back to the airport using Airport Link is as easy as coming from the airport If you can handle your luggages to the train and off the station and if you want to save a few bucks for transport then this is definitely recommended for you

title: Crowded and not easy if you ha s heavy bags.
review: Strangely some of the stops you have to walk up and down if you get off with your bags this could be about 51 steps going down so there are no elevator or escalator's to help you at some of these locations If you are older or cannot carry your heavy bags you may want to take a taxi which will be much easier and about the same speed because for some reason the train takes a lot of time

title: A handy cheaper alternative but poorly signed
review: The airport rail link can be accessed from the city of Bangkok however you have to change trains at least once or twice and the signage is extremely cool there isn't any sign indicating way to go not even an aircraft icon  When you purchase your original ticket to travel from various parts of Bangkok nobody bothers to tell you you have to purchase an additional charge and when she did the transfer to the airport rail link  It's okay for a satellite traveling but if you have three or more people it will be cheaper and far more convenient to get a taxi

title: Efficient Mode of Transportation
review: It was easy to navigate although I wish that the machine to buy ticket also has English translation It would be super convenient if that is the case that would cut the long line at the ticket booth by a lot

title: Your Gateway to Bangkok
review: When you are travelling light This is the best route to take when you want to experience bangkok up close and personal Its economical convenient and safe way to navigate the city The best thing that ever happen in Suvarnabhumi airport Kudos to Thai Government

title: Cool, Clean, Effecient
review: its just a shame that all the transport networks don't link in together and you require a different cardpass for each of the 3 main forms of public transport nothing is integrated properly currently

title: best way to get around the city
review: nice clean easy and inexpensive Can't ask for a better way to get around the city of Bangkok  High recommended it

title: Easy
review: Really easy to use and much quicker than a taxiPlenty of room for luggage  Can get busy but if you get on at the airport you will get a seat

title: Booked Chiang Mai to Bangkok, sleeper 2nd class less than 2 days befor the time of travel.
review: I think in peak season it would be wise to book a few days at least in advance Booking as late as I did there were trains that were booked out and I didn't get the exact departure time that I wanted but hey don't be dissuaded that you can't get a ticket close to your traveling date Going directly to the station I avoided an agents fee and the process was easy The staff were helpful and spoke reasonable English You do need your passport or a copy of it to book from Chiang Mai station though

title: Fast way to go...
review: If you want to avoid traffic and not loose your time in this crowded city use it  Avoid peek hours

title: Great Train Ride - Very Moving Experience.
review: I took the train and then a bus to the museum at Hellfire Pass built by Australia to honor all those who lost their lives in trying to complete the rail line  The train across the 'Bridge on the River Kwai' and then the wooden trestle was amazing and goes through some very beautiful countryside  I then walked from Nam Tok to the bus stop and took the bus to the museum  a beautiful building in a lovely spot honoring those many people who lost their lives here  It was a very moving experience

title: Easy to find and use
review: Easy to find and use and very cheap Only problem we found was getting off to find connecting bus servicewe ended up having to get a taxi as we could not find it Comfortable enough with air con Very busy but that's what you would expect as it was a weekend when we arrived

title: Convenient
review: Avoid the traffic & use this Convenient mode of transport around Bangkok Ticket machines are simple to use Most signage is translated in English Affordable Clean and Efficient

title: Best transport system in Bangkok
review: Easy to use affortable convinient Even when it is crowded often it is the best way to get around Combined with the Airport Link it is the quickest and cheapest way from the international Airport to most places and hotels in Bangkok There is a day ticket that is 130 Baht(currently) that makes a lot of sense to get around between shopping malls and many hotels Many hotels that are further away from BTS stations offer a shutte service from and to the stations

title: Clean and fast
review: Very clean air conditioned and fast Train officer's were helpful with directions and spoke English

title: BTS
review: Our guide showed us how to use the BTS A quick cool and efficient transport system Nice to see everyone queuing in an orderly fashion

title: An excellent city network
review: When I watched the skytrain being built (over 20 years ago) I wondered how it would work  But it is great and has greatly improved Bangkok's congestion  With connections to the main airport and to the 'mainline' trains it is a major plus for Bangkok

title: birds eye view
review: really strange to review a subway but this thing is awesome  you get a birds eye view of bangkok especially near the sala daeng bts when it passes the park its all green and gold temples and skyskrappers  Easy to use cheap fast and air conditioned

title: Big loop
review: From Chatuchak weekend market to the old Hualamphong  railway station close to Chinatown the metro forms a big loop connecting 3 times with the skytrain track The journey can be quite crowded nobody feels obliged to give a seat for any reason the air conditioning is too cold for summer clothing Buy a token for single journey the Rabbit card doesn't work here

title: Excellent connectivity
review: This was a very very convenient way to go around the city sight seeing  the Aircon coaches were a welcome break from the heat outside It was cheap to travel as well

title: Easy to use, but difficult to get an explanation the first time you get there.
review: Cheap and clean to European standards Unfortunately few of the people in the ticket offices spreak any English and impossible to buy an combination ticket with the metro You will attract much more tourists by speaking at least one more language

title: Overcrowded fish can
review: Even so the Skytrain is not a comfortable transportation it is by far the best available in Bangkok that tells you something how far behind Thailand is when it comes to mass transportation Do not attempt to board the train before 10am you might not make it to the platform and need to wait for a long time in the heat surrounded by angry frustrated people In short my critics are 1) overcrowded (or under supplied with trains) 2) the ticket gates close very fast and very hard if you are not quick enough the will hit you hard 3) no toilets or wash rooms on the station 4) annoying advertisements on the platform and on the trains 5) often hard breaking & acceleration of the train if you do not have grip you will meet new people The good points there are no alternatives in Bangkok

title: GET AWAY FROM TRAFFIC
review: Its good if you dont want to be stuck in traffic its cheaper than taximeter and motorbike taxi of course Most of people think the map is confusing but if you pay more attention it will be more easy to go most of the touristic places

title: Train and Water Market tour review
review: One of the main reasons for booking this tour was to spend time exploring the railway market However we spent 15 min in the market yup that‚Äôs right I flew across the world for 15 minutes Ok that‚Äôs a little over the top but you get point We did however spend 45 minutes at roadside gas station  truck stop food court so maybe the tour should have been labeled truck stop and brief tour of train market   Part of the reason for truck stop was the guide who was very nice and knowledgeable has us ride the train into the market which was cool and an appreciated that experience however logistically this should have planned better We could have arrived at the market first give us the hour to explore and maybe take the train out of the market for a stop to two The truck stop and ‚Äúlunch break‚Äù at the floating market accounted for the majority of the trip The floating market was about 40 min or so   Now let‚Äôs talk about the floating market this one  is totally commercialized for tourism Instead of walking between vendors on the street with exactly the fare for sale now you go in a boat and see the same stuff  All that being said It is nice to be out on the water  Who is this tour for well since I like cultural experiences this is defiantly not for me If your looking for off the beaten track nope If your looking for new products hand made crafts etc ‚Ä¶ Nope If a day trip with family is on the agenda sure If your looking just to ‚Äúcheck it out‚Äù on a surface level then yup good trip for you If your a photographer looking for market shots or a traveler who wants to get a good flavor of the area forget about it hire a driver and come yourself   If you happen to have any significant mobility issues I would also steer you away from this tour Getting on and off the train will be an issue Also the train market is narrow around the tracks but it does extend further inwards from the tracks Just so y‚Äôa know there are a ton on tourists there and they tend congregate along the train track   For many this will be a nice escape day from Bangkok and an ok but not an overly memorable experience I honestly know it take a lot to plan out a day tour but I really cannot recommend this one

title: Best way to head to Central Bangkok fast
review: When I arrived in Bangkok I decided to take the City Link Airport Rail Link to the City Center getting off at Makkasan station in less then 25 minutes the price is very reasonable less then 65 Bahts or $182 US  Service is timely and efficient the trains are clean and secure

title: More accessible than tube
review: I found BTS sky train pretty convenient in this chaoticly crowded city Although it may not run as fast as metro it's easier to access as you don't have to walk down those escalators and long distances under the ground  The view alone you get from the BTS is worth the ride

title: A comfortable ride
review: It was the first time I took the MRT from JJ Market to Sukumvit where the shopping mall Terminal 21 is located The ride was comfortable with good airconditioning  It's also less crowded than the BTS

title: Use it if you come from BKK airport!
review: Seldom I've seen such an efficient means of transportation to go from an airport to a major city in a country This recently built ARL is perfect to get to your destination quickly in Bangkok

title: Clean and efficient
review: Had no problems with timeliness Well priced Shame about some areas not being well served by it but in general such a good system

title: trip to air port
review: if you didnt bring so many travel bags then it is better to use airport rail link to go to the airport it is save your time and money because on office hour bangkok's traffics are very busy if use taxi you will be trapped in a traffic jam for hours and miss the plane so count your estimate time longer when use a taxi to the airport

title: public transport
review: very easy safe and cost effective method of transport The skytrain can take you to almost every where you wish to travel in order to get to places as quick as possible

title: Travel easy in BKK with AC
review: Get around easy in BKK comfortable with AC easy to pay for ticket by coins at machines before you head down to the tracks Make sure you keep the ticket coin or ticket  to get out when you reach your destination

title: The best transport in day time Bangkok
review: The skytrain is the only real efficient way of getting from A to B in the bustling daytime of the Bangkok rush hours i would easily recommend using the Skytrain before choosing taxi or Tuk Tuk from 08 in the morning until 20 in the night With plenty of stations and the easy touch free Rabbit payasyougo ticketing system you can reach every where in central Bangkok Did I mention that it is also cheaper than both Tuk Tuk and taxi It is also nice and airconditioned so you also get a little pause from the heat of the sun Feeling adventurous Take the skytrain to some where you haven't been before and take a look ) ) Enjoy

title: Easy, cheap
review: Convenient and cuts time trekking the humid streets Not too busy but sometimes a little crowded at rush hour

title: Mostly convenient
review: It's inexpensive quick and efficient way to travel from the airport and connect with the BTS and MRT  Especially with BKK's traffic you won't be stuck in it by taking the Airport Rail Link

title: Market and floating market
review: Sara and bank  are wonderful guides Very friendly and wonderful explained the itinerary well and then made sure myself and other group members didn't get lost (which is a miracle for me) If in Bangkok again ill definitely be asking for them on my next tour

title: Good
review: Everything in Thailand was good for me We were so happy when we were on skytrain can see everything good view kind people fast speed Good for me

title: Quick and modern
review: A very fast and modern way of getting to places Unfortunately it does not go to some of the historic sites  Prices are rather cheap and typically in the 2545 BHT range

title: Very efficient system
review: Great way to get around Bangkok With a taxi you can be stuck in traffic for an hour but with the BTS you just glide over it  Yes it can be packed like sardines but for me it beats sitting in traffic  I have places to go and things to see

title: Cheap and easy
review: Cheap and easy to get around MBK has its own stop so get shopping and maybe just buy a ticket to ride from start to finish and check out the sights on the way round

title: Leave extra time
review: It's great fast and convenient to get to the airport using the Rail Link and way cheaper than a taxi but doesn't always come as often as claimed make sure to leave extra time so you don't miss your flight

title: Awesome Train network
review: Nice air conditioned train network  connects most of the places in Bangkok  convenient way to travel around

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Excellent way to avoid the horrible traffic jams Good aircon in the heat Connects most major tourist and shopping areas Get a refillable card for convenience if you're staying for a while Many stations have escalators or lifts for disabled

title: Most Sensible Travel Option
review: The quickest most comfortable and convenient way to get around Bangkok Warning  always carry a jacket because the inside feels as cold as the Swiss Alps  Connects the city very conveniently and cheaply  with the Airport Very efficiently run

title: Sky train
review: Travel during the day time is awesome It can get quite full during peak hours (79am & 5pm) if you‚Äôre going to be moving around a fair bit I suggest you buy a day pass As it will work out to be cheaper than paying per use Traffic in the city area is so bad that it‚Äôs not worth taking a cab We‚Äôd travel via MRT to the malls then return by cab with our purchases long after the peak times

title: Traffic
review: Bangkok Los Angeles Tokyo Shanghai  all suffer from the same problem  too much traffic and an infrastructure that can't support it Bangkok has the BTS sky train which links with their relatively new underground system It can't get you everywhere you want to go but covers around 80% of the City It is super clean air conditioned highly efficient and extremely cheap to ride If staying a few day get a multi day pass The rides work out as little as a $1 $2 Taxis are also very cheap in the city  the difference is that you will sit in traffic for ages whilst the BTS gets you there quickly and comfortably

title: Fast and easy to use!
review: Great way to get to your hotel from airport plus it is inexpensive  go to lower level of airport there is the boarding platform  Buy one token depending on where you are going insert into turnstile and you are all set  You do have to wait to get on train When train arrives the police do a check of the train before you can board Only takes a few minutes Very easy to use if you need help just ask many people will be able to direct you

title: Great To The BTS, Then What?
review: Taxis into central Bangkok are about 250 baht ($9 USD) The train is much cheaper to the BTS Then the hassle starts Steps and uneven pavement surfaces are a night mare We always see tourists struggling with their luggage trying to guess which direction is to their hotel Many intersections you can't cross Up 40 steps across walkway bridge down 40 steps  My advise spring for the little $5 USD extra and take a taxi to your hotel front door You don't need the grief after a long flight

title: Faster with Airport Rail Link takes more security measures
review: 8 station from airport to downtown last station is Phayathai station after that you can continue travelling with skytrain call BTS to get in other side of Bangkok  easy and faster  But a lots of people on rush hour in the morning and evening

title: Airport Link
review: This is an easy and cheap way to travel tofrom the airport Easy to buy a ticket even for a foreign traveler

title: Good Mode of Transportation
review: The airport rail link stops at places outside of Bangkok execpt for the final stop which connects to the BTS inside the city The trains take quite a while to arrive with an average interval of 10 minutes between each train It usually is very busy during rush hour between 47pm The tickets are easy to buy and are sold at a cheap price Overall a good way to get from the airport to inside Bangkok

title: RIPPED OFF at the floating market.
review: Forget this trip when we arrived we were asked to pay 2500bt each for a trip in a wooden boat to buy yet more junk we no doubt would take home and ditch at the first opportunity  The vendor was so surprised we refused to pay she quickly lowered the price to 3000bt for two still no deal she lowered it to 2000bt for two Still no deal what a rip off  Turned out to be a nice 4 hour drive in the country

title: The BTS can you afford to ignore it?
review: Cheap and an excellent and quick way to get around the overcrowded streets of Bangkok The BTS is easy to use and understand and covers all the main areas of Bangkok using it will save you a fortune and also help you mix with the locals Reminds me of an inverted London Underground if you understand my meaning  Cheap efficient and clean you can‚Äôt ask for more Give it a go you won‚Äôt regret it

title: Beware of pickpockets!

title: Cheap, easy and fast

title: Fast and cheap
review: Great way to get around Bangkok and it is cheap try and avoid the peak times as it can be horrendous also a good connection to the airport

title: Clean, fast and air-conditioned!
review: The traffic in Bangkok gets pretty bad The BTS together with the MRT (underground subway) will pretty much take you to where you need to go I recommend it over anything else

title: Local tour
review: The Tour was really nice and especially the floating Market was a must see The tour guide sara was very friendly and welcoming she explained us a lot and helped us with every question

title: Great choice to get around
review: Take the time to figure this out As a tourist in the city for a short time it can be tempting to just use taxis or maybe tuktuks to get around but the train is often more convenient faster and less stress The system is modern well air conditioned and efficient

review: Great bargain for transportation but it's very crowded at rush hour   Mornings are best  Pick up a BTS map for free anywhere   it's very straightforward and easy to use

title: Unforgettable !
review: We had the best day on this trip both markets were an incredibly experience and our guide made us feel safe and educated We had the perfect amount of time at each market and were even at the railway market at the perfect time to see the train pass Totally recommend this trip if you want to still have time at the end of your day Was an unforgettable experience

title: Cheap and fast
review: Great cheap and fast way to get to the city of Bangkok Can easily change to MRT at Makkasan Station

title: Great day out but not much time for shopping!
review: This trip was a great experience    Firstly we went by bus to catch the train to the railway market  When the train came it was so full that we had to stand on the doorways in the middle of two carriages which were outside of the train  It made the journey quite exhilarating and sometimes a little scary but great fun  When you arrive at the market it‚Äôs quite a sight as the train pulls in with very little space either side  People are  waving at you from each side ‚Ä¶ crammed with their backs against the wall to let the train through Unfortunately when we got off the train we only had 15 minutes so it was impossible to look around the large market  Although I‚Äôm not a massive shopper I would have liked more time to look around and maybe give back a little to the local traders  Secondly the bus took us to the floating market which was also rammed and very chaotic  We had about 30 minutes here to eat and look around  Again not enough time  We then got on a long tail boat and floated around for about 40 minutes but did not stop at any of the stalls or platform  Again I would have liked to support some of the traders  The guide was repetitive and spoke very poor English but she was funny friendly and very pleasant  All in all‚Ä¶ we had a great day and I would recommend the experience to anyone who isn‚Äôt specifically looking to do much shopping in the markets

title: Quick and efficient
review: Runs on time quick and easy way round Bangkok You need coins at some of the stations for tickets although there are ticket booths

title: Good form of transport
review: The nearest line to us was the terminal on the   line To get into the city we changed at Siam then went to Saphan Taskin then caught the tourist ferry down the river However be careful not to go on the little long tourist boats as there are a rip off We brought a day ticket so we could get on and off as we pleased The skytrain is a good way to get round and you get to see a bit of the city

title: Fast and very convenient!
review: Easiest transport to use in Bangkok You just need to go to the MRT Station get one free transport map at the airport pick your destination go to the ticket machine choose English and put the money (cashcoin) in That's it Then take the ticket to the gate  You can go everywhere by using MRT and BTS in BKK

title: Easy and fast
review: Very easy and  good way to get arround in Bangkok Buy a card and save even more I travelled alone one day all over the place and found the locals very kind and helpful

title: Don‚Äôt be scared of the BTS
review: Buy a Day pass for $140 baht and explore It‚Äôs air conditioned I would recommended getting a tour guide we did our first trip Second time around we made our way around

title: Very clean and easy to use
review: The best way to get around if it is daytime  You need to have the exact change or the Attendent can change out money for you  If you are going very far or making multiple trips you can buy a day pass for not much more  We found that taxis at night were easier and cheap  You can take the sky train down to the free ferry which is nice

title: Economical way to go around Bangkok
review: Economical Fast and Reliable we found the MRT to be one of the best and cheapest ways of travelling in Bangkok We learnt it the hard way when we were stuck on the roads in traffic jam and realized we are close to an MRT station So we just hopped in and got to our destination in no time (at a ridiculously cheap fare compared to a Taxi) You must consider this when traveling distant place in Bangkok and even while traveling to the Don Meong Airport (get half way there to the Chatuchak Park MRT station from where you can get a cheap AC Shuttle Bus  A2 I think  costing just 30 THB per personto get to the Airport really fast  see my post on getting to Don Meung Airport for more details) or for going to Suvarnabhoomi International Airport (get to the Phetchaburi MRT Station from where there is a direct and reasonably priced Airport Express Train)  For going to Chatuchak Weekend market  get off at Khamphaen Phet MRT Station which is in the heart of the Market itself

review: Actually we were quite worried before our Bangkok trip How to go to Bangkok hotel from airport How to get out from airport Taxi Bus Rental car Rail  Finally we have chosen Airport rail link Never thought only THB45 can enjoy in the 5stars railway system Took about 3040minutes to reach the last station Phaya Thai And our hotel just 510min walking distance from the station  Very happy with the Bangkok transportation system which connecting airport and city

title: Efficient

title: Easy to use
review: Clean clear announcements of upcoming stations smooth ride The booths only give change but they will tell you how much to put into the ticket machine if you ask (ie if you cannot work it out from the easy to understand chart) Put your coin in the slot then retrieve it to open the gate Good directions to help you pick the train going the right way for you An excellent service but not enough of it (The roads in Bangkok are awful congested and chaotic (avoid tuk tuks they seem to only want to take you to places they get commissions))

title: Unique local experience

title: Great service

title: Avoid rush hour

title: Excellent and cheap public transport
review: ARL is the best option for those whose staying downtown Bangkok We reached BKK at 845am and after custom and immigration by 930am we're already on our way to Phaya Thai (7th and last stop on ARL) And another half an hour off to take BTS to our hotel (Asia Hotel)  The ARL is two floors below arrival hall at the airport Ticket machines are at the gate of ARL Decent queues should be expected during peak hours (We bought online through Klook) Should cost you 45 baht per single trip

title: Cheap efficient option
review: We always like to get down town from the airport independently and cheaply No need for a taxi hop on Airport Rail link at airport and walk over to MRT via foot bridge at the end get a map of the underground and voil√° easy Locals always ready to help at ticket machines or there are booths Research it before you arrive so you know where to change and get off  Have some Baht  cost us 70 tb each to last stop Hua Lampong  Note the MRT stops here and for anything further west in the city  you will need tuk tuk

title: Perfect!

title: Super convenient & cheap

title: It does what its supposed to
review: Convenient clean airconditioned and fast waybof getting around the crowded bustling Bangkok One wishes it lead to more corners of this bustling place

title: Imhappygirl1978
review: Skytrain or BTS is very convenience for travel in the Bangkok City but please avoid rush hour  in the morning and in the evening as hotel staff told me especially in weekday because sometimes you can not put yourself go to inside of that train  haha

title: Affordable and fast

title: Easy
review: Easy way to travel around very reliable and cheap travel trains are very clean and routes easy to follow

title: Cheap and efficient
review: I use this very often when I need to go into the city leaving my car at the airport  It is very reasonably prices hassle free and even at busy times it functions well  Cool views on the way in too

title: Giod City Transport.
review: Provided you don't travel during rush hours comfortable great service Well done Bangkok you got it right

title: Easy way to travel

title: Very convenient, nice views, cheap

title: The way to travel

title: Super Cool - Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: BTS sky train along with Tuk Tuk is the best way to travel in Bangkok In spite of having good roads Bangkok has a very high traffic and it takes about 1 hour to travel 10 km or so Sky trains run very frequently like once every 5 minutes and they are air conditioned  Will provide you respite from the heat In sky train you can cover 2025 km in 45 minutes or so Make sure that you download the Sky train map and then you can cover Bangkok city without much problems

title: Fabulous scenery
review: The trip along this railway gives you some stunning scenery many photo opportunities Make sure to get a window seat so you can have a nice breeze to cool you down in the heat I would definitely ride on this track again wonderful experience

title: Amazingly  convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: It's Clean and comfortable network The service is regular with plenty of trains available Try to avoid rush hours travel between 10 am and 4 pm when ever possible 8 pm till11 pm is fine as evening traffic is heavy There is also an very good under ground service ( MRT) in Bangkok  A couple of stations have access to both services So yo can get to your exact destination if you plan carefully Get a city map and check where the stations are located Buy a travel card if you intend to stay more than 3 days as there is a queue fo tickets sometimes

title: fast link to airport
review: If you know the train timings in advance this is a very good option for airport from busy sukhumvit area Actually the train station  is Makkasan which you can go from Phetchburi BTS station about 300500m distance The BTS and MRT are well connected  hence making the airport rail link easiliy accessible Once you get in the train it will take you to airport (Suvarnabhumi) in 20 mins and in most convinient way Only be very sure of the train timings as gap between trains may be about 1 hour and it can be a serious problem if you need to catch a flight

title: Most comfortable mode of transportation
review: If in Bangkok bts is the most recommend mode of transportation Try to choose hotel close to the line  Though not full connected to most area but still can take you to many places visited by the tourist  In two or three the coverage will be much better

title: Convenient and reliable
review: What do tourists want when  they visit Bangkok They want to go places and do things They certainly don't want to waste time sitting in traffic snarls never getting anywhere What does one expect in a huge and densely populated metropolis like Bangkok other than often crowded transport But the BTS though often (but not always) crowded is far preferable to trying to navigate through overcrowded roads It's a nobrainer 'nough said

title: Best and fastest way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the cheapest and fastest way to get around Bangkok  and it's so easy to use  Taxis get stuck in traffic and took tucks charge way too much (but are great fun to use) The Skytrain gives you access to all of Bangkok and if you use it with Google maps you can easily get to wherever you need want to be

title: Modern Skytrain system

title: Great experience

title: Fastest way into the city
review: It is really a fast and economical option However it makes sense to start from the terminus ( at either end) as it gets very crowded in intermediate stations

title: Extremely Convenient

title: Incredible!

title: Quick and easy

title: WORTH & CONVINIENT RIDE

title: Best way to get around the city
review: The BTS is by far the cheapest and fastest way to get around the central part of Bangkok Bangkok traffic is notorious so although taxis are very reasonably priced you can be stuck in traffic for a long time even to go a short distance Choose the BTS whenever you can when your destination is close to one of the 2 BTS lines BTS also interchanges with MRT Underground at various points opening up the other cheap and fast option for getting around the city

review: Our guide Sarah was very friendly and sweet She told us a lot about the different villages we drove by on the way to the markets She gave us some free time to explore the markets on our own and was very patient with everyone The railway market was really unique to witness After the floating market we got ourself some lunch and Sarah made sure everyone was comfortable Really enjoyed this day

title: Fantastic way to travel

title: Avoid Friday traffic jams to airport
