title: Nice way to avoid the Bangkok traffic
review: This is a cheap safe and easy way to get around if you are familiar with how public transportation generally works Signage is in both Thai and English The trains are clean Everyone lines up and waits for passengers to get off before politely getting on the train It was all very pleasant and orderly I took this from my hotel down to the river and then took a river taxi to the Grand Palace Did this in reverse at the end of the day Definitely a good option for transportation

title: Convenient for Central Bangkok
review: The airport link runs between Phayathai in Central Bangkok and the airport It is frequent reliable and only 30 minutes to town From Phayathai a transfer to the Skytrain will get you to Siam Square Silom and the Sukhumvit area The fare is 45 baht (less than 1 pound) each way and must be bought before boarding   from machines which accept both notes and coins The downside is that some Skytrain stations don't seem to have escalators or lifts so you might have to carry your own suitcase up and down several flights of stairs Also not very convenient if you are not staying close to the Skytrain or underground Metro lines

title: Very convenient
review: Its the easiest way to go to the city during the rush hours and the cheapest way to go About 1545baht per trip depandind how far you go

title: Organized and modern
review: This is the most user friendly train I have ever seen  Purchase your tickets by machine reading the stop guide  Automated  Just have to know where you are  where your going and have proper change  On the platform there is a study high impact plastic wall separating riders from the tracks with automatic fats that open when the train stops  I have never seen this anywhere  On either side of the gate are marked lanes on the floor  Riders pick a lane and wait in single file  Directly across from the gate is the marked departure lane  No one stood here The train stopped the departing passengers got off easily and then the boarding passengers got on  Organized respected guidelines  I was very impressed  Many countries including my own need to check this out and learn something üòé

title: Very convenient
review: Very easy to find in airport also very cheap and very convenient Don't be afraid to use Find the nearest station to you hotel on the maps and go ahead

title: brilliant service
review: this puts most trains to shame very clean easy to access a day card costs around ¬£2 very easy to use as there are maps all over as to where the stops are so easy to plan your route all names are announced as you near the next station in Thai and in very clear English trains do get very busy at peak times be prepared to give up seats for elderly and infirm and of course any Monks as they get priority

title: Very interesting tour
review: Fantastic trip very interesting markets to explore  excellent guide (Lucky) only down side is this is more a day trip due to distance which is fine but I think it needs to be clearer

title: Quick
review: Easy train to use 40 baht to mbk Air con as well We got off at central pier from orange boat was easy to find

title: Love the BTS for getting around
review: It's a great way to get around Bangkok without being stuck in the jam Get the stored value ticket if you're going to be there for a longer period of time Also I'm amazed at how the Thais give up their seats to my kids Only 1 is really little the others are about 810 and can definitely stand in the train But the Thais still give up their seats to them Amazing I salute you

title: Nervous at first
review: When I knew I was going to Bangkok solo I was nervous how to get around But the BTS proved to be a blessing for a cheap easy very safe way to get around Take it

title: Works very smooth
review: Airport Rail Link works absolutely smooth and without any problems Just follow the signs at the airport get your ticket at a machine (people will assist you) and step into the train It is as easy as that

title: Easy and cheap Transportation and Spotlessly Clean
review: Used this every day while in Bangkok So easy to get around and so clean and reasonably priced Saves time sitting in traffic also

title: Very useful
review: Trains run till late and goes to most places of interest Easy and convenient to travel by but do avoid the rush hours

title: Welcomed relief from Bangkok Traffic !!
review: Bangkok traffic is famous for its long grid locks   Use the Sky train  There are 2 lines that interchange at the Siam Paragon Mall Station Do under 5 mins of research with a map of bangkok and the trains I know its a bother  but this will save you hours of frustration and getting lost  You do the above and you are sorted on most destinations in bangkok and fast  Its cheap clean and on time  Tickets can be bought at dispensers at every station or the ticket office   Do use it save yourself time in the heat

title: Economical and quick way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a recommended way to get around in Bangkok especially during the rush ours (which seems to last the whole day from early morning to late afternoon) Although the Skytrain may be crowded as well in periods it will take you close to many of the most visited attractions and shopping malls in this huge city faster than any tuktuk and at a very reasonable price

title: best way to reach the airport from the city
review: the journey was comfortable and the fare was reasonable you pay 40 thai bahts for a 30 min journey which is good as compared to the taxis ideal if you are traveling solo

title: Don't catch the MTR
review: Caught MTR a few times with my son his wife and 18 month old son what a nightmare always so crowded once we tried to catch for few stops six trains went by and were so crowded couldn't get on in the end we walked

title: great to go from a to b or you will stop ate the station c..haha
review: Easy to travel with the train in Bangkoki would like take all my friends to see how easy it is to go and how cani love to come back soon

title: Great Way to get around the city
review: This is an amazing way to get around Bangkok easily Its relatively inexpensive and you can purchase a day pass which is cheaper and way faster than using a cab given Bangkok heavy traffic I'm all about convenience but this makes much more sense than a cab unless your dressed up then get a cab and arrive in style

title: Unique and amazing experience
review: Great experience and well organised A must do visit whilst in the Bangkok area Note  the half day tour goes for about six hours

title: from hotel to main airport
review: This new airport rail link connect the Phaya thai station with the subarnabhumi airport of Bnagkok price is 45 bhats from 600 am

title: BTS Skytrain best option to move around daytime
review: Please be adviced that during daytime learn the map and stations and buy day ticket for Skytrain It might be grouded but you don't want to sit in a taxi or tuktuk inside heat and traffic pollution and waste pressious time on your citybreake During night time tuktuk is most convenient and has most value for money to my mind

title: Great transport
review: The skytrain was a very effective and convenient way to get around fast and frequent Value form money was great also  With stations at all the key areas of the city

title: Fast and cheap
review: I usually come to Bangkok with the family but this time I arrived alone and planned on meeting them a few days later So instead of the usual car ride I took the train Its very easy lots of English signs directing you to the train easy to but the ticket and no chance of getting the wrong train ( well almost no chance) even after 14 hours of flying The train is comfy air conditioned there were lots of seats and I had my bag at my feet I got off at Phayathai station with no trouble and went to buy a ticket on the BTS skytrain A bity tired at  this point I bought a ticket followed the crowd and went to get on the train that looked suspiciously like the the train to the airport I quickly jumped off and went back down to the exit explained the error and got a refund with direction to go down another level and get the BTS line Went to Siam caught connecting to National and a quick walk to the hotel On a GOOD day at the right time it would be about the same time to taxi in to my hotel At busy times I think the trains would be quicker and 90 BHT Vs 500( incl highway toll road charges) So the trains are great for singles or couples but with a tired family I would use taxi or town car depending on the amount of luggage and kids

title: BTS
review: The sky train doesn't go all around the city but gets you to other transportation that helps Inexpensive fairly easy to navigate once you realize it's one main line with multiple stops and return service I recommend the all days pass if you plan on making several stops through out the day otherwise save money and pay to just go directly there and back

title: Fast, cheap and very easy to use
review: We found this train trip from the airport to Phaya Thai to be very cheap and easy to use The express line from the airport to Phaya Thai is out for about a year but you can travel on the city line and it only takes 30mins to Phaya Thai For 45baht its a bargain

title: Fast and economic way to travel
review: A hassle free way to travel economically Get to the city within 30 minutes Won't get stuck in traffic No need to haggle with taxi drivers

title: BTS station in Bkk
review: Its so convenient and easy to get around First u go up the counter and tell them where u want to go then they give u changes and u use the coin and put in machine and press where u want to go then thats it The train is very clean and fast very useful especially bkk the traffic is so terrible But u need to walk abit after u reach yr destination Clean and safe and not like new york substation

title: expensive, congested, not luggage friendly
review: expensive in bangkok standard the platform can support more train unit but BTS only offers four even in peak hours It's a nightmare to tourist with luggage as there is no downward escalator No matter what you have no choice in Bangkok as you can hardly get a taxi in bangkok nowadays

title: Shining Example
review: What can I say I have used the train system in Sydney many times but the MRT leaves it for dead Very clean always on time (every 7 8 minutes) very modern Very cheap

title: BTS Skytrain: clean, effici√´nt and on time!
review: With more and more traffic jams in Bangkok  not only at rush hours the BTS is a good alternative Easy accessible and at every station English speaking counter staff to assist with the purchase of tickets Using BTS is often faster than by taxi and very reasonably priced BTS also has good working air conditioning and goes to all major places in town including the MBK shopping Centre at National Stadium

title: Quick and easy during busy street traffic times.
review: Took me 35min on a Friday morning from Asoke station with a short transfer on the metro then on to the airport No complaints Would certainly do this over the far more expensive taxi if you are staying centrally on the BTS or metro lines

title: Enjoyable experience
review: A very entertaining tour with a lot to enjoy Floating Market and rail market were both very cool Sara did a good job entertaining informing and shepherding is along through the various activities

title: great way to see the city of Bangkok
review: I like all  is very fast and have good air con also very easy to buy tickets and understant the routes

title: Great day out!
review: I had Sara as my tour guide She was fabulous both maeklong and floating markets seem to be very touristy but Sara provided us with lots of local recommendations of what is good and what the markets were originally known for and what to stay away from She was also great in telling us what prices were fair so no one paid too much Sara is so kind and provided us with lots of information about the area and the history of the markets One of my favourite days in Bangkok so far it is so so worth the early start This tour is very well priced compared to other tours Sara also threw in a bunch of free sweet corn local bananas "tempura bananas" and cold water and towels to keep us cool on the hot day Couldn't have been happier with the day and met lots of lovely people in our small group This is a must when coming to Bangkok We were back by 2pm so I had plenty of time to get to the train station for my night train to Chiang Mai Thank you Sara you were the best

title: BTS is FAB!
review: The BTS is great in bkk only to be bettered by SG and HK but I think it is great NO expensive super clean and runs on a good time system A must to travel in

title: Very High Tech
review: The BTS Skytrain is so modern extremely clean and air conditioned Not to mention that the fares are very cheap and I recommend you get the day pass The only issue is that it travels a bit slow

title: What a difference it makes!
review: Compared to spending hours in Bangkok traffic jams in the past the Skytrain is magnificent Only 140 baht for a day ticket takes you close to most of the places you would want to visit ( and in air conditioned comfort) It has revolutionised travel in central Bangkok

title: Best way to see Bangkok, but needs upgrade to accommodate handicapped
review: Puts you within doorsteps of most city attractions in uptown Bangkok No wheelchair access however

title: Conveniente way for travell
review: Very good and easy This avoids to stuck in traffic and brings you to many destinations Buy a rabbit card Better than buying ticket by ticket

title: Convenient and reliable
review: The ARL train runs fr the airport to Phay Thai in Bangkok It takes 30 mins and cost 45b Fr 1 nov 2018 all tickets must be purchased fr the auto ticket machine From Phay Thai the terminal station you can change to BTS train to get around Bangkok Pl note that the ARL ticket is different fr the BTS ticket It is a reliable way to get to the airport if you are worried about getting stuck in the famous Bangkok traffic jams

title: Very easy to use
review: The sky train is simple to use very frequent and air conditioned It's very busy at peak periods as Thai people is it to commute to work It links in with all of the other transport systems Easy to get to the ferries to visit the sights up and down the river And last but not least you get a good view as it is in the Sky after all

title: Nice visit, bad tour guide
review: Our guide Aoi was bad At the visit to the market next to the train she did not leave us time to take photos or explore we ran from people we were standing for 20 minutes in the heat waiting for the train to pass without being able to move or visit the market and then we had to run to the car to go to the floating market   Keep in mind that you leave at 8am from your hotel to travel two hours to the train station that leaves at 1040am

title: Reliable.
review: The bts train is a reliable medium to travel around the city The daily is just 140 per pax   Its center is at siam which is basically the center of bangkok Here you can access many varieties of shopping and other activities   The train has three lines going to major three directions You could always go to the station nearest to your target location and take a taxi which them becomes of course cheaper and you avoid unexpected bangkok traffic   I used it with my wife and son (15 yrs old) It was great

title: Good and fast
review: just like MRT in singapore it basically goes everywhere and fares are not expensive u can go everywhere siam sq city area to chatuchak and even to airport ive rely alot on it good job

title: Easy Quick Way to get around Bangkok
review: Travelling on the MRT is a easy & quick way of travelling around Bangkok Trains are frequent quick air conditioned and clean they can be crowded at peak times

title: Easy and cheap
review: When you have hand luggage only Not easy if you have to carry big suit cases to the airport Easy access by MRT Makan stattion from BTS Asok stattion

title: Short and Comfortable Ride
review: Was taking the airport rail link from Pratunam area to Aiirport and back Only 40baht per way and it is convenience Need to kow that they had posted security officers to scan all luggage and bags towards the airport Also they would be a security sweep before allowing the people to board the train at the both end of the journey

title: Incredibly easy to use
review: The Bangkok metro is simple to use fast clean and efficient  You barely wait a minute or two for the train to turn up

title: Not the Orient Express
review: We traveled 1st class overnight and I'd read some reviews so I knew what to expect We avoided the high prices orange juice and ate our evening meal before we set off We had their breakfasts and we're pleasantly surprised after some of the reviews Yes the AV is a bit aggressive I recommend wearing a long not short sleeve shirt But the blanket supplied  was adequate My partner in the top bunk wore an eye shade to sleep as the light cannot be turned off On the lower bunk I think ear plugs could help I managed happily without Our car #11 was quite old #10 is new and we're told is better You can't book more the two no the aheadeven so when we tried just three days short of two months our preferred date was fully booked We had two big suitcases which meant we were quite cramped in our cabin One plus was our train ran an hour late so we managed to see more of the interesting hill scenery from daylight at six

title: Clean, nice and very quiet MRT
review: I said very quiet because not many people using MRT Each station is big and very spacious Plus it is clean Not many station master can speak English so must use the name of the place you're going to then they understand Use the vending machine you choose English first on the top right hand side Press the name of the station you're going to and pay the amount by coins or paper Then there is black plastic coin comes out hang on to it don't loose it because this is your MRT ticket So the black plastic coin comes out then your change Look carefully for your change don't left it there Then you go the gate with the green light and there is a place to tap your black coin Hold on to your coin just tap it but still hang on to it When you exit from the station you just put the black coin on the slot just drop it then the gate will open   Have a nice ride

title: Its easier then I though
review: I took it everywhere and didn't get lost I like that its close to most tourist attraction I like that some stops are at shopping areas I did so much shopping its crazy

title: very good service
review: sky train is very close to the hotel s sukhumvit suites  hardly 3 minutes walk  easy to go any and every where

title: The only way to go
review: Very few pay the extra for the Express so it is quieter but the Cityline trains run more frequently and one experiences more of the real Thailand and its people

title: 6'3" man - no problem!
review: First sleeper trainbus ever Got a lower berth 2nd class ac full stretch no problem I needed a guaranteed sleep after the night I had before I was out like a light Train took a little longer than scheduled (14hrs) but I woke up feeling awake and refreshed Didn't purchase food just brought some snacks and water

title: Brilliant
review: This is the MRT make getting around Bangkok a very simple hassle free experience Totally safe reliable and a joy to use

title: nice one
review: I always love the airport link there its clean easy to access and use ) the direction is pretty clear for me that's what traveler need

title: Fast connectivity to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Airport rail link connects Phaya Thai and Suvarnabhumi airport and is operational from 0600 to 0000 hours It is a convenient way to travel to and from the airport and has interchange  stations at Phaya Thai(BTSSkytrain) and Makkasan(MRT blue line)

title: User friendly
review: Very easy to use staff trained and always helpful Good way to avoid Bangkok Traffic jams and thats the thing you really wanna avoid

title: Great way to travel
review: Travelled with the skytrain from our hotel to the airport hassle free Kid friendly and always some kind of an official to assist with strollers etc

title: This train is a godsend!
review: If you know Bangkok traffic then you would appreciate this train service to and from the airport It‚Äôs fast predictable convenient not expensive and air conditioned No problem with traffic at all too

title: Easy, Effective, Fast and Cheap!
review: The Skytrain is very good So easy to use and you can zoom around the city in no time Price of tickets are very good value and yeh over all it's a very efficient mode of transport Helped us a lot in our short few days in bangkok to see a tonne of things Prefer it a lot more to London Underground haha

title: Easy, fast and clean
review: The MRT is simply the fastest way to get across this amazing city the carriages are clean well lit and air conditioned Gets a little crowded as you might expect during rush hours

title: Airport Rail LInk
review: A great way to get into the city from the airport  Excellent timekeeping and only 30bht  Getting on and off the link no problem  For those with a bit of luggage there are lifts at your destination to get you to road level

title: Railway and Floating Markettour with Sara
review: The tour wirh Sara was amazing Sara was such a heartwarming and knowledgable guide She always made us feel well and we had to laugh a lot The tour is very well planned and it was a oneinalifetime experience

title: Easy and quick
review: Prepare coins THB 1 5 10 before heading to stations as changing coins at the stations takes time during rush hours I paid mostly 2025 for 34 stations further

title: If you want to get around in Bangkok it is the way to go
review: I find that this system (BTS) ONE OF THE MOST EFFICIENT ways to get around  a Bangkok has it down perfect With some common sense it is easy to get around Add the app on your phone and it is even easier

title: Easy Way to Navigate Bangkok
review: BTS skytrain is a great way to explore Bangkok Used the metro to connect to our  shuttle boat after sightseeing in Bangkok Routes are well marked Only downside is that there are long distances to cover to access boarding from stop to stop but that allowed us to also use local buses that made special ‚Äúunscheduled‚Äù stops for our family Make sure to hold onto your ticket as you will need it to exit

title: Swift, and a great way to avoid Bangkok's traffic congestion
review: The MRT is a very convenient way to get around Bangkok It intersects with the BTS (Skytrain) in a number of stations so between them most places you want to go are covered Both the MRT and the BTS connect with the airport train at different stations

title: Perfect mass transport from Suvarnabhumi
review: For solo traveller it is the best solution to reach the Bangkok Downtown You could continue to your accomodation by BTS or MRT Sometimes little bit fulled of people who carry a big luggage who need larger space than the backpack

title: super good
review: It was so clean I was very impressed Easy to get everywhere in Bangkok and avoid traffic I liked it very much and saved alot of time

title: A Lovely Way to See the City
review: Easy to use stations announced in English and signs are easy to follow Clean and spacious A great way to see the city

title: EASY RIDING
review: its easy to around BKK with this train if you cant buy ticket by finding machine just asking for the ticket in the office

title: Great
review: The travel service in and around bangkok was great many stations within walking distance of all the city hotels  They are extremely clean and a great punctual service most people are polite and happy to help if you have a question  Try and work out where you want to go prior to queuing up and pay

title: first ride
review: Excellent Metro Good connectivity to Indira market  Very cheap also in comparison to taxi Taxi charges are nearly rs 400 to 500 Baht while metro took only 40 baht per person and takes only 35 minutes Drawback not runs 24 hours closed from 12 pm to 6 am

title: Easy to negotiate
review: Like metros in many cosmopolitan cities this was easy to negotiate even if you don't know the language There were very few signs in English but the graphics were easy to follow both on the maps and on the ticket machines We only went one stop and we never left the doorway area because it was so crowded but people were mannerly and we felt safe Stations were clean too

title: There are cheaper ways to get around like taxis
review: It seems to work and is especially good in peak hour however cabs are very cheap

title: Great tour
review: Great day staff was knowledgeable and spoke English well Worth the price  Van was very comfortable Experience was great

title: Most convenient way of transport for tourists in Bangkok
review: Sky Train is the most convenient way of transport for tourists in Bangkok These modern trains go to almost everywhere within Bangkok Using these trains you can avoid the horrible traffic of Bangkok and go to your destination on time Tickets cost no more than 50THB Note that Sky train does not go to Grand Palace Wat Poh Pom Phra Sumen to Pom Mahakan which are the main attractions for tourists However using Sky Train you can reach to Saphan Taksin Station At the ground floor of the station the express ferry terminal is located Using the Express ferry (One way cost is 40THB and day pass is 150THB) you can go to Grand Palace Wat Poh Pom Phra Sumen Wet Market China Town and many other places

title: Simple mode of transport to get back and forth the airport
review: Nothing difficult using the service trains arrive and depart almost every 510 minutes A Token for travel is obtainable from the kiosk and is used for admittance through the turnstyles at to the platform The locations of the different stops are clearly indicated within the compartment   As long as you know the district of where your hotel is located you will have no problems as to what station to get off

title: Save money take the train
review: I have used the train from the airport on my last two trips to Bangkok I find it easy to use and is quicker than a cab plus saves some Baht for the trip

title: Over crowded but convenient
review: Took this train from ratchaprarop station with 3 adults and one infant Has lifts so don't worry about the luggage ## during peek hours placing and standing with the luggage is quiet uncomfortable both for you as well as other commuters  ## 40 bhat to airport Very affordable and main thing is very very fast compared to bkk traffic Easiest way to get to airport as it goes straight to terminal

title: Cool, Fast and Efficient.....
review: The BTS is really the best way of traveling in Bangkok  Cars are air conditioned and directions are very easy to understand  You can get a "Day Pass" for only 140 Baht (less than $4 US)you can go all over the area and explore non tourist sights

title: Going to to correct airport???
review: The rail line is very clean and efficient to BKK Traveled on a Saturday so not very busy So excited we got to Suvarnabhurri Airport (BKK) way before our departing flight to Krabi Thailand We were at the wrong airport We needed to be at Don Muang (DMK) 30 miles away That isn't part of airport rail link Can be 30 mins to 2 hours away   Traveled link again to head out Internationally Much better experience

title: Super easy
review: Super easy to use and cheap Much better than being stuck in Bangkok traffic Also try using the MRT which is also excellent

title: Get's you there...
review: Quicker than a tuktuk i suppose but has very limited connectivitychange overs Overall a nice and clean system

title: Easy and you avoind the killing constant traffic jam on the streets
review: Easy to find your way to choose aboutamong the three lines   good maps  affordable  all informations given in English  also station nameseng

title: Easy access to some popular stations
review: BTS skytrain is airconditioned and organized into two lines One can change between the two lines at Siam station and there's access to Bangkok metro and airport rail link too

title: Cheap and Clean Train in the City
review: It's nice train in Bangkok We used skytrain from Chit Lom to Mo Chit The train is very modern and clean From inside we can enjoy the view of Bangkok City

title: Cheap and convenient way to travel around Bangkok
review: Cheap convenient and safe means of transportation in Bangkok and most important of all avoid the traffic jam

title: good way travel around bkk
review: good reasonbell fix price around bkk  friendly staff easy to juse staff olways ready to help if you need advice  free map pick up near the counter if you travel around bkk

title: Beautiful Wat Mongkon MRT Station!
review: We took MRT from Asok (Sukhumvit MRT Station) to Chinatown ( Wat Mongkon MRT Station) on the Chinese New Year The Wat Mongkon MRT Station is beautiful The staff were friendly and helpful

title: Convenient!
review: The skytrain is a cheap alternative to the pricey tuktuks  It cost us 22 THB each to go two stations  tuktuks wanted 300 There is a map of the system at the station  You check where you want to get off and it tells you how much it is  You then put the coins in the machine (you can get change at the booth) and it gives you a card  Put the card in the entrance gates and it gives it back to you  You then use the card to exit the system  (Don't lose your card)

title: good way to travel
review: the MTR & BTS are both great ways to travel through Bangkok clean and very efficient the service is very reliable and the staff working within it are always friendly

title: Food is so so  but by local trains standards  ok  Preferred the 1st class sleeper on way up
review: On way back 2and class sleeper  was ok  But crying babies and stop start trip  due to weather mucking up the line a bit But will do it again

title: way to travel in Bangkok
review: I highly recommend using the Skytrain it is a great way to move around and you don't have to worry about traffic It's very easy to navigate and very convenient

title: Our Stays revolve around it!
review: For us who love that sense of independent travelling Airport Rail Link is always central to all our plans Its convenient and gets you to the airport on time They need to however make it 24 hours

title: Convenient and easy to use.
review: An excellent way to avoid all the traffic congestion Trains run every five minutes and are Airconditioned First platform is where you purchase your ticket from dispensers Very easy to use Most trains depart from the second level Only down side it not all stations have escalators

title: Easy and fast
review: This is a choice for travaler who would like to go to BANGKOK or BTS or MRT (they are connected) by avoiding the traffic jam It is fast You maybe spent your time 3040minutes to travel from Suvannabhum airport to Bts Phayathai which is near the Victory Monument HAVE A SAFE TRIP ^^

title: Great way to speed around town
review: Clean fast and easy to get to most things Can't beat it as airport transport too AC is usually pumping which is a huge sell in BKK

title: Clean and Quite
review: We took the train from the airport to downtown It was cheap fast clean and quiet Once off the platform though you have to deal with Bangkok hucksters Only take a metered cab or negotiate in advance Know were you are going and communicate that to the driver They don't speak English so have the address written in Thai

title: Railway market and floating market tour
review: What an amazing 6 hour tour Great value for money One of the best tours we have been on in the world not just Bangkok Our guide Kwan was amazing too and kept us informed throughout the whole tour

title: Stolen passport on overnight train
review: I had my passport and valuables stolen from next to my head (inside a zipped up bag) while I slept on an overnight 2nd class ac sleeper from Bangkok to Surat Thani Lesson be very careful with your belongings and use a money belt wherever possible   Great trip otherwise Way better than the newer trains which have sterile air conditioned restaurant cars and only microwave food options available

title: Ease of use
review: This train system was super easy to use and very affordable Maps were easy to follow to see where you wanted to go I don‚Äôt enjoy using public transport but this system made it easier

title: fast
review: take it easy go to some place is not busy and not traffic jam so this is connect to shopping mall another station

title: Train n floating market
review: The time for visiting the train market is too short Car transport was good Should have few bottles of water arranged in the car as it‚Äôs a long ride

title: Although nice the people at the ticket counter are not helpful.
review: The service is best but the direction is not clear from the station It should have more of directions on display It becomes a little difficult for travellers  But a good way if you want to beat the traffic

title: Clean cheap subway
review: Bangkoks subway is a great way to get to places if you don't like sitting in traffic jams for decades It's safe clean airconditioned and pretty cheap The downside is that it is just one line in a very big city So if you don't live near a station or are headed somewhere near a station it's kinda useless and you are stuck in traffic again

title: Day pass  on the train
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok for a day You buy a day pass for 140 baht and away you go The trains are clean frequent and easy to navigate  Tuk tuks are fabulous but with the traffic in Bangkok this is the way to travel

title: Reliable Hassal Free transport
review: Hassal free transport in the centre of Bangkok that is cool and fast with an ever expanding network This has interconnecting station with the BTS and even the airport link but the walk is a little long if you have lots of baggage Travelling at peak times ie early morning for workers and again in the early evening with workers going home it can get very crowded If you are staying in Bangkok for any length of time pick up a multi pass that you only need to top up as required its saves time lining up for tickets A very clean safe effective and cool option to transport yourself

title: A good people mover but pretty hot and squashed
review: We were lucky to use the skytrain with a guide so the language wasn‚Äôt as to work with It was pretty hot and crowded but it certainly is a cost effective way of getting around

title: best way to go around
review: the only real and honest choice to go around Bangkokforget taxis and motorbikewith few quids you go around everywhere

title: Best way to Airport
review: Airport rail link connects the city directly to the airport convinient to travel with luggage we travelled from phetchaburi to ratchaprarop to  reach Pratunam

title: Fast ride to anywhere you go
review: Back in my country I had a car and thought it was going to be hard not having one here in Bkk I proved myself I was wrong Using the BTS everyday makes my life easier no need to stress out about traffic It is always clean and people are polite

title: Convenienet
review: One of the advantages staying at hotels along sukhumvit road is the BTS Loved it for the convenience it gave taking us to shopping areas and then some   Efficient Clean and comfortable

title: Crowded
review: Very crowded and dont expect people offer the chair to someone who need Just have in the new city center and you will need to finish by cab or bus if you want to visit the ancient part of city  where you have most of place to visit such as grand palace golden budha

title: Great rail system in Bangkok
review: We took terminal 21 and travelled all the way to the Wat Pho Temple and Wat Arun Temple in a short period of time Credit to Bangkok to have a metro system so efficient

title: Great time at the Or Tor Kor food market
review: At the recommendation of a local friend we visited the Or Tor Kor food market and had a great time  It is a huge market full of stalls selling all kinds of local food   fruits spices vegetables sea food staple food cooked or raw ingredients  Also attached with street food stalls where you can sit down to enjoy a local meal  Take the MRT blue line get off at Kamphaeng Phet station take Exit 3 and you are right there

title: Easy way of travelling and cheap too
review: The connection to the last stop (starting from the airport) costs 45 THB per person This is so much cheaper than a taxi

title: Efficient
review: Convenient and efficient  Was super crowded when we were on it literally packed sardines Clear signs and easy to transfer from MRT to BTS to airport rail

title: Fast and Cheap
review: Bangkok BTS are a great transportation for busy street in Bangkok Bangkok traffic are ridiculous most street and highway packed  all the times  You have to spend so much times and money on street BTS is much faster and cheaper Be prepared for a lot of people during rush hour

title: Efficient
review: Helpful staff Efficiently run Takes you into town cheaply enough Not a lot more to say other than clean and cool

title: clean and easy to use
review: very clean and easy to use english speaking train conducter announces stops in english as well we used the train almost every day

title: Quick with aircon
review: Great way to cover distance in Bangkok Clean and cheap with fierce aircon (thankfully) Worth choosing accomodation to give easy access to Skytrain and river ferries

title: Great market experience
review: We had a great day visiting the railway and floating market The driver and guide were both great guys and would definitely recommend Bigcountry tours They picked us up from our hotel at 8am and dropped us back at the BKK shopping centre around 315 There were only 10 on the tour so we were able to get a lot of info from our guide and was very easy to get the paddle boats around the market even though it was crazy

title: BTS Skytrain for Bkk trip
review: I always use this as my main mode of transport when in Bangkok It stops at all major shopping belts Easy to acess You may purchase from single trip ticket 1day ticket or a Rabbit card ( Stored value card) All obtainable at any train station passenger service counter One thing to note no balloons on board They confiscate my kid one on my return trip from Asiatique   Main station for tourists Siam station (Siam Paragon)  Mo Chit (Chatuchak weekend market) National Stadium (MBK shopping) Sala Deang Ashok (Terminal 21 Shopping) Chidlom (Nearest station towards Patrunam market and Platinum mall)

title: Extremely Interesting
review: Having visited the 'ThailandBurma Railway Centre Museum Hellfire Pass Memorial' the 'Bridges over the River Kwai' and stayed at 'The Float House' we concluded our stay in the Kanchanaburi region with a ride on the 'Death Railway Train' itself We opted to pay a little extra so that we were guaranteed a window seat Although this did mean that we weren't able to travel with the local people we did get a fantastic view of lush forest and the River Kwai We also passed over bridges built by locals and prisoners of war during World War 2 and as the railway track bent round it was easy to see that we were actually travelling over the bridge Whilst on the train we were given complimentary water cool towels and a choice of tea coffee or cola What an interesting experience All told we were aboard for about an hour and from here we continued our journey back to Bangkok by minibus This is a must do experience if you are in the vicinity

title: Good for speed
review: WE went on skytrain from hotel as was the fastest way to get to the river Can get busy but compared to tube in London a doddle

title: An economic and efficient way to get around Bangkok
review: We used the  MRT a lot while staying in Bangkok It was only 2 mins walk from our hotel (Centre point Silom hotel) There are attendants at the station who speak very good english and they will point you in the right direction The trains are very clean but a bit packed most of the time

title: Amazing trip and cool guide
review: The trip was interesting and despite the long bus ride the experience of riding the train to the market and watching it leaves are amazing and one of a kind The floating market boat ride and lunch were good as well

title: Good way of traveling for locals and tourists
review: Easy how it works Busy though Affordable and effective way of traveling For just a short trip you need some coins For more trips I'm planning to buy daycard

title: Excellent mode of city transport
review: This rail system is an excellent way to travel in Bangkok City  it travels above the major traffic and covers vast areas of the city  It is reasonably priced and when we were there in May 2015 there were huge extensions to the rail system in progress

title: Very efficient
review: Ive travelled in BTS skytrain a couple of times during my stay in Bangkok last year(feb2015) as well as this year(feb 2016)Its very convinientefficient n reasonableThe traffic is so bad in Bangkoj that you will easily take an hour to reach d shortest distance whereas the skytrain takes you in much less time and a you spend a lot less They are neat and clean and very systematicYou can buy your tickets from the counter aswell as from the ticket machines installedIts always crowded thoughBut considering the amount of time and money you save its totallt worth

title: Pleasantly surprised with how easy it was
review: We took the train only a few times but I was so happy with how easy it was There are english translations of stops for tourist's convenience

title: quick and easy
review: a quick and easy transport device probably one of the cheapest ways to get into town if you need from the airport great

title: Clean, cheap and convenient
review: Easy way to get from the airport HOWEVER if you are carrying luggage the lack of escalators to get onto the SKY TRAIN makes life difficult We walked down two flights of stairs when we disembarked and hailed a taxi for the rest of the journey

title: Fast and comfortable ride
review: There are  or were  two airport link lines  The Express and the City trains  For some reason the Express did not seem to be working recently but the City train for THB 45 still gets from the airport to Phaya Thai (terminus) in about thirty minutes  faster than most taxis could cover the distance  At Phaya Thai there is a direct link to Skytrain  Good clean and efficient service

title: Easy and fast!
review: The MRT is the Metro of BKK and a great way to get around Easy to jump to the skytrain the Airport rail link and to numerous busses and trains

title: Grat way to get downtown from the airport
review: Great way to get from the airport to the city instead of being stuck in traffic Be prepared to change train switch to skytrain or take a cab to reach your destination Not suitable if you travel heavy

title: Fast and no traffic jam
review: It is the best least hassle free to get around Bangkok intercity best to buy daily pass to avoid the lineup to buy tickets at the end of  individual gates

title: Cheap and fast
review: It's very comfortable to move with this train in Bangkok but unfortunately it goes only in rough directions of the city

title: Safe, easy, quick mode of transport
review: Safe easy quick mode of transport for locals and tourists Well connected to BTS Sky train It not only connect airport but other part of the city too so you can tooandfro city without getting into  city traffic and very very good place to meet local public  it terminates at Phaya Thai and you can take another metro train from there for rest of the city Fully AC Great mode of transport inandout bangkok

title: The best way to commute between the airport and the city
review: Fast and cheap not too crowded and has good connections on the city side Better than taxi and you can always take a taxi at the end station there' even a taxi stand

title: Why are there so many taxis outside the airport.
review: For 45 baht it takes just under an hour to get into central Bangkok Or you could pay a taxi driver 400+ baht to sit in a traffic jam for a couple of hours as he tells you about the financial horror of his families daily existence in an attempt to get a big tip  Just take the escalator down to lowest level Buy a token Go through the automated gate Then wait for a train that arrives every 15 minutes Then for the next hour you sit in air conditioned comfort Get off at your station Flag down a taxi and pay anything up to about 100 baht Depending on the distance to get to your hotel Or you could always take the taxi option

title: Great Itinerary!
review: Communication was great Right after we booked the tour they emailed us a pickup time and then the day before gave us a more accurate pickup time via email They were on time The small bus  van was very well kept air conditioned and comfortable with cup holders The itinerary was very well thought out and we packed a lot in It didn't feel too lengthy of a day There were plenty of opportunities to go to the bathroom I would suggest bringing a little handheld fan and moneybills You get one bottle of water free They stop at a very nice gas station to go to the bathroom once you get close to the first attraction I'd suggest buying a drink there as well to stay hydrated You won't get dirty you can wear normal street clothes Sara our guide was excellent She kept our group together and explained different things throughout the day We noticed other tours next to us and the guides of those other companies weren't explaining much to their groups Sara was enthusiastic positive and one of the best guides out there Highly recommend this tour This isn't something you'd want to book without a tour guide

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: I used the link a few times it is super efficient I downloaded the Aiirport Link App which is free and takes all mystery out of train arrivals and departures It gets very crowded at rush hour but otherwise is quite comfortable It links very conveniently with  the metro and bus systems

title: Fast but so cold inside
review: Fast moving through Bangkok  Rabbit card ok but you are not refunded for the 80 bath deposit Very cold inside  I took a bad cold because of it No control over seniors seats No one leaves you a seat  Should be controlled

title: Simple to use and great gun
review: Used the Skytrain just for the fun and found it userfriendly Had a meal at Silom and found our way back to the closest station to our hotel

title: Transportation
review: It is easy to buy tickets and easy to use the Skytrain  You can avoid the heavy traffic by using the Skytrain

title: Wonderful day!  Our guide, Tanya was the best...Highly recommend!
review: Was hoping for more shopping exploring time and less travel time  Plus Being a half day trip I expected to be back sooner it was 330 but it was Wonderful experience and I highly recommend it

title: Sightseeing on  Bangkoks.' BTS SkyTrain'
review: One way of getting around Bangkok's traffic is the BTS SkyTrain A real travel treat awaits you just riding the rails Air conditioned clean and handy avoiding grid lock traffic easy to use a great public transportation systemSpectacular views around Victory Monumentwith the MRT Maps free at airport as you exit near the taxi rankSkyTrain intersects subwaySo you two options of getting around Bangkok is  world class tourist  cityArrivals go up every year

title: Snail of bangkok!
review: The Airport link is the slowest of the 3 lines Also with the fewest stops Only good thing about this line is that you can take it to and from the airport

title: Great public transportation.
review: It is so cheap and I found it easy to navigate It is a fast way to get around and with all of the pollution in Bangkok an environmentally friendly option

title: Excellent Public Transportation
review: The trains are clean and timely They can get very crowded during the day but the frequency helps out

title: Burma-Thailand Railway
review: I came here with a business partner on a tour of Thailand We got on at the Kwai River Bridge station The view from the river is spectacular The weather was good and it was nice to be able to open the window and ride the train without it being too hot It's a long way from Bangkok so it's a oneday tour I think it's a good place to visit at least once

title: As Advertised
review: The name is on the tin if you need to get to and from Suvanphun airport or BKK town center this doesn't the job well but considering you will probably still need a taxi to your hotel and that a taxi from the airport in the first place would be about $15 or less I am not sure it worth the hassle

title: Only way to travel!
review: Amazingly easy to use  Never really got super busy even in peak times Commuterstravellers are all well disciplined as before you get on the train you que in an orderly line 1010 for cleanliness an all trains are air conditioned    Definitely cheaper and a lot safer than the taxis n Tuk Tuks going around  you have to try one though

title: Can be great or terrible depending...
review: If you board at the airport its great since you will definitely get inside and also may have a seat To the airport is another story unless they have airport passenger only cars You can easily wait for 3 or more trains at rust hour and the trains intervals are not fast more like 10 15 minutes or more A nightmare without luggage even worse with luggage Airport express trains stopped running which were good for passengers There are typically no fans to even recirculate the hot air at stations and it is very hot Reportedly lack of and or poor managed maintenance has led to many issues Some stations do have food courts and restaurants The Ramkanghaeng Station food court has nice Indian Food and inexpensive

title: EXCELLENT ACCESS TO BANGKOKS ATTRACTIONS EASY TO USE
review: Very user friendly for tourists cheap day tickets provide limitless access to all stations & gets you away from the pollution & chaotic traffic jams at ground level

title: Great way to go around Bangkok
review: We took BTS Skytrain everywhere in Bangkok  I wish there were more ticket machines that take notes however as many ticket machines only take coins Other than the 1 day pass there was no tickets that I could purchase one time and get deducted per usage The 1 day pass was 140 Baht when we visited and thus is not worth it if you don't take at least 4 long trips

title: BTS Skytrain is the best way to travel across Bangkok
review: This train is fast and clean  it helps you avoid the fumes from a tuk tuk or overcharging by taxi and there is of course no traffic whatsoever  We rode this thing repeatedly and even used it to travel to train stations and subways to travel outside of Bangkok  It's a lifesaver  You can also use it to get close to wherever you need to go and just hail an uber to pick you up close to one of the stations when you arrive  Amazing

title: The most economic and efficient way to travel to and from Suvarnabhum airport
review: Considering the heavy traffic in Bangkok city which may delay your arrival in airport Airport Link can take you there on time This fast mode train runs between Phaya Thai station and Subarnabhum airport with stopages in between It takes exactly 30 mins and costs 4045 bath Every 15  20 mins there is a train If you are travelling from city to airport you can reach Phaya Thai Airport Link Station by taxi or BTS sky train If you reach the station by BTS there is no elevator at the BTS platform to carry your suitcase down to airport link platform have to use the stairs I prefer to go there by taxi as there are escalators and elevators to carry the suitcases up to the platform At Subarnabhum airport the Airport Link  Platform is at the basement floor Once you reach PhayaTha station you will find elevators and escalators to carry your suitcases down Phaya Thai station is at the city centre with a taxi stand From Phaya Thai you can take a taxi to your hotel or use the BTS sky train    Few downsides of this transport is during week days and peak hours it gets very crowded If you are travelling with children and have large size heavy suitcases this is not the most suitable transport Mostly meant for budget tourists solo travellers

title: Take easy way to go
review: I use the Airport Rail Link from the Airport to Siam Square after give up the quite taxi waiting That's easy way to go and cheap At the Airport you can down stair and buy the Ticket (from tickets machine) Choose the route from the Airport to Phaya Thai Station (the last stops of Airport Rail Link) just 45 bahtperson And walk a few minutes to Siam Square please Good luck to you guys

title: Fast, cheap, easy!
review: What a great service Like a little oasis every time you step on board the air conditioned carriage Train every few minutes Great way to explore Bangkok The tracks about three stories above the road level and gives you a great overview of the city No more congested streets and dodgy taxitoktok drivers Highly recommend

title: very polite thai people
review: We are staying at the Eastin next to Surasak and we take the skytrain quite often It's convenient and not too expensive The best is to buy a rabbit pass and the rate is automatically deducted when you enterleave a station The rabbit pass also gives you discount at some juice stores (just look at a discount)  The skytrain has air conditioning (bring a light jacket as it can be cold) and moves silently People are not allowed to eat nor to drink as such the train is very clean I've also notice that thai people are very polite they line up neatly on the side of each door (especially during rush hour) and wait their turn to enter

title: Quick and easy through bangkok
review: Be sure to have coins for the ticket machine Or you can change notes into coins at the stations however there is usually a long line

title: Great way to get around
review: The skytrain was very clean and tidy  Announcements in English made it easy to know when to get off  Tickets were easy to purchase and stations seemed to be in convenient locations

title: Single line
review: Still not mature Line is single and serve only a few places Extension is in progress High security checks for entry Safety for everyone

title: Clean, Safe, Quick, But Doesn't Take Credit Cards
review: Loved avoiding the crazy Bangkok traffic by using the elevated train called the BTS  There are two BTS lines and you need to pay by cash  If you don't have cash or are unsure of how to use the ticket machines use the friendly ticket agents who are located at every station and speak English  Retain your ticket or token as you need it to enter and exit the BTS system    You can use the BTS to get to the underground subway called the MRT  Tell the ticket agent your final stop and they can direct you  Not that there are two BTS stations where you can connect with the the MRT but the MRT system requires another ticket so expect to pay twice

title: Never again
review: First of all we would like to thank 12go for the service that was perfect and Bossotel as well   Saying that regarding the train it was poor and very dirty the toilets was minimalist and not so clean too it not First Class The service was good but we paid 1'750 bath for 3 meals and 3 breakfast which is more than expensive and we did not receive any bill and we were unable to check the price of what we order and the food was not very good   To be honest it could have been first classe last century in the 50' but nowadays for the price we paid THB 6459 which is the double of the price of a flight for three people and as frequents train train traveler (europe usa) we believe we can expect more   We are terribly sorry for this appraisal

title: Avoid Traffic
review: A great way to get around Bangkok without the hassles of taxis and traffic It also connects with the Bangkok Subway system It's cost effective clean and efficient

title: Lots of stairs
review: Trains are are efficient people movers but generally very crowded standing room only Even when there are escalators from ground level stairways connect to platforms Rabbit cards are very convenient need passport to buy one

title: For express transportation in city.
review: Convenience Express way to see interesting places in Bangkok city esp Business Variety of Food and Shopping regions

title: Why no loo?
review: Great transportation Easy for tourists as maps locations available & most importantly in English Helpful staff at all stations I went thru Quick effective punctual as many trains  But why oh why lack of toilet  Not one in all of them stations I went to  Rcvd a pic of a demonstrator who "relieved" (number 2) herself at one of them BTS' due to it  Asked staff of shops there how they do their "business"  all said to get out fr BTS and go to nearest hotelcoffeeshopshopping center Was stuck at Asoke Station at around 7 pm on Jan 13 otw to Saphan Taksin  First time experiencing how sardines are packed in tins Luckily Thais r wellbehaved  Overall great BTS one up compared to Malaysia's LRT

title: Same experience
review: Going up goind down follow the arrows Be guided by the BTS or MTR map Prepare for your coins or 2050100 Baht to use to buy tickets Token and card is provided (for residence you can have tap card) for your fare

title: Easy, convenient
review: It is easy to use the bts Beats the traffic congestion It is efficient clean and economical Best way to travel around in Bangkok

title: Tremendous
review: The best way to travel around the capital The train is above the streets thus giving a view of the city and the crowded roads below Good value too

title: Fast and cheap link to the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is convenient to use and a fast and cheap way to get to the airport I would recommend it to anyone flying in and out of the city

title: Clean and fast
review: Fast way to transport around the city The people always give up their sit for my young daughter Can be crowded but as always is with other countries‚Äô public transport Nothing bad to say

title: great service.
review: amazing servicednt use taxi or tuk  tuk cheap and best option as it cheaper dan anydink in Bangkok easy to take ticket  and people are  very helpful Basically all the major spots are adjoins the stationsu can save lots of money by using the Sky Train

title: Never Again to ride on Thai train!
review: Took Train No 7 on 2nd class AirCon (there is no 1st class on Day train) from Bangkok to Chiang Mai that was supposed to be 10 hrs 30 min journey but took an additional 45 min to arrive at the destination  It was the most uncomfortable and unbearable train service I ever experienced The train was very old slow and noisy There was no dining car for this long journey however the attendants do take order for rice meal box (at Baht 60) that took them 3 hours to deliver to my seat Although it was an aircon carriage but after one hour into the journey the fans were turned on It was very hot and stuffy throughout the journey I will not travel on train in Thailand after this bad experience

title: More improvements are required
review: Bangkok BTS lines are very good choices to avoid the horrible traffic jam in Bankok cities The BTS lines covered most of the tourist attraction as well as nearby hotel However there are still a number of improvements required to consider by the management The ticket machines are always queue up by the passenger due to the not user friendly system and the small assembly hall You have to ready sufficient coins otherwise you have to queue up for money exchange  If you are more than two passengers sometimes it's cheaper to take a meter taxi than BTS Furthermore the very limited escalators or lifts that not very convenient to the people with disabilities or tourist with luggages

title: Clean skytrain with A/C!
review: The train system was very quick efficient and clean Plus it is air conditioned which was amazing on the very hot days Priced well and handy I'd say it's a great way to get around Bangkok

title: Skytrain
review: IT is really very cold inside THE train so prepare to Freese or take something that you can use inside it

title: Quick&Easy to use
review: Gets you around pretty quickly (like any other mass transport system in major cities) and staff are helpful with tourists

title: the fastest way to the city/airport
review: Aitrport Rail Link is the fastest way to the cityairport regular service at reasonable costs can be crowded when office hours end

title: User friendly train
review: This is such an easy public transport system to use Simply look at the map for your destination station which will then have the cost of your journey next to it Pay that amount into a ticket machine and you are given a plastic token allowing you to make your journeysimple I wish the train system here in Melbourne were as easy to use Very user friendly

title: Easy to use
review: And it's lovely and cold on a super hot day Very packed with commuters but it's a fast efficient way to get around the city

title: Lifeline of Bangkok!
review: Given the insane traffic and endless jams all around Bangkok it wouldnt be possible to commute quickly if it wasnt for the Skytrains They are comfortable quick and clean Best mode of transport in Bangkok

title: Clean and cool
review: Much better more reliable than trying to find a taxi (with a driver that actually used the meter and spoke english) One of the best ways to get around the city

title: Getting above the Bangkok traffic
review: The notorious Bangkok traffic can be beat easily by taking the Skytrain an economic and quick way to get around some important parts of the city  It also has the added attraction of an elevated walkway in some parts of town making pedestrian life much more pleasanti

title: Death Railway tour
review: We were collected from our hotel at 0700 by Moo (our guide) and a driver Minibus was comfortable  We had spoken to tour company day previously as we wanted to amend the itinerary to enable us to visit the Thai Burma Railway museum where we had arranged to meet Terry the manager who was trying to find details of my father in law who was a prisoner on the railway from 19421945  Moo had been made aware of this and so she made sure we had plenty of time at the museum as this was the most important part of the trip for us We did miss a couple of things off the itinerary (our choice) to facilitate what we wanted to do Moo‚Äôs manager even called her on the trip to make sure we were being accommodated as we had requested Moo was a very knowledgeable guide really friendly and helpful The trip was great and well worth the extra for a private trip Only criticism is that the lunch break was probably a bit long for us which would have allowed us to possibly see something else The train ride was good as was Hellfire Pass and walking across the bridge was also We got back to our hotel at 2030 so a very long day  Overall I would recommend this trip and Moo as a guide as we got everything we required from it

title: Best way to fool around in Bangkok~
review: I always take BTS to have fun in BangkokCause it's so convenient to get everywhere The position is way much better than MRT or Airport Rail Link It would be even more perfect if I could take BTS from Don Mueang Airport to the city area~

title: What's not to like?
review: Great service efficient beats the heat and the traffic  Strongly suggest purchasing a rail card day pass  you can buy single tickets but the lines are long  BTS is one of the best ways to travel in Bangkok particularly if you're headed fro Catuchak Market on the weekends

title: Best form of transport...
review: I love the BTS it's so easy and cheap and it takes you anywhere you want to go in Bangkok it's fast clean can get a bit full at peak hour traffic but definitely the way to travel

title: cheapest ,fastest way to travel within city
review: we loved it specially the cool aircon was a blessing after we were scorching in the sun  you could travel long distances at less than half prices of taxis  one of the best way to travel and safe

title: Quick and cheap
review: Quick and cheap Very easy to navigate even if you don't speak the language Air conditioned Not much seating

title: Great for getting around
review: We used this a lot on our visit It's easy to work out where you are going and really cheap too You can pay for a single journey  varies in distance or 140B for a day pass It's clean and well air conditioned

title: fast and easy
review: with the airport link to town then taxy to hotelfinal destination and the other way arround to go to Suvarnabhumi airport is the easiestfastest way in bangkok

title: Take the day train
review: The day train was an excellent way to see the landscape and culture of Thailand north It is a long trip but it seemed to go by fast because of the sights to see It was a pleasant and comfortable trip but beware that as the sun went down a few crawling insects come out I would take your own food with you to eat on the way as the food option was not really what we would have chosen

title: most convenient way to travel
review: It's cheap clean and get to places vey fast  Need to learn how to use ticket machine first you get coins from customer service and then look for the code of your destination press the code and will show the price insert coins and get your ticket

title: Nice and clean
review: After take many underground around the world I can tell that Bangkok underground known as BTS is one of the top 5 which is clean and nice one

title: modern
review: very good but cant buy a monthly ticket on credit card  need passport veru=y convient  all ok  used cash instead

title: Skytrain
review: Very handy I think all of their rail systems were good

title: clean and efficient
review: perhaps a great way to travel from one end to another and escape the traffic with announcements in english the travel sure was convenient

title: Airport rail link
review: Great to be able to go downtown directly from airport by public transport Cheap and efficient Connects to metro at Makassan

title: Very clean, cheap and fast.
review: The fastest way into downtown Bangkok  After each round trip the already spotless train is swept by a cleaning team in the airport station  Wheel chair friendly  About $150 one way

title: saves time but check if its actually working
review: The quickest way to get into the city from bangkok's suvarnabhumi airport is this airport rail link It starts from the level 1 of the airport gets you Phaya thai station where you can exchange to the BTS ( bangkok skytrain service) to come back to sukhumvit or move just about anywhere along the tourist tracks of bangkok It saves you the headache of the road traffic  which nearly takes 90 minutes to get to sukhumvit road"9 main street of bangkok) Theres only one annoying issue  sometimes this service is shut down and the hapless tourist is forced to use the airport shuttle bus or take a cab The ticket is fair similar to the airport shuttle but this service gets you into the city in 3045 mins

title: Too many breakdown recently - people stuck in hours. Expensive compares to other countries.
review: Too many breakdown recently Just last 2 days (2526 June) they experienced 2 breakdowns in the morning and people stuck in trains and at the stations It was very crowded and many people missed their schedule Also the price is very expensive compare to nearby countries 23 stations can cause you 40 Baht (~ 12 USD)  And also nowadays I think it's too crowded During rush hours sometime I had to wait  23 trains to passed by since I cannot get in the crowded trains until I can get myself in 4th train

title: Train ride on the death railway
review: It was a great experience riding with the locals non air conditioned coach Full blast of the wind on our faces on a rickety racketty ride was worth the 25 hr trip from Bangkok Mixed feelings of sadness and awe at the same time thinking of the lives that were lost building the tracks War is evilüòî

title: Cheap, easy, clean
review: We used the skytrain to get around BKK It was scenic  clean on time quick and affordable  (In comparison to the train system in Sydney)  A great way to get around Bangkok

title: A boon for Bangkok
review: The best and easiest way to get around Bangkok city The BTS or Sky Train as it is called is well connected through out the main city of Bangkok and some of its suburbs

title: Fast and cheap
review: Traffic can be a nightmare in BKK this is the best and cheapest transport tofrom the airport Tickets available at the station

title: Easy to use
review: The MRT is so easy to use There are maps showing the various stops This is an inexpensive and easy way to get around the city The train is safe and clean

title: BTS The most fun way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain is the fun and efficient way to get around town The train is always on time immaculately clean and perfectly maintained I was there October 2018 and my Thai friends have told me that in Dec 2018 they completed an extension of BTS line by 13 kilometers including 9 new stations That's exciting news Looking forward to returning soon

title: Why Extend Routes But Not Add More Carriages?
review: Along with the MRT subway routes the Skytrain has proved a huge boon to public transport in Bangkokespecially in the monsoon season Yet there is one huge problem In recent years the two original Skytrain routes have been extended to add many additional stations and new lines are now opening Yet very little has been done to solve overcrowding by adding addition railcars The Sukhumvit Line continues with just four The Silom Line sometimes has 5 sometimes 4 The result is packed trains even in the early afternoon and at some stations having to wait for several trains before being able to get on one during rush hours Why the management refuse to add additional cars when they are now desperately needed remains a total mystery I wonder if any of the management actually travels in rush hour to see what the public has to put up with

title: Efficient
review: This is one of the most efficient mode of transportation in Bangkok It interconnects with the MRT and airportlink And most of the tourist establishment are just around the stations  If you use the skytrain often I suggest you buy the one day pass (unli ride) and if you hate the long queues for the tickets you ought to buy the rabbit card
